loan.name: Ermetania

texts.en:
Ermetania P. is from the village of Poblacion, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Ermetania is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Ermetania owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing & other beauty services to local community members. Ermetania has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture, Ermetania is the one who is combing the hair of the customer and the other one is the customer.
In 2010, Ermetania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermetania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional materials needed for the service and as working capital. Ermetania is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ermetania from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loan.name: Pastor

texts.fr: M. M. a 64 ans et est mari une revendeuse. Il a 3 enfants en charge. Il fait la vente de documents biblique et a commenc cette activit en 1990. Il sapprovisionne lAlliance biblique et revend ensuite dans le march local dadawlato. Pour satisfaire plus de client, il demande un prt. Le monsieur est celui qui est habill en T-shirt blanc.
texts.en: Mr M. is 64 years old and married to a reseller. He has three children in his care. He sells bibles and religious books. He began this trade in 1990. He gets his supplies from the The Biblical Alliance and then resells the books at the local market in Adawlato. To meet the demand from more clients, he applies for a loan. Our client is the gentleman with the white T-shirt.

loan.use: To buy religious books

loan.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo D. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Amparo is married and has 3 adult children. Amparo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & biscuits in the local community. Amparo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.
In 2010, Amparo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amparo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Amparo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk foods

loan.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly forma parte del banco comunal El Altillo ubicado en la ciudad de Puerto Montt. Ella tiene una sociedad con un cuado en la venta de muebles, l los fabrica en un taller que tiene en su casa y ella sale a vender y maneja la administracin, desde hace 3 aos. Tienen aproximadamente 9 empresas como clientes fijos, ya que sus muebles son principalmente para oficinas. Tambin tienen clientes particulares. Con este prstamo comprar materiales y nuevas herramientas para mejorar la fabricacin de los muebles. Su sueo es tener una mueblera establecida. Vive con su marido y sus 4 hijos. Los 2 mayores son universitarios quienes trabajan y estudian, el de 16 aos tambin trabaja y estudia y el menor de 10 aos solo estudia. Para Magaly Fondo Esperanza le da la oportunidad de surgir en su negocio y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la regin de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronoma y especialmente la reputacin de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanas. Es tambin la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chilo, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
Magaly is a member of the community bank "El Altillo" which is located in the city of Puerto Montt. She has been in partnership with a brother-in-law selling furniture for three years. He makes the furniture in a shop he has in his home and she goes out to make sales and also handles the administration. They have about nine companies as regular clients as their furniture is primarily for offices. They also have private clients. With this loan she will purchase materials and tools to improve the manufacturing of the furniture. Her dream is to have an established furniture store.
Magaly lives with her husband and four children. The two oldest are university students who work and study. Her 16 year-old also works and studies and her youngest of 10 years only goes to school.
For Magaly Fondo Esperanza this is an opportunity to rise in her business and thus improve the quality of life for her family. Perto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. The attractions of Puerto Mott are its beautiful green countryside, its uncrowded beaches, its gastronomy and especially the reputation of its seafood and crafts. It is also the gateway to the Isla Grande de Chiloe, rich in tradition and legend.

loan.use: Purchase materials and tools.

loan.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a 36-year-old married man with two children, who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the hardware business for one year. He started with small-scale farming, saved money, and then started the hardware shop. His hardship is his low income, and his vision is becoming a wholesaler who is self employed and educating his children.
Modesto intends to use the loan to buy cement.

loan.use: To buy cement

loan.name: Agossou Kokou

texts.fr: M. Agossou a 39 ans et est mari. Il est pre de 2 enfants. Il est n Lom et exerce comme activit la vente de produits alimentaires. Il a commenc en 2006 et sapprovisionne au grand march de Lom. Il revend ensuite dans un magasin la devanture de sa maison. Il sollicite un prt pour acheter 10 cartons de boite de tomate et 10 bidons dhuiles.
texts.en: Mr Agossou, aged 39, is married and the father of two children. He was born in Lom and runs a grocery store. He began in 2006. He gets his supplies at the great market in Lom and then retails them in his store located at the front side of his house. He applies for a loan to buy 10 boxes of canned tomatoes and 10 cans of oil.

loan.use: To buy groceries

loan.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina C. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 65 years old. Cerelina is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Cerelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Cerelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Cerelina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and instant noodles. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cerelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loan.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and instant noodles

loan.name: Abbia

texts.en: Abbia is a 38-year-old married female with two children, who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been doing agriculture for the last 12 years. She started by renting a machine to make popcorn, but has now bought her own machine. Her hardship is lack of enough raw materials, plus thieves. Her vision is to expand her business and educate her children. Abbia needs the loan to buy popcorn to sell.

loan.use: Buying popcorn for resell.

loan.name: Gillena

texts.en: Gillena is a 28-year-old married female, with two children, who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a tailor for the last five years. She started with one sewing machine and now has three machines. Her hardship is high fees for her trading license, plus limited capital. Her vision is start a wholesale business and educate children, as well as to build a house. Gillena needs this loan to buy a sewing machine.

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine

loan.name: Anatalia

texts.en:

To make a living, Anatalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. loan.name: Engelina

texts.en:
Engelina T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old. Engelina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Engelina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs and chickens for sale. Engelina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Engelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Engelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Engelina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Engelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loan.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline A. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Jacqueline is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as snack foods, candies and biscuits in the local community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Jacqueline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jacqueline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loan.name: Juliet

texts.en:

To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a specialized retail store. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loan.name: Fiyaz's Group

texts.en:
Fiyaz resides with her family in a 2-room brick house in the city called Pakpattan. Pakpattan is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for past 30 years.
Her husbands name is M. A. S. and he operates a vegetable business at his home from where he sells fresh seasonal vegetables to customers from his community. He uses a room of his house for this purpose. He is well known for his customer relations and good quality vegetables.
Fiyaz is a housewife but when her husband is absent she also operates his business. She is the mother of one son who works in a factory and contributes to the household financially. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to put in his shop for sale. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years, and Fiyaz is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profit to his business.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable-sales business

loan.name: Reymon

texts.en:
Reymon D. R. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old. Reymon is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Reymon owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Reymond's wife sells fish like milkfish and sardines in the public market. Reymon has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2007, Reymon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reymon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Reymon is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Reymon from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loan.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loan.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet L. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Janet is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & ukay-ukay (used clothing) in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2005, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Janet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of used clothing. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Janet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loan.name: Bujuuta 'b' Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Gorreti B., 44, operates a beauty salon business in the Bujuuta B trading center in the Lugazi district. She mostly offers hair dressing services. Weekly, this business generates close to 100,000 shillings as profits. Prior to opening this business, Gorreti, who is happily married with four children, says she was more involved in farming.
This business has been in existence for 15 years, and to achieve this longevity, it has called for a lot of sacrifice, time, hard work and patience. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase a hair dryer.

loan.use: To purchase a hair dryer

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 20 years. Her husbands name is M. Y. and he operates an animal sales business. He purchases animals like goats from the animal market, raises them, and then sells them to people who require them, at a good profit.
In order to financially support her family, Hanifaan also does paid work. She packs different spices like black pepper, red-chilly powder, salt etc. on order and charges for her labor. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter who is young. Hanifaan couldnt provide them education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is involved in a potato-selling business. He buys potatoes from the vegetable market and sells to different vegetable shops to earn an income. He does this work to contribute to his family financially.
Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her sons business. With the loan, he will buy potatoes in bulk and increase his sales. Hanifaan is hopeful that through the loan investment her son will be able to take his business to more profitable position and make more income which will improve his familys financial condition.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loan.use: To buy potatoes for potato-selling business

loan.name: Phelelani Group

texts.en: Elpha is 65 years old and married with seven children aged between 19 and 35. She sells brooms, mats, hats, bags and baskets at pay points and also in Durban. In the photo above, she is standing in the center of her borrowing group. Elpha been engaged in her business for ten years and has two employees. She says that the main challenge to her business is the shortage of employees. She has many customers and sometimes loses them because of insufficient stock. In the future she hopes to have a formal place to sell her mats and make the business more sustainable in order to hire more staff. She has requested this loan through Kiva partner, Womens Development Businesses (WDB), to buy more dye, wool, mats and grass for her handicrafts, and also buttons for making bags. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her buy enough food for her family, and send her grandchildren to school, extend her house and send her last-born child to university. She also said that she appreciates WDB and Kiva for providing this opportunity she never thought she would see herself on the internet!

loan.use: To buy handicraft materials (dye, wool, mats, grass) and buttons for bags

loan.name: Shahnaz Bebal's Group

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Shahnaz has lived in Pakpattan, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives there in a two-roomed brick house in a combined family unit in the area of Shaheed Nagar. Shahnaz is a seamstress. In order to support her family financially, she stitches clothes for her neighboring customers. She has operated this business for many years and is well known in her community for the quality of her work. Her husband, B., is a loader by profession. He loads different items such as fruits, vegetables and construction materials (such as bricks and cement) on his donkey cart and delivers them to their destinations.
Shahnaz is the mother of three sons and two daughters. She only managed to provide education to her eldest son who is in 5th standard. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her brother-in-law who operates a fruit-selling business in the market. With the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk (to minimize the purchase cost) in order to fulfill customer orders on a timely basis. Shahnaz's brother-in-law has operated this business for 15 years and Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loan.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loan.name: Tasneem Mehram Ali's Group

texts.en:
Tasneem lives in Pakpattan, a small Pakistani city known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for over 30 years. Tasneem is 48 years old and married to M. A., who has a wheat-selling business. He has contacts with different farmers from whom he purchases wheat and then he resells the wheat at a good profit to different shops in the city. He has been engaged in this business for 20 years and has vast experience in this field.
Tasneem is a hardworking lady who operates a timber sales business to support her husband financially. As many people in her community dont have a gas connection in their house, they use timber for cooking. Tasneem is the mother of a son who works in an animal sales business and contributes to his family financially through his earnings. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy wheat in larger quantities to fulfill larger orders on time and to make more income. Tasneem is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client who always pays her installments on time and never misses a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Tasneem.

loan.use: To buy wheat for resale

loan.name: Ndiang Mbambodj Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de NDIANG MBAM. vient d'tre inaugur et de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF le 21 dcembre 2010. Il est compos de 48 femmes issues du mme groupement fminin et du mme village.
Madame AMINA S. debout en premier position partir de la droite sur la photo et mise en mdaillon est prsidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est ge de 51 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 07 enfants.
Elle est couturire de profession. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle exerce ce mtier. Elle est dtentrice d'un atelier de couture o elle confectionne des vtements.
Son nouveau financement lui permettra de mieux dvelopper son activit de couture et accroitre ses revenus financiers
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les besoins de la famille
texts.en:
The recently created Ndiang MbaM. Banc Villageois has just received its first financing from Caurie-MF on December 21, 2010. It is made up of 48 women who are all from the same group and the same village.
Mrs. Amina S., standing, at the far right of the photo, and shown in the inset, is President of the Banc Villageois. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. She is a seamstress by profession, an activity she has carried out for more than 10 years. She owns a workshop where she makes clothes. This new loan will allow her to expand the business and increase her revenue. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting the family's needs.

loan.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies

loan.name: Nezikokolima Kitega Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Salama N., 36, has been operating her tailoring business in Kitega-Lugazi for seven years now. Before this enterprise, this happily married mother of six was more preoccupied with farming as a means of subsistence.
Salama says she began this business with her own savings, unlike many of her contemporaries who rely on bank loans. Her niche in the market has been growing, and she attributes this to her good relationship skills and word of mouth. The determination and diligence she has personified has seen her make significant headway in her operations, especially as regards being able to sell her clothes beyond Lugazi.
Weekly, this business generates her 70,000 shillings, and she says with this loan, she is going to buy new textiles for making clothing.

loan.use: To purchase new clothing material

loan.name: Jennie America

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SUMAC SONCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Jennie Amrica; ella tiene 57 aos D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia es profesora cesante D. educacin primaria, ella trabajo aos para el estado y ahora esta dedicndose a su familia, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta y tiene todas las ganas D. seguir apoyando a sus hijos en especial a su hijo mayor que necesita para su maestra.
La socia solicita el prstamo para la pagar la maestra D. su hijo mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
She is Jennie America. She is 57, married, and has 2 children. She is an unemployed elementary teacher who worked for the state for years and is now dedicating herself to her family. Jennie is a very happy and enthusiastic person, and has every desire to continue supporting her children, especially her oldest child who needs money for a master's degree.
She is requesting this loan to pay for her oldest child's master's degree.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loan.use: to pay her oldest child's tuition.

loan.name: Noshad Liaqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Noshad is married to L. A. and lives in Pakpattan, Pakistan, a city famous for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for over 25 years. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from the animal market, raises them up and then sells them to customers. His customer base is butchers and he earns a good income by providing them with animals. He has been engaged in this business for ten years and is an expert in his field.
Noshad has a daughter and three sons. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education while the others stay at home. Noshad supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She learned this art at a young age and it is now paying off. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household responsibilities very well.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) and raise them up to sell at a good profit. He will also use some of the money to buy animal feed. Noshad is confident that after the loan investment her husbands business will grow further and make even more income than before. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Noshad.

loan.use: To buy animals and animal feed

loan.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SUMAC SONCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 57 aos D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. ropa ella viaja hasta la ciudad D. Lima para luego distribuirlo a sus amistades y familiares tambin trae D. all artefactos como licuadoras, cmaras fotograficas, planchas entre otros ms, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio y D. esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.
La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar ms mercadera para su negocio y para pagar sus pasajes hasta la ciudad D. Lima.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
She is Mrs. Gloria. She is 57, married, and has 2 children. She sells clothing and travels to the city of Lima in order to later distribute the clothing to her friends and family. She also brings back articles such as blenders, cameras, and irons, among other items. She has had this business for a long time and this is how she gets her family ahead.
She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business and to pay the fares for her trips to Lima.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loan.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business and to pay the fare for her trips to Lima.

loan.name: Paul Ngugi

texts.en:
Paul Ngugi N. is 47 years old and married to Esther Wairimu, who contributes to the family income.
He owns a passenger vehicle for his public transport business. He has been in the business for about 10 years with an income of KES. 30,000 per month.
This is his second loan from KADET Ltd. He successfully repaid the previous one. Someday, he hopes to own a bus to increase his profit margin and improve the living standard of his family.

loan.use: To service the vehicle

loan.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SUMAC SONCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella tiene 39 aos de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias, entre otros ms la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo con este negocio y le gusta ya que le trae muchas satisfacciones una de ellas es que puede estar ms tiempo con sus hijos sin necesidad de tener un horario, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar ms mercadera para su negocio y as poder tener ms variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
She is Mrs. Florentina. She is 39, married, and has 2 children. She sells beauty products such as creams, perfumes and cologne, among other items. She has had this business for some time now and she likes it because there are many good things about it. For one, she gets to spend more time with her children without having a schedule. She is a very happy person with a great desire to succeed.
Florentina is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loan.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

loan.name: Sarah Njeri

texts.en:
Sarah Njeri is a 46-year-old widowed lady. She has been growing tea for about 20 years with an income of 4,000 KES a month.
She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy farm inputs and fertilizer. She hopes to buy a car and improve her standard of living in the future.

loan.use: To buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loan.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SUMAC SONCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma Mara; ella tiene 57 aos de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azcar, leche entre otros productos ms la socia lleva aos con este su negocio el cual le est yendo muy bien y espera poder seguir asi, la socia mediante este negocio saca a su familia adelante ella es una buena persona alegre, optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.
La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar ms mercadera para su negocio para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Norma Maria belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank.
She is 57, married, and has 3 children. She has a grocery store where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar and milk, among other items. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. She hopes to be able to continue, as she uses this business to get her family ahead. She is a good, happy and optimistic person with a great desire to succeed.
She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to provide everything that her customers want.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loan.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to supply the needs of all of her customers.

loan.name: Sop Serigne Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SOP SERIGNE SALIOU est n depuis le 14 dcembre 2008. Il est compos de 15 femmes qui habitent le mme quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA
Madame OULEYMATOU S. droite de la photo, emmitoufle d'une charpe noir parseme de fleurettes vertes et bleues est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 54 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 04 autres qui lui sont confis par des proches.
Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle s'approvisionne au march central de Louga pour revendre dans son quartier.
Son nouveau crdit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bnfices.
Son objectif est d'agrandir son commerce et de renforcer son niveau d'pargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Saliou was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of 15 women, all living in the same neighborhood and knowing each other because they are neighbors. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Keur Seigne Barra.
Mrs Ouleymatou S., to the right on the picture and wearing a black scarf with green and blue flowers sewn all over it, chairs the group. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of six children. In addition, family members have entrusted four other children to her care.
She sells second-hand clothes. She gets her supplies at the central market in Louga and resells them in her neighborhood. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her inventory level and increase her earnings. Her objective is to expand her business and strengthen her savings level.

loan.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loan.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es transportista publico, tiene un taxi que funciona como Trufi inter-ciudad La Paz - El Alto. Tiene dos hijos de 2 y 7 aos de edad;, vive en su casa propia en la zona Tilata de la ciudad de El Alto. El crdito que solicita ser utilizado para la compra de un motor y una caja de transmisin para su movilidad y as continuar trabajando y cubrir la manutencin de su familia.
Es el tercer crdito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Gonzalo provides public transit in his taxi which functions as an inter-city minibus between La Paz and El Alto. He has two children ages two and seven. He lives in his own home in the Tilata neighborhood in the city of El Alto.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an engine and a gearbox for his vehicle so that he can continue working and support his family.
This is his third loan with field partner IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loan.use: Purchase an engine and a gearbox for his taxi.

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sisters grandchildren). She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.
Sarah has a retail business selling phones. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works seven days of the week. Sarah sells her products in a retail shop. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mobile phones, phone batteries, chargers and sim cards. Sarah's main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and to start selling wholesale only.

loan.use: To buy more mobile phones, phone batteries, chargers and sim cards

loan.name: Sudaj

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SUMAC SONCCO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Sudaj; el tiene 25 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes el vende diferentes productos entre ellos golosinas, productos de primera necesidad, fideos, aceite entre otros mas, el socio lleva un buen tiempo con este negocio a la vez el socio es gua de turismo pero por ahora no ejerce su carrera ya que le falta graduarse y mediante este trabajo est ahorrando para su graduacin.
El socio solicita el prstamo para implementar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes.
El socio est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank SUMAC SONCCO". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.
The member is Mr.Sudaj. He is 25 years old, lives with his partner and has one son. The member is dedicated to his grocery store business where he sells different products including sweets, convenience store items, noodles and oil among other things. The member brings experience to this business, at the same time the member is a tourist guide, but for now he isn't using his career because he still needs to graduate. In the mean time he is working and saving for his graduation.
The member is requesting the loan to begin his grocery store business.
The member is happy because of the loan and he promises to complete his payments.

loan.use: The member requests the loan to begin his grocery store business.

loan.name: Jose

texts.es: Jos es transportista publico, tiene un taxi que trabaja como trufi con ruta fija La Paz El Alto. Est casado y tiene tres hijos de 18, 14 y 7 aos de edad; vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Kollasuyo de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposa es comerciante y tiene una tienda de abarrotes. El crdito que solicita ser usado para la compra de un motor y caja de cambios para su movilidad; de esta manera continuar trabajando normalmente. Es el tercer crdito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Jose is a public transport driver. He has a taxi and he works on an established route in La Paz - El Alto. He is married and he has three children, aged 18, 14, and 7. He lives in a house belonging to his in-laws in the community of Kollasuyo in the city of La Paz. His wife is a merchant who has a grocery store.
The loan requested will be used to purchase an engine and a cash register for his car. This way he will be able to keep working normally.
This is his third loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and the first through Kiva.

loan.use: To purchase an engine and a cash register.

loan.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Toms vive en casa propia en la zona Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, el seor es comerciante, y su esposa tambin es comerciante con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. El crdito ser utilizado para compra de materiales como arena, cemento, ladrillos, para la construccin de dos habitaciones.
Por su estudio socio econmico califica para obtener un nuevo crdito.
texts.en:
Tomas lives in his own home in the community of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has three young children. He is a merchant, as his wife is a merchant also, and with both incomes they are able to support themselves.
This loan will be used to purchase materials such as sand, cement, and bricks to build two bedrooms.
His socio-economic analysis qualifies him for a new loan.

loan.use: To purchase bricks, cements, and sand to build two bedrooms.

loan.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has seven children, three of whom attend school. Deborah has a pub business, which she has been doing for over 10 years. She works seven days a week. Deborah sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.
The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and seasonality challenges. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house and to start selling wholesale only. Deborah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loan.use: To purchase more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin

loan.name: Sirley

texts.es:
Sirley vive en casa de su padre en la zona Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, la seora atiende una librera de barrio, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. El crdito ser utilizado para la construccin, cementado de patio en su vivienda.
Por su estudio socio econmico califica para obtener un nuevo crdito.
texts.en:
Sirley lives in a house belonging to his father, located in the community of Llojeta in the city of La Pas. She is married and she has two young children. She has a bookstore in her neighborhood and she is able to support her family with this income.
The loan will be used for the construction and cement flooring for a patio in their home.
Her socio-economic analysis qualifies her for a new loan.

loan.use: To build a patio in her home.

loan.name: Wcsl Pri Kapethe Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Sierra Leone, is pleased to present the teachers of the WCSL Primary School in Kapethe, a village in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1973 by the Weslyan Mission to educate the children of Kapethe village and neighboring villages. The school is currently staffed with 10 teachers and has an enrollment of 225 pupils. This is not the first loan that teachers of this institution have borrowed from Kiva lenders
Jonathan L. J. (pictured in the back row, second from left) is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group. His is 43 years old and was born in the village of Gerihun. Jonathan is married has six children, all of whom attend school. He has been in the teaching profession for 30 years. Jonathan is requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children.
School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMTs operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their salaries alone. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institutions bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loan.use: To pay school fees for his children

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase a chromate cobalt dental appliance..

loan.name: Maxima

texts.es: La seora Mxima es soltera y tiene un hijo, vive en casa de sus hermanos ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. La cliente cuenta con una tienda en la cual vende ropa para mayores y nios, en una zona comercial de La Paz. El crdito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadera y as tener productos surtidos en la tienda y poder mejorar sus ventas. Es as como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar. Es su primer crdito y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito.
texts.en:
Maxima is single and she has a son. She has lived in a house belonging to her siblings for a long time. The house is located in the community of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.
She has a store from where she sells clothing for adults and children, located in a commercial region in La Paz.
The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in order to have a variety of products for her store and to perceive better sales. This is how she earns an income for her household.
This is her first loan and her socio-economic analysis is positive and she is eligible to access a loan.

loan.use: To purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loan.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El seor Ramiro es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente trabaja manejando maquinaria pesada (un montacargas) en una empresa de construccin, de la cual el dueo es su primo; Ramiro tambin se encarga aparte de los contratos de trabajo de la empresa. El crdito lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora para su casa. Es as como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar. Es su primer crdito y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito.
texts.en:
Ramiro is single and he has no children. He has lived with his parents for a long time. The house is located in the community of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.
He drives heavy machinery (a front-end loader) for a construction company, of which his cousin is the owner. Ramiro is also responsible for the company's work contracts.
The loan will be used to purchase a computer for home. This is how he earns an income for their household.
This is his first loan and his socio-economic analysis is positive and he is eligible to access a loan.

loan.use: To purchase a computer for his children.

loan.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SOP SERIGNE BABACAR est cr le 15 dcembre 2008. Il est compos de 15 femmes du mme quartier et qui ont des liens d'amiti et de parent. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA
Madame MAME LAT F. M. debout l'extrme droite de la photo, les bras croiss est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 32 ans. Elle est marie et mre d'un garon de 02 ans.
Elle fait du commerce. Elle achte des tissus, des chaussures et d'autres articles destins la vente. Elle est trs exprimente dans ce domaine d'activit pour l'avoir mene depuis plusieurs annes
Son nouveau crdit lui permettra de renforcer ses activits et d'accroitre ses bnfices
Son objectif est de renforcer son activit et son niveau d'pargne
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE BABACAR was created on December 15, 2008. It is comprised of fifteen women from the same area who are tied by friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois ofKeur Serigne Barra.
Ms. MAME LAT F. M., standing on the far right in the photo with her arms crossed, is the groups leader . She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two boys. She works in commerce. She buys fabrics, shoes, and other goods for resale purposes. She is highly experienced in this business domain for having worked at it for several years.
Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business and to increase her profits. Her goal is to improve her work and her savings.

loan.use: Buying shoes, fabrics, and a variety of goods

loan.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat comes from Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for over 5 years. She is a working lady and is involved in making artificial flowers. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She takes orders from different gift shops and supplies them with finished goods to earn a good income for her family.
Her husbands name is M. I. and he operates a grocery shop in the market. His shop is located in the busiest market where he deals with a good number of customers every day. Eshrat is the mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are illiterate and stay at home. Eshrat couldnt provide them with education due to poor financial conditions.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his shop to increase his sales. Eshrat is hopeful that after putting more stock in his shop, her husband will be able to offer a greater variety of products to his customers and make more income which will result in a better standard of living for her family.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Eshrat.

loan.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loan.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). Justine has a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Justine sells her products in a shop, retail.
Justine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through frying "chapats" and "samosas".The main business challenges for Justine include transportation and seasonality challenges. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a supermarket.
Justine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family

loan.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil

loan.name: Seydina Mouhamad Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SEYDINA MOUHAMAD est n le 14 dcembre 2008. Toutes le femmes qui composent le groupe sont du mme quartier. Elles ont form leur groupe par voisinage et par des liens d'amiti et de parent. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA
Madame MBARK. F. debout l'extrme droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 46 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 03 enfants en charge.
Elle de l'embouche bovine. Elle achte des sujets frles qu'elle engraisse pour revendre au bout de 4 5 mois Paralllement elle fait du petit commerce
Avec son prt elle va renforcer ses activit afin de raliser plus de bnfices
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Seydina Mouhamad solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of women who are all from the same area, and who came together as neighbors and through ties of kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois KEUR SERIGNE BARRA.
Mrs. MBARK. F., standing on the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are still in her care.
Her activity is cattle fattening. She buys frail animals, which she fattens and resells after four to five months. As a sideline, she is also engaged in small trade.
With her loan, she will strengthen her business in order to increase her profits. Her goal is to assist her husband in providing for their family.

loan.use: To buy oxen

loan.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 aos, vive con su esposo y una de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 aos se dedica a la costura de mandiles para amas de casa, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su maquina de coser; desde entonces trabaja en el taller de costura que tiene en su misma casa. Por otro lado, su hermana le ayuda en la comercializacin de estos mandiles, llevndolos a distintos lugares y ciudades aledaas a su zona. Esta forma de realizar su negocio le ha trado buenas ganancias que recompensan las horas arduas de trabajo que realiza, es por eso que en adelante desea implementar con ms maquinas de coser y otras herramientas para su taller de costura. Es el sptimo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra de mas telas.
texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own home. For the past 10 years she has made aprons for housewives. Her main working tool is her sewing machine. She then she has worked in her sewing shop, located in her house.
Her sister helps her sale the aprons, taking them to various locations and distant cities in the region. She has managed to earn a good income, a reward for her arduous hours of work. In the future she hopes to purchase more sewing machines and other tools for her sewing shop. This is her seventh loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has the financial support. She has demonstrated responsibility with her payments and she also enjoys being a member of her communal bank. All of the other members are responsible and they are team players. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of more fabrics.

loan.use: To purchase fabrics.

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 12 children, eight of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (foster children).
Rebecca has a poultry farm. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rebecca sells her products from home, wholesale. Rebecca has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks, and boxes of soap and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Rebecca include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 chickens.
Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family .

loan.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks

loan.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her sons construction supply slaes business. With the loan, he will buy cement, bricks and sand, etc. and improves the sales of his business.
Khursheed is a widow. She lives with her 2 sons in a 3-room brick house in a city called Pakpattan, located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has had a very difficult life since the death of her husband and in raising her children alone. Now both of her sons have become young men and are doing their businesses. Khursheed spends most of her time at home and takes care of her household responsibilities.
She is very hopeful about the positive growth of her sons business. She wants to marry him off and hopes that an increased income will help her save some money for this purpose.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khursheed.

loan.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supply sales business

loan.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 33 years old, and she has three children. The youngest is five years old while the eldest is 9 years old. Leoncie sells children's second-hand clothes, and she is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothing to sell. With the profits she plans to buy a motorcycle.

loan.use: Buying second-hand children's clothes for resale

loan.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila tiene 55 aos, vive en compaa D. su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace ms D. 35 aos se dedica al comercio, en un inicio venda frutas, despus vio conveniente vender gelatina que ella misma prepara y cuya herramienta principal es su refrigeradora. Todos los das por las maanas sale a vender gelatina, caminando largos trayectos y ms en lugares muy transitados. Afirma que los das en donD. tiene mayores ventas es cuando es un da caluroso, ahora se encuentra en verano, tiempo que le favorece para vender ms. Se siente muy contenta y motivada D. ver que despus D. largas horas D. trabajo regresa a su casa este postre, lo cual hace ver que ha tenido buenas ventas. Por ahora desea mejorar su negocio con nuevos implementos para la preparacin D. gelatina. Es el octavo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, podr comprar ms ingredientes y envases descartables al por mayor.
texts.en: Bertila is 55 years old and she lives together with her husband and their 4 children in their own home. She has been a merchant for more than 35 years. She started out selling fruits but later she started selling gelatins that she maD. herself. Her main work tool is the refrigerator. Every day she sets out to sell her gelatins, walking long distances to reach the most visited areas. She makes the most sales on very hot days, and now that it is summer the weather is helping her to sell more. She is very happy and motivated to come home after long hours of work and to see that this dessert has yielded good sales. She wishes to improve her business with new implements to make her gelatins. This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments and she enjoys being a member of her communal bank. The other members are responsible team players. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan she requests will be used to purchase more ingredients and disposable containers in wholesale.

loan.use: To purchase ingredients and disposable containers.

loan.name: Venatie

texts.en: Venatie is 32 years old. She has three children, the youngest being 4 months old, while the eldest is 6 years old. Venatie, together with her husband, owns a driving school, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy another motorcycle for their driving school. Venanties husband works at their driving school, and they have been running this business for six years. She plans to buy a tailoring machine to open up a tailoring workshop.

loan.use: To buy another motorcycle for the driving school

loan.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has six children, all of whom are in school. Jane has a business selling bark cloth. She has been in this business for five years and works seven days a week. Jane retails her products at the market. Jane has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more supplies of bark cloth. Jane's main business challenges are competition and seasonality. Her goal for her business is to start going to Masaka villages for bark cloth. Jane lives in a home that she owns, where she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more supplies of bark cloth

loan.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema lives with her family in a small city of Pakistan called Pakpattan. She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it for the past four years.
She is a widow. Her husband died suddenly a few years ago. This was a very difficult time for her, but she recovered her sense and started a cloth-selling business to survive financially. Her clients are mainly people from her community who give her regular orders.
She has a son who runs a small grocery store adjacent to his home. He earns income through his shop, which offers daily-use items like cooking oils, rice, and spices to his customers.
Sheema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons business. With the loan, he will put more groceries in his grocery store and increase his sales by fulfilling the demands of his customers.
Sheema is confident that her son will get a better income from his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sheema.

loan.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loan.name: Solidario Vida Group

texts.es: Solidario Vida: Maria Julieta C. S. tiene 36 aos tiene 3 hijos los tres estan estudiando en una escuela del gobierno su negocio es de venta de ropa nueva lo inicio hace 4 aos ella tiene un local pequeo a la orilla de la callle en donde ella vive los vecinos ya la conocen y se hacercan desde muy temprano para comprar sus mercaderia, el prestamo que ella solicita es para comprar mas blusas, camisetas, y pantalones ya que en esta fecha la demanda de su mercaderia aumenta su sueo es expandirse y abrir un nuevo local en su municipio para obtener mejore ganacias y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El grupo vida esta integrado por dos seoras y un seor los tres se dedican a la venta de ropa nueva tienen su propio local y desean invertir mas en ropa, el sueo de ellos es crecer en su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para darles un mejor futuro a su hijos.
texts.en:
Vida (Life) Communal Bank
Maria Julieta C. S. is 36 years old. She has three children, and they attend a government school. Her business is selling new clothes. She started the business four years ago. She has a small place on the side of the street where she lives. Her neighbors now know her, and, starting very early, they come to buy her merchandise.
The loan she is requesting is to buy more blouses, t-shirts, and pants. The demand for her merchandise is now rising. Her dream is to expand and open a new place in her municipality. She wants to do this to get better earnings and to improve her childrens future.
The Vida group is comprised of two women and one man. The three of them sell new clothes, and they have their own places. They wish to invest more in clothes. Their dream is to see their businesses grow, to get greater income, and to give their children a better future.

loan.use: To buy clothes to sell

loan.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Farida has a retail business. She has been in business for less than one year, and she works seven days a week. Farida retails her products at the market. Farida has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She also generates additional income through a restaurant. The main business challenges for Farida include competition and transportation. Her goal for her business is to start selling wholesale only. Farida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap

loan.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a caring lady who operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes for neighboring customers and earns income. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer dresses easily. Her quality work helps her to attract many customers, and she receives regular orders every month.
She lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.
She is married to M. A., who is a painter by profession and paints houses and buildings on contract.
Sughran has two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a welder, while the others stay at home and dont do anything.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different shades, along with paintbrushes, which will help him to produce quality work and to maximize his profits.
Sughran is hopeful that an investment will be a good step towards the positive growth of her husbands business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loan.use: To buy paint boxes and paintbrushes for a painting business

loan.name: Seor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Hedibia es una de las 8 socias de la alcanca Comunal Seor Nazareno . Es casada y a sus 50 aos de edad tiene dos menores hijos dependientes de ella y de su conyugue. Se dedica a la venta de frutas, bebidas gaseosas y confitera aledaamente a la zona donde reside y como ambulante ofrece sus productos en lo peajes donde transitan muchos camiones de carga pesada que viajan al centro del pas. Esta actividad es emprendida desde nia pues los pobladores de la zona aprovechan la oportunidad de tener una zona transitada por muchos vehculos incluso para hacer turismo interno en nuestro pas como nos manifiesta Hedibia su finalidad es obtener ganancias de sus ventas para educar a sus hijos menores. Hasta ahora a logrado mejorar su vivienda y suea con ahorrar para comprar un auto y ponerlo a trabajar en transporte pblico de pasajeros. Podemos apreciar a 6 de los integrantes en plena reunin de desembolso, lamentablemente el acceso a su anexo de Corcona le dificult la llegada a tiempo de Rolando y Madeleyne por lo cual se estn publicando sus fotografas adjunta a la del grupo. Todos estn integrados en el sistema de Prosperidad y son personas responsables, orgullosas de sus negocios y quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hedibia is one of the 8 members of the Seor Nazareno" Communal Bank. She is married and at the age of 50 has two young children who depend on her and her husband. She sells fruit, pop and snacks on the streets around the zone where she lives. She offers her products at the toll gates where many heavy cargo trucks pass through on their way to the center of the country. She learned this business as a child, as the citizens of the area take advantage of the opportunities inherent in living in an area with a lot of traffic, including tourist traffic. Hedibia's goal is to make an income from her sales to educate her children.
In the photo, we can see 6 of the members in the payment meeting. Unfortunately, the difficulty in getting to Corcona meant that Rolando and Madeleyne were not able to arrive on time, so we are putting their photos next to the group. All of the members in the Prosperidad system are responsible people who are proud of their businesses and want to succeed.

loan.use: to purchase fruit, pop, snacks (peanuts, beans), and plantain chips.

loan.name: Marie

texts.en:
Pictured here is Marie K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Born in Makeni city about 56 years ago, Marie is married to a trader and the couple has one child.
Marie sells drinks and DVD players. She has been a businesswoman for seven years now. With a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone leones, she will expand her business by buying more drinks and DVD players to add to her current ones.

loan.use: Buy more drinks and DVD players to add to her current ones

loan.name: Touba Dabaye Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de TOUBA DABAYE est cr le 28 dcembre 2010. Il vient de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF. Il est compos de 36 femmes qui sont toutes issues du mme village. Elles sont unies par des liens de solidarit trs solides.
Madame PENDA N. debout tout fait droite de la photo est responsable du Banc Villageois. Elle est ge de 26 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d'une de ses nices.
Elle fait de la broderie de draps de lit. Elle maitrise bien cette activit pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs annes. En tant que paysanne elle fait aussi de l'agriculture.
Son premier prt avec CAURIE-MF lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des fournitures de broderie afin de pouvoir faire l'extension de son activit
Son objectif est de soutenir son mai dans la prise en charge de la famille, de participer au payement de la scolarit des enfants et de renforcer son pargne
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of TOUBA DABAYE was created on December 28, 2010.It has just received its first financing with CAURIE-MF and is comprised of 36 women from the same village. They are united by sturdy ties of solidarity.
Ms. PENDA N. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the leader of the Banc Villageois. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of four children to support. She also has one of her nieces in her care.
Ms. N. embroiders bed sheets. Having worked at it for several years, she is mastering this business nicely. As a peasant, she is a farmer as well. Her first loan with CAURIE-MF will enable her to buy cloth and some supplies for embroidery in order to expand her business.
Her goal is to support her husband in supporting the family, to help cover schooling costs, and to bolster her savings.

loan.use: Buying fabrics and supplies for embroidery

loan.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista K. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, two of whom are in school.
Teopista has a business of selling yellow and sweet bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Teopista sells her products at the market, by means of retail.
Teopista has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas. The main business challenges for Teopista include competition and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and to start buying from farmers directly.
Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, utility bills and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loan.name: Dora Glicet

texts.es:
Dora Clicet tiene 49 aos de edad tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada ella inicio su negocio hace 10 aos, con el apoyo econmico del esposo ya que en la colonia donde vive no vendan verduras ni productos de consumo diario, los cuales le generaron ganancias, obtuvo un crdito con el cual logro instalar una mini tienda obteniendo mas ganancias y pudo ampliar la tienda, adems vende comida (tamales y chuchitos) los fines de semana. En el negocio es ayudada por las hijas.
Ella solicita FAPE que la siga apoyando con un crdito para seguir adelante y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora Clicet is 49 years old, and she has six grown children. She is married. She started her business ten years ago with financial support from her husband. She started because no one in her neighborhood sold vegetables or daily consumption products, which generate income for her.
Using a loan that she got she managed to set up a mini store. With the increase in earnings she was able to expand the store and sell food (different types of tamales) on the week-ends. Her daughters help her with the business.
She asks that FAPE continue supporting her with a loan. She wants the loan in order to get ahead and be able to give her children a better future.

loan.use: To buy daily consumption food products

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, all of whom are in school.
Esther has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Esther sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through a canteen.
Esther has requested a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy more bags of charcoal and merchandise for her canteen. The main business challenges for Esther include competition and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale basis only and to buy a plot of land.
Esther lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and merchandise like sugar, salt and bread for her canteen

loan.name: Cheukh Khassane Aidara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit CHEUKH KHASSANE AIDARA est cr le 09 dcembre 2008. Il regroupe 16 femmes qui sont toutes du mme village. Elles sont pratiquement toutes lies par la parent. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUB. SERAS 2
Madame NDEYE F. debout l'extrme droit de la photo, emmitoufle d'une charpe orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 55 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui son confis par des proches.
Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activit depuis sont adhsion dans le Banc Villageois en 2008.
Son nouveau crdit lui permettra d'acheter des mouton qu'elle va engraisser pendant 05 mois pour le revendre au 06 mois afin de pouvoir rembourser.
Son objectif est de renforcer son activit et son pargne
texts.en:
The Cheukh Khassane Aidara solidarity group was created on December 9, 2008. It is composed of 16 women who are all from the same area. Almost all of them share bonds of kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of TOUB. SERAS 2.
Mrs. NDEYE F., standing on the far right of the photo and wrapped in an orange scarf, is the group leader. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She is also taking care of two other children entrusted to her by relatives.
Her business is cattle fattening. She has been engaged in this activity since she became a member of the Banc Villageois in 2008.
With her new loan, she will buy sheep which she will fatten over a period of five months for resale in the sixth month. This will allow her to repay the loan.
Her goal is to strengthen her business and increase her savings.

loan.use: To buy sheep

loan.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 55 aos, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a realizar bellos bordados, actividad que lo realiza desD. hace 41 aos, esta experiencia le ha servicio para ser mas productiva diseando nuevos modelos en sus bordados. Sus hijas la ayudan en esta tarea, siendo su casa, lugar que implement para que sea un taller artesanal. Lo que ms le agrada D. su trabajo es la tranquilidad que siente y las ganancias que le produce ya que esta labor a pesar D. durar un mes aproximadamente, por cada falda bordada y las aplicaciones que requiere como lentejillas e hilos dorados como plateados requiere D. mucha precisin e hilos D. muchos colores. Una vez que ha terminado D. producir, su clientela compra muy satisfecha porque conocen D. la calidad D. su trabajo, para el futuro Betty desea tener mayor produccin. Es el dcimo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra D. ms materiales para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Betty, age 55, lives with her husband and their five children in her own house. She has been making beautiful embroideries for 41 years. Her experience has maD. her more productive in designing new patterns in her embroideries. Her daughters help her with this work. Her house is where she established her handicraft workshop.
What pleases her most about her work is how peaceful she feels. She also likes the income it produces for her. She likes it even though it takes approximately a month of work to make one embroidered skirt and the required appliques like sequins and gold or silver threads. It requires much precision and many colors of thread. Once she has finished making the item, her customers are very satisfied with their purchase because they know the quality of her work.
