In the future Betty wishes to have greater production.
This is her tenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. She is pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive. She will use the requested loan to buy more materials for her embroidery.

loan.use: To buy different colors of thread

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. lives in the Kitawuluzi Lubaga road neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, none of whom are in school.
Maria has a business of selling phone usage and stationery. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Maria sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.
Maria has requested a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to more SIM packs, airtime, books, pens and reams of papers. She also generates additional income through selling raw food.
The main business challenges for Maria include competition and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.
Maria lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family

loan.use: To buy more SIM packs, airtime, books, pens and reams of papers

loan.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a wife of M. A. and resides in Pakpattan, which is a small city of Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for over 10 years.
Her husband is a painter by profession and paints walls and houses on contract. He makes contracts with different house owners and building owners and work for them on daily wages.
Fatima is a midwife by profession and offers her services on an as-needed basis.
She has given birth to a daughter and two sons. Her eldest son has a barbershop in the market, while the others are young and stay at home. Fatima couldnt provide them an education due to poor financial conditions.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different shades and paint brushes for expanding his painting business. The purchased items will make him able to fulfill the demands of the clients and to earn larger profits.
He has been doing this business for past 10 years and Fatima is confident that after the loan investment, her husbands business will grow further and make him even more income every month.
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding the Asasah Passbook is Fatima.

loan.use: To buy paint boxes and paint brushes for a painting business

loan.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 46 aos, vive con su hijo y su madre en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 ao vende cerveza, negocio que realiza desde su domicilio, es as que atiende a partir de la tarde hasta la noche. Siempre recibe la ayuda de su madre, ya que tiene buena acogida, es por ello que se esmera en brindar un trato amable a sus clientes. Es as que cada cierto tiempo se abastece de mercadera, eso favorece en las ganancias. Ahora su propsito es crecer su negocio e implementarla con ms productos. Es su sptimo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra de ms mercadera en cervezas y as podr incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 and lives with her child and mother in her own home. She has sold beer for one year from her home, working from the afternoon into the evening. Her mother always helps her, and the business is well-known. They take great care to offer good customer service, so every time that she stocks up on merchandise, she makes a better income.
She is now hoping to expand her business and stock it with more products. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always been responsible with her payments. Furthermore, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very united people.
Gloria thanks those of you who will lend toward her loan, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (beer), and thus be able to increase her working capital.

loan.use: to stock up on more beer

loan.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 26 aos, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Se dedica al comercio de juguetes y otros artculos de plstico, negocio que lo realiza desde hace 3 aos. Su esposo la ayuda en este negocio, l la ayuda a vender sus productos de manera ambulante todos los das, siendo los fines de semana que tiene mayores ventas. Por otro lado su madre la ayuda en el cuidado de su bebe mientras sale ella a vender. Durante este tiempo en el negocio, vio por conveniente que su negocio es muy rentable. Asimismo considera que los productos que vende son muy demandados por su localidad sobre todo en pocas navideas es por esta razn que desea en adelante tener una tienda bazar. Es su primer crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que la ayudara en el progreso de su negocio, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, podr comprar ms mercadera para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth is 26 and lives with her husband and child in her own home. She sells toys and other plastic items, a business which she has had for three years. Her husband helps her with the business. He helps her sell the products on the street every day, as on the weekends they make the best sales.
Her mother helps her by taking care of her baby while Ruth goes out to sell. The business is very profitable. Ruth says that the products that she sells are in great demand in her area, especially during the Christmas season. For this reason, she wants to have a general store in the future.
This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support that will help her with her business. Furthermore, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and united people. She thanks those people who will lend toward her loan, since it will be very helpful for her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.

loan.use: to purchase more toys and plastic items

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Develop and promote its activity of shopkeeping

loan.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es: la sra. Aida Esperanza L. R. tiene 66 aos de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo pupolar, tiene una pequea pulperia en esu casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica y tambien vende lacteos como ser queso, mantequilla y quesillo. este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos y esta ubicado en la calle principal del Barrio El Centro, es un lugar estrategico en El Municipio de Trojes ya que por aqu circulan muchas personas de diferentes aldeas y caseros. La Sra. Lpez es muy conocida en la zona por ser una mujer de buenas costumbres. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Aida Esperanza L. R. is 66 and sells common consumer products. She has a small convenience store in her home where she sells everything related to basic household items, as well as dairy products such as cheeses and butter. This business is her only source of income. It is located on the main street of the El Centro Neighbourhood. This is a strategic location in the Trojes municipality, since there is a lot of pedestrian activity from many different neighbourhoods. Mrs. L. is very well-known in the area as a woman of good character. She will use this loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her business.

loan.use: the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, ham, candles, matches, light bulbs, batteries, toilet paper, drinks, churros, candies, threads, oat cereal, pasta, sauces, cheese.

loan.name: Sonia Abigail

texts.es: Sonia B. es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos asisten a un colegio cercano a su casa, Sonia creo su negocio hace 2 aos vendiendo saldos de ropa usada, debido a que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y con el paso de los meses las ventas han generado ganancias y le han dado la oportunidad de comprar pacas (ropa americana) por mayor y ella las distribuye en los asentamientos cercanos al lugar donde ella vive, y esto ha generado mayor demanda en las ventas de ropa que ella necesita poder vender a todos sus acreedores pero para ello Sonia solicita un Prestamo a FAPE y Kiva para poder comprar 14 pacas mas ya que cada paca le cuesta Q. 1,000.00. El sueo mas grande de Sonia es ver a su familia unida siempre y a sus hijos con un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Sonia B. is married and has 4 children who attend a school near to her house. Sonia created her business 2 years ago, selling used clothing, since her husband was out of work. As the months passed, her sales generated an income and provided her with the opportunity to purchase pacas (American clothing) wholesale. She distributes it to neighbourhoods near to where she lives. This has generated greater demand than she can satisfy, so Sonia is requesting a loan from FAPE and Kiva in order to buy 14 more pacas, as each costs Q. 1,000.00. Her greatest dream is to see her family together forever, and for her children to have a better future.

loan.use: the purchase of clothing to sell

loan.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 55 aos, es viuda, y vive en compaa D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. productos bsicos para la comida, desD. hace 4 aos que posee una tienda en donD. ha logrado tener experiencia en el comercio, ya que desD. un inicio incursiono en esta actividad D. manera ambulante y distribuyendo sus productos a otras ciudades. En la actualidad su tienda se encuentra instalada en el interior D. su casa y en donD. sus hijos la ayudan en la atencin. Su establecimiento abastece con productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos que gustoso consumen en su establecimiento debido a al buena atencin que ofrece y esto hace que su negocio sea la preferida ante la competencia. Ante esto continuar esforzndose en incrementar el capital D. su negocio con ms productos. Es el octavo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra D. ms mercadera en productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old, a widow, and lives with her 5 children in her own home. Her business is selling essential food products. She has owned her store for four years and has gained a lot of experience in selling. When she was just starting out in the business, she used to make her sales as an traveling saleswoman, distributing her products to other cities.
Currently, Yolanda's store is located in her home and her children help her to serve in it. Her establishment supplies essential household products to her neighbors who happily buy from her thanks to the good customer service that she offers. This makes them favor her store over the competition. Yolanda will continue working hard to increase her business capital with more products.
This is Yolanda's eighth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments. Yolanda likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other. She would like to thank those people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business. She will invest the loan money in buying more merchandise, more essential household products.

loan.use: To buy more essential household products

loan.name: Sarwar Rasheed Tabbasum's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agricultural industry. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. Sarwar is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and be responsible for her household. In addition to being a housewife, she sews at home to supplement her familys income. Sarwar has done this work part time, but because she has gotten a very positive response from her customers, she has decided to dedicate herself to this work to full time since demand for her services is increasing.
Sarwar has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine to improve her product quality and speed. Sarwar is hopeful that investing in her business will help it grow and improve her profits. In this photo, Sarwar is the woman holding the Asasah passbook.

loan.use: to buy a sewing machine

loan.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: el sr. Juan Francisco G. F. tiene 47 aos de edad, su negocio siempre a sido la venta de lea, pero el ao pasado empezo a cultivar cafe y platanos y este negocio le estara dando los frutos para este ao, tambien vende lacteos. Juan es un sr. emprendedor y muy luchador, se a esforzado mucho para sacar adelante a su familia. nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que sus cultivos estan floreciendo y piensa que este ao tendra una produccion de cafe y platanos. el credito lo utilizara para siembra de cafe en una nueva parcela, tambien comprara lea y lacteos. Juan es una persona responsable y de buena conducta moral. su meta es poder hacer que crezca su pequea finca de cafe para tener buenas ganancias en un futuro.
texts.en: Juan Francisco G. F. is 47 years old. He has always worked selling firewood, but last year he started growing coffee and bananas, which he will be harvesting this year. He also sells dairy products. Juan is a motivated, diligent man who has worked hard to improve his family's lives. He told us that he's very happy that his plantings are flowering, and he thinks that this year he will be able to harvest coffee and bananas. He will use the loan to plant coffee on a new plot of land, as well as buying wood and dairy products. Juan is an upright, responsible person. His goal is to be able to expand his small coffee farm to have greater earnings in the future.

loan.use: Purchase firewood and dairy products

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a widow who takes care of five dependants. She sells kenkey (a fermented corn dish) and smoked fish at Elmina. Adjoa uses her income to provide for the well-being of her family. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to smoke and sell. Adjoa will reinvest the profits from her loan into expanding her business.

loan.use: to purchase fish

loan.name: Alba

texts.es: El solicitante es comerciante de la zona de Pilar, su negocio se halla situada en el Barrio San Antonio de esta ciudad, esta en el ramo ms de 15 aos, realizando la venta de mercaderas de primera necesidad asi como fideos, harinas, carnes, verduras, frutas y otros, la misma es casada, vive en casa familiar. Posee todas las comodidades necesarias para el bienestar de su casa, en dicho negocio se refleja que hay buenas ventas ventas, calidad de sus servicios, inmensas variedades de mercaderas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientelas. El cliente solicit el prstamo para comprar mercaderas como, fideos, harina, arroz, verduras, frutas, y otros, ya que se le present un lote a un buen precio.
texts.en: Alba J. has a business located in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Pilar. She's been in the business more than 15 years, selling staple goods such as noodles, flour, meats, vegetables, fruit, etc. She is married and lives with her family. She has everything she needs for her family's wellbeing. She has good sales, gives good service, and has a wide variety of merchandise to meet her customers' demands. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase products such as noodles, flour, rice, vegetables, fruit, and other items, since she has the opportunity to buy a lot at a good price.

loan.use: Purchase meat, flour, noodles, rice, vegetables, etc.

loan.name: Georgina Cudjoe Araba

texts.en:
Georgina Cudjoe Araba M. is married and has eight dependants. She has been through senior high school. Georgina fries doughnuts to sell at Elmina and her husband is a mason. Georgina uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills.
In this picture, Georgina is scooping flour mixture into oil to fry her doughnuts. She will use her loan to buy flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. In the future, Georgina plans to reinvest her profit.

loan.use: to buy flour and ingredients

loan.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 38 year old mother who lives in Cartago, Costa Rica with her husband and three children. A current university student, Viviana is a multi-talented entrepreneur who has tried her hand at various types of work to support her family. She is adept in the arts of piata making, card making, gift wrapping and seamstress work. Viviana is also passionate about childrens education and is studying to become a primary school principal. When her children were young, she was unable to attend classes. Now that they are older, Viviana takes care of her business from 6 am to 5 pm and then goes to class at night.
Viviana runs a family business selling school supplies such as binders, papers, pens, etc. She will use her loan to purchase a photocopier to offer photocopying services to her customers. Viviana is confident that this type of service will be very popular with the local students as it is not offered by any other stores in the area, and she expects to increase her revenue. The loan consultant who has been working with Viviana and her family over the years describes her as a hardworking and entrepreneurial person who has goals and plans. Viviana and her husband work as a team and make decisions together.
The main business obstacle Viviana faces is the slow rotation of inventory. To address this, she is beginning a publicity campaign and offering promotional deals to her customers. One of Vivianas long-term goals is to open an internet caf. This would increase revenue as well as provide the opportunity to create a job for one of her children or a community member.

loan.use: to purchase a photocopier

loan.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Nana Adjoa A. is married with seven dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. Nana sells cosmetics at Elmina and moves her wares from one area to another. Nana has attained a senior high school education and helps her husband to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use her loan to provide working capital to expand her cosmetics business. In the future, Nana hopes to use her profits to build a shop.

loan.use: to provide working capital

loan.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es: La joven Seora Cecilia Elizabeth U. C. es comerciante individual, se dedica a la venta de Ropa Americana clasificada, tiene mas de 2 aos de tener su negocio, pero fue hasta en el mes de Diciembre del ao pasado que estableci su negocio en un local, ya que antes lo realizaba de forma ambulante, su negocio iba creciendo rapido y se le hacia imposible mostrar la mercadera a sus clientes, entonces fue como decidio montar su negocio en un local y esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de El Paraso, calle principal de mayor afluencia comercial. el credito lo utilizara para comprar 2 fardos de ropa para surtir ms su negocio, desea tener un buen surtido en ropa de calidad y tambien mejorar los precios de venta. las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en: Cecilia Elizabeth U. C. has worked selling used American clothing for more than two years. She used to sell door-to-door, but in December of last year she set up a shop. Her business had grown rapidly and it had become impossible to display her merchandise for her customers. So she set up a shop in downtown El Paraso, on the main shopping street. She will use the loan to buy two bundles of clothing to stock her store. She would like to have a good supply of quality clothing and be able to raise her prices. She needs the income to help her son get ahead in the world.

loan.use: Purchase two bundles of used clothing

loan.name: Tasmeena

texts.en:
Tasmeena lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agricultural industry. She is a talented woman who makes wooden trays to sell to utensil shops. Handmade items are considered very important and Tasmeena is very skillful in applying her talent. One of Tasmeenas sons works on the Pakistan railway. Tasmeena was not able to provide for her sons education, which is why he works hard for a low wage.
Tasmeena is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He is a blacksmith who makes iron rods to earn a living. He runs a shop in the local market and is known as an expert in his field. He has been operating his business for the past 15 years and has a number of customers. He will use the loan to buy iron to fill his orders and increase his profits. Tasmeena is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her husband.

loan.use: to buy iron

loan.name: Yudi

texts.es: Yudy tiene 48 aos, vive en compaa D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 20 aos se dedica a la elaboracin D. bordados artesanales sobre prendas tpicas D. su zona, desD. entonces y en la comodidad D. su casa elabora D. manera muy tranquila los bordados. Este negocio le ha generado rentas muy provechosas, y ms cuando hay festividades generalmente suceD. durante los meses D. junio y Julio. Disfruta D. su trabajo, ya que lo considera como una distraccin, adems que pone en prctica su habilidad D. combinar bien los colores en los bordados. Es por ello que continuar desempeando esta actividad con miras a seguir progresando. Es su dcimo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en materiales que necesita para continuar elaborando bordados.
texts.en: Yudy is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. For 20 years she has been making embroidered pieces on garments typical of her area. In that time, she has been doing embroidery very peacefully in the comfort of her home. This business has generated a very profitable income, and more when there are festivities, usually during the months of June and July. She enjoys her work, because she considers it a hobby, and in addition she puts into practice her ability to combine colors well in her embroidery. That is why she will continue doing this activity for the purpose of continue to get ahead. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, because she has always been responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of her community bank, because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks those people who will be part of the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful for her business' progress. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase materials she needs to continue doing embroidery.

loan.use: Purchase thread and other materials to continue doing embroidery

loan.name: Adjoa Essoun Felicia

texts.en: Adjoa Essoun Felicia C. sells underwear, dresses, rice, soaps and other goods in Elmina. Adjoa has gone to a senior-high level of education. She is married and takes care of three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been in this trade for four years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dressses to increase the quantity of goods sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loan.use: Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dresses to increase the quantity of goods sold.

loan.name: Silvio

texts.es: Silvio tiene 42 aos, est casado y tiene 3 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace ms de 15 aos, se dedica a la fabricacin y venta de cuadros, espejos y botiquines, empez vendiendo primeramente mercaderas ajenas, apenas pudo contar con un pequeo ahorro pudo hacerse de capital y fabricar su propia mercadera, con la calidad aumentaba su margen de ganancias a sus productos, hoy da tiene clientela formada. Don Silvio agradece a fundacin paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo constante que les brinda para fortalecer su microempresa y a la vez espera recibir siempre tan valioso apoyo. El crdito que solicita es para la compra de madera, lminas y espejos en plancha.
texts.en: Silvio is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has been a business man for more than 15 years. He manufactures and sells frames, mirrors, and cabinets. He first began selling other people's merchandise. He barely had any savings. He was able to raise capital and manufacture his own merchandise; with its quality he increased his products' profit margin. He now has an established clientele. Mr. Silvio thanks the Fundacin Paraguaya and Kiva for their constant support, which strengthens his micro-enterprise, and likewise hopes to always receive such valuable support. The loan he is requesting is for purchasing wood, plates, and sheets of mirror.

loan.use: Purchase of wood, plates, and mirrors.

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa K. sells fruits in Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as capital to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a fruit shop.

loan.use: Her loan will serve as capital to buy more fruits to sell.

loan.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Y. sells a variety of things, some of which are jewelry, dresses and others. Aba has attained senior high level of education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been in this trade for four years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for resale. She anticipates building a shop to sell her goods.

loan.use: Her loan will be used to buy more goods for resale.

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. is married and has four children. Esi sells food items in Elmina, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children. Demand for other food items is increasing, and she is requesting the loan to purchase these items to expand her business. She plans to build a shop from the new profit.

loan.use: To purchase items to expand her business.

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She sells porridge and secondhand clothing in Elmina. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the family. The loan will be used to buy additional maize to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua plans to educate her children.

loan.use: The loan will be used to buy additional maize to prepare porridge for sale.

loan.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit MANKO est cr le 28 juin 2010. Il est compos de 19 femmes qui sont toutes du mme quartier. C'est un groupe trs dynamique et solidaire. Leurs activits dominantes sont le petit commerce et l'levage.
Madame YAYE RAMA B., l'extrme droit sur la photo, enroule d'un pagne jaune est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 51 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 08 enfants. Elle s'occupe galement de sa petite fille.
Elle fait du petit commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne en savon, encens, pagnes tisss etc pour revendre dans son village.
Son prt lui permettra de mieux dvelopper son activit afin d'escompter des bnfices plus importants.
Son objectif est de renforcer son pargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la sant, la scolarit et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Manko solidarity group was created on June 28, 2010. It is composed of 19 women, all living in the same neighborhood. This is a very dynamic and united group. Their main business activities is retail and raising livestock.
Mrs. Yaye Rama B., on the far right in the photo, wrapped in a yellow outfit, is the groups leader. She is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of eight. She also takes care of her granddaughter.
She has been working as a small retailer for ove 10 years. She stocks up on soap, incense, traditional pagnes fabrics etc., in order to resell these wares in her village. This loan will allow her to grow her business and to increase her income. Her goal is to boost her savings and to help her husband provide for the family needs, such as the costs of healthcare, schooling and food.

loan.use: Grown and promote her small business

loan.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem M. A. is 45 years old, married to M. A., and has given birth to three children. They all left school and started to work in their teenage years to help financially support the family. The family lives in Kasur, which is a small city within Punjab, Pakistan. It is famous for its leather industry.

Milk sales have become the family's business since most of the members are involved in it. Naseems husband has some buffaloes at home that he milks early in the morning and then sells the milk to his neighboring clients. He has run his dairy for the past twenty years. Naseems eldest son sells buffalo milk, her middle child works in the fields and grows different crops, while her youngest son also sells milk.

Naseem works at home doing embroidery and stitchery work. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and is paid after completing the orders.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kivas partner Asasah to further expand her husbands milk business. She is a regular borrower from Asasah; this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

With the loan, Naseem will buy another buffalo to increase their dairys output of milk and to serve many more clients. She is hopeful that such an investment will improve her familys business to a great extent.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo

loan.name: Jappo Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit JAPPO LIGGUEYE est cr le 09 dcembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois? Il est compos de 16 femmes qui sont toutes issues du mme quartier. Elles se sont noues par des liens d'amiti et ont comme dnominateur commun le culte du travail. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUBA SERAS 2
Madame SEYNABOU N. debout droite de la photo, vtue de grand boubou orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 42 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la garde d'un enfant qui lui est confi par des proches.
Elle est leveuse. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achte des moutons qu'elle engraisse pendant 5 6 mois pour les revendre dans le march ou dans son quartier
Avec son nouveau crdit elle pourra au moins acheter deux moutons qu'elle va emboucher
Son objectif est de subvenir ses besoins personnels, de renforcer son pargne et son activit
texts.en:
The Jappo Liggueye solidarity group was created on December 9, 2008 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Touba Seras 2, to which it belongs. The group is composed of 16 women from the same neighborhood. They share ties of friendship, and are also bound by the cult of work.
Mrs. Seynabou N., standing at the right of the photo and wearing a large orange robe, is the head of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are still in her care. She also has custody of another child entrusted to her by relatives.
She is a cattle breeder who practices sheep fattening. She buys sheep to fatten over a period of five to six months for resale at the market or in her neighborhood.
She will use her new loan to buy at least two sheep for fattening. Her goal is to be able to support herself, strengthen her business, and bolster her savings.

loan.use: Buying a ram

loan.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El Sr. Rosendo es un hombre que trabajo desde sus 24 aos de edad en rubro de transporte actividad donde le va muy bien, en la actualidad el Sr. Rosendo tiene 46 aos de edad, casado con la seora Gipsi que se dedica a labores del hogar, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando vive en casa familiar ubicado en el barrio Oriental zona norte de la ciudad de Santa Don Rosendo utilizara el dinero del crdito para ya que el tiene un buen historial crediticio El cliente manifest su agradecimiento por la rapidez del crdito y lo bien que lo atendieron el la Institucin.
texts.en:
Mr. Rosendo is a man who has worked in transportation since the age of 24. It is going very well. He is now 46 and married to Gipsi, who does the housework. They have 2 children who are in school. They live in the family home in the Oriental neighbourhood in the north of the city of Santa Don Rosendo.
He has a good credit history. He is grateful for how quickly he was approved and for the good service in the Institution.

loan.use: maintenance for his vehicle (auto body repair)

loan.name: El Rubi Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Rubi lo integran 3 mujeres, todas muy unidas y estan ubicadas en el Barrio las Flores de la ciudad de El Paraiso, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la sra. Mayra Yolanda Z. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de tajaditas de pltano, tiene mucha experiencia en fabricar tajaditas de platano fritas.. Doa Mayra es una mujer que a sabido ganarse a su clientela, por el buen sabor, la cantidad por porcin y los precios que ella ofrece, adems de la venta de tajaditas de pltano tambin se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y sus derivados, esta actividad la realiza solamente los das sbados de cada semana. Mayra utilizara el credito para la compra de platanos, aceite y sal.
la sra. Maria Rosario N. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas. Doa Maria es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad que realiza, ya que las golosinas que vende son de muy buen sabor, cuenta con una gran clientela. adems de los ingresos que percibe en su negocio cuenta con ayuda econmica por parte de su esposo ya que el le enva remesas desde los Estados Unidos por lo que es notable que sus condiciones de vida son muy favorables. Pero esto no le quita el entusiasmo de trabajar. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus golosinas.
La sra. Deysi Judith O. C. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la elaboracin y venta de pan y rosquillas. Durante todo este tiempo Deysi a perfeccionado su tcnica para la elaboracin de rosquillas y pan logrando obtener muy buen sabor en su producto, tiene una gran clientela ya que su producto tiene gran demanda, ofrece precios bajos a los mayoristas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima y continuar elaborando su producto y cubriendo la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rubi group is made up of three women who are very close to each other and live in the neighborhood of Las Flores in the city of El Paraso. Below is more information about the different work that they do.
Mayra Yolanda Z. is a merchant who sells sliced bananas. She has a lot of experience making fried sliced bananas. Doa Mayra won over customers with good flavors, good portion sizes, and good prices. In addition to selling sliced bananas, she also sells pork on Saturdays. Mayra will use this loan to purchase bananas, oil, and salt.
Maria Rosario N. is a merchant who sells sweets. She is well known in her community for her work. The sweets she sells are tasty, so she has a lot of customers. In addition to the income she earns from her business, her husband sends money every month from the United States, so her living conditions are good. However, she is still eager to work. She will use this loan to purchase materials to make her sweets.
Deysi Judith O. C. is a merchant who makes and sells bread and pastries. Deysi has been perfecting her bread and pastry making technique for a long time to create a good tasting product. She has a lot of customers because there is a lot of demand for her products. She offers low prices to wholesalers. She will use this loan to purchase materials to make bread and pastries so that she can continue baking and meet the demands of her customers.

loan.use: Purchase cheese, butter, sugar, bananas, oil, salt, tortillas, vegetables, meat, potatoes and yucca

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es: Rosemary, tiene 41 aos de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales son menores, vive en la zona de Huaquillay, en el distrito de Comas. Hace cinco aos que integra el grupo Santa Rosa de Huaquillay, formado por 9 integrantes, quienes la eligieron como secretaria del grupo. Hace nueve aos Rosemary se dedica a la compostura de prendas, desde los 18 aos empez a confeccionar y decidi poner su negocio, gracias a su negocio ha logrado su estabilidad econmica, y apoya a su esposo en los gastos de alimentos. Su anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Con el prstamo solicitado lo invertir en stock de prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Rosemary is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three small children. She lives in Huaquillay, in the district of Comas. Five years ago she joined the group Santa Rosa de Huaquillay, whose 9 members elected her to be secretary of the group. For nine years Rosemary has earned a living by mending clothing. She started making clothes when she was 18 and decided to start her own business, which has offered her economic stability and enabled her to help her husband with food costs. Her greatest wish is for her children to have good careers. She will use the requested loan to purchase a stock of clothing.

loan.use: Invest in merchandise for her business

loan.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Las Tres Maras esta compuesto por tres integrantes todas mujeres, La representante es la Srta. Elvia realiza la venta de cosmticos, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres trabaja de lunes a sbado, es vendedora ambulante va a distintas instituciones a ofrecer sus productos es una persona muy amable y muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crdito comprara cosmticos por mayor que se encuentren en oferta, las otras dos componentes se dedican a la venta de accesorios para celulares en Cochabamba y sacaba ofrecen de lunes a sbado tienen varios clientes fijos , el prstamo lo invertirn para aumentar su mercadera para as variar sus productos, todas las socias estn agradecidas con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Las Tres Marias [The Three Marias] solidarity group is made up of three members, all women. The representative is Miss Elvia. She sells cosmetics. She is single, lives in her parents' home, and works from Monday to Saturday. She sells door to door, and goes to different locations to offer her products. She is a very likable and hard-working person.
She will use this loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics that are currently on sale. The other two members sell accessories for cell phones in Cochabamba Monday to Saturday. They have various fixed customers. They will use this loan to increase their merchandise in order to have varied stock. All of the members are grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loan.use: to purchase cosmetics wholesale

loan.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba F. is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman, while Aba is a fish monger in Elmina. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing and for the education of her children.

Aba will use her loan to purchase extra fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to buy some land.

loan.use: To purchase extra fish to smoke and sell

loan.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit est cr le 15 dcembre 2009. Il est compos de 20 femmes qui sont toutes issues du mme quartier. Elles ont longtemps volu ensemble au tour des activits gnratrices de revenus. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUB. SERAS 1
Madame ROKHAYA F. debout l'extrme droite de la photo avec un large sourire est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 51 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux enfants qui lui sont confis.
Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des fruits et des lgumes. En sus de cette activit elle compte vendre des beignets.
Son nouveau prt lui permettra de mieux dvelopper son activit de vente de fruits et lgumes et de beignets.
Son activit est de soutenir son mari dans la gestion familiale d'une part, et renforcer son niveau d'pargne d'autre part.
texts.en: The Sop Serigne Fallou solidarity group was created on December 15, 2009. It is composed of 20 women who all come from the same neighborhood. For some time they have created income-generating businesses together. The group is affiliated with the TOUB. SERAS 1 Banc Villageois. Mrs. Rokhaya F., standing at the far right of the photo with a broad smile, is the leader of the group. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She also provides for two children entrusted to her care. She has a small business selling fruits and vegetables. In addition to this business, she plans to sell beignets (a type of doughnut). Her new loan will enable her to expand her business selling fruits, vegetables and beignets. Her goals are to help her husband support the family and to increase her level of savings.

loan.use: Buy fruits and vegetables.

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 31 aos, vive al lado de su esposa Ada de 29 aos y su pequea hija en la casa de sus suegros, juntos luchan cada da para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 aos, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la venta de ropa, junto a su esposa. Esta muy satisfecho pues les va bien ya que compran la ropa a mayoristas de la ciudad y la llevan al lugar donde viven para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, as la venden a un poco ms del precio real y obtienen regulares ganancias. Paralelamente a esta actividad tambin se dedica a dictar charlas pastorales en su iglesia cristiana, por lo que recibe un sueldo regular que le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de mejorar la infraestructura de la casa donde vive pues aunque es de sus suegros, ya le cedieron una parte a su esposa; ya que quiere instalar ah un negocio. Es el segundo crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carlos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construccin, pues quiere empezar con la refaccin de su casa, para continuar vendiendo sus prendas de vestir sin problemas en la comodidad de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carlos, age 31, lives with his wife Ada, age 29, and their small daughter in the home of his parents-in-law. Together they fight to get ahead every day. For two years, this enterprising man has sold clothing with his wife. He is very satisfied, since it is going well for them. The buy the clothing from the city wholesalers and bring it to the area where they live in order to fill their customers' orders. This way, they sell it for a little more than the real price and obtain regular earnings. In addition to this activity, he also gives sermons in his Christian church, for which he receives a regular salary which allows him to offer his family a good quality of life. He has many plans for the future, such as improving the structure of their house--even though it is his in-laws' house, they gave part of it to him and his wife. He wants to open a business there. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his quotas punctually since he does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow him to continue working in the search of progress. Carlos plans to invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials, since he wants to start refurbishing his house in order to continue selling his garments without problems in the comfort of his own home.

loan.use: to purchase materials for finishing building his home.

loan.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nueva Generacion esta integrado por 3 mujeres las cuales viven en EL Matazano Jamastran, son mujeres que tienen tiempos de concerse y son muy amigas, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la sra. Reina Isabel Cceres se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y granos bsicos, tiene una pequea pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "ENID". lo atiende personalmente por lo tanto es bien administrado y se nota que lo a manejado muy bien dicho negocio esta ubicado entre la interseccin de las aldeas de la zona montaosa del valle de jamastran. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
la sra. Orfilia Escoto Lpez se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de productos agropecuarios, papelera y fotocopiado de todo tipo de documentos denominado Agropecuaria Matazano cuenta con mas de 2 aos de experiencia en este tipo de actividad comercial, nos comentaba que le a ido muy bien ya que se encuentra en una zona netamente agrcola y ganadera, lugares aptos para este tipo de negocio. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos agricolas, papeleria en general.
la sra. Yeny Lizzeth Cceres se dedica a la venta de cosmticos desde hace mas de 2 aos, durante ese tiempo le a ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos que percibe de las ventas apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares y a la vez no descuida sus oficios domsticos y a su familia.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Generacion ["New Generation"] group is made up of 3 women who live in El Matazano Jamastran. They have known each other for a long time and are good friends. The following is a description of their businesses:
Mrs. Reina Isabel C. sells common consumer products and basic grains. She has a small general store in her home. Her store operates under the name "Enid". She works in it herself, and it is clear that it is well-managed. Her business is located at the intersection of the neighbourhoods in the mountainous zone of the Valle de Jamastran. She will use her loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.
Mrs. Orfilia Escoto Lpez is a merchant. She mainly sells agricultural products and stationery, and provides photocopying for all types of documents. Her store is called Agropecuaria Matazano. She has more than 2 years' experience in this kind of business. She told us that it has gone very well for her since she is located in a strictly agricultural area, a prime location for this type of business. She will use her loan for the purchase of agricultural products and general stationery.
Mrs. Yeny Lizzeth Cceres has sold cosmetics for over 2 years, during which time things have gone very well for her, since she uses her income to help her husband with the household costs without having to ignore her domestic responsibilities and her family. She will use her loan for the purchase of cosmetics.

loan.use: the purchase of beans, rice, corn, sugar, coffee, cosmetics, general stationery and agricultural items

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Mara, de 55 aos vive en su casa que es propia en compaa de sus 2 hijos mayores, que trabajan y se mantienen, pero ella continua trabajando con mucho empeo para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 aos, esta emprendedora mujer tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles y productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda. Esta muy satisfecha con el negocio pues le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos, adems es tranquilo y lo desempea durante todos los das desde las 8 de la maana hasta las 10 de la noche, aunque obtiene regulares ganancias lo que no le gusta es que no puede salir muy a menudo pues no tiene con quien dejar el negocio. Dice que se entretiene mucho conversando con sus compradores y le gusta mantener abastecido su negocio. Como es una dama con muchos planes ya tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar ms las instalaciones de su tienda, para la comodidad de sus clientes. Es el cuarto crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mara tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de variedad de comestibles para surtir mejor su negocio y as continuar creciendo empresarialmente.
texts.en: Mara, age 55, lives in her own home with her two grown children who work and take care of themselves. She still works with a great desire to succeed. For five years, this enterprising woman has had a business selling food items and basic necessities in her home. She is very satisfied with her business, since it has allowed her to get her children ahead. Furthermore, it is calm and occupies her every day from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. Even though she does not make a regular income, what she doesn't like is that she can't go out very often since she doesn't have anyone to run the business for her. She says that she greatly enjoys talking with her customers and she likes to keep her business stocked. Since she is a woman with many plans, she is already planning on expanding her store more in the future, for the comfort of her customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises to pay her quotas punctually, since she does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. It will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Maria plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a variety of food products in order to better stock her business and this continue to grow as a business.

loan.use: to purchase a variety of products to stock her store.

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. sells maize, pineapple and utensils at Elmina. She is divorced and takes care of six dependants. Adjoa has been selling maize, utensils and pineapple for 10 years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependants.

loan.use: Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of utensils to sell.

loan.name: Sop Serigne Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SOP SERIGNE KHADIM est cr le 14 dcembre 2008. Il est compos de 09 femmes issues du mme quartier et partage le mme centre d'intrt qui est le dveloppement de leur terroir. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA EST.
Madame FATOU S. debout tout fait droit sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 44 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 05 autres enfants dont une orpheline.
Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend sur talage divers produits alimentaires tels des condiments de cuisine et des lgumes.
Son crdit lui permettra de renforcer et de dvelopper son petit commerce et aspirer une activt plus importante.
Son objectif est de participer l'amlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et renforcer son pargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigee Khadim solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. The group is made up of 9 women who are from the same neighborhood and who share the same interest - developping their region.
The group is part of the "Keur Serigne Louga Est" Banc Villageois. Mrs. Fatou S., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She is also responsible for another 5 children of whom one is an orphan. Fatou is a small-scale retailer. She displays and sells various food items such as condiments for cooking and vegetables. The loan will allow her to strengthen and develop her small business and aim for a increased level of activity. Her goal is to contribute to an improvement in her family's living conditions and to save more money.

loan.use: To develop and market a small business

loan.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has ten dependents. She makes and sells "Aboodo" in Elmina. "Aboodo" is the local name for a baked dish made from corn flour and sugar. It is wrapped in a green leaf before baking.
Maame has been in this business for ten years. Her husband is a fisherman. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase extra bags of maize to use in preparing Aboodo for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to educate her dependents.
The picture shows Maame removing the baked Aboodo.

loan.use: To purchase maize to make Aboodo

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. sells food items and maize in Elmina. She is a widow taking care of six dependents. She also sees to the general upkeep of the home.
Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her maize business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.
Adjoa is showing the maize she sells.

loan.use: To use as working capital

loan.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: la sra. Guadalupe del Carmen D. se dedica a la venta joyas de Oro de manera ambulante y es notable que durante este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio, con los ingresos que le a generado el mismo a logrado terminarles sus estudios a sus hijas, mismas que ahora todas son profesionales y graduadas de carreras universitarias con licenciaturas en pedagoga. ahora ya no tiene hijos a su cargo pero esto no a sido pretexto para no seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta hacer, ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la calidad y precios en que vende las joyas. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas como ser Cadenas, Esclavas, Anillos, Aritos, cadenas, pulseras y esclavas para dama y caballero.
texts.en: Mrs. Guadalupe del Carmen D. sells gold jewelry on the street. It is clear that she knows how to run her business; with her income, she has been able to see her daughters through to the end of their studies. They are now professionals and graduates with university degrees in teaching. She does not have children under her care anymore, but this has not been a reason to stop working in a business that she enjoys. Her customers prefer her for the quality and good prices she offers for jewelry. She will use this loan for the purchase of jewelry such as chains, bangles, rings, hoops and bracelets for men and women.

loan.use: the purchase of chains, bracelets, hoops, rings, bangles.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Mara, de 49 aos, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jos de 55 aos y de su pequea hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada da por salir adelante. Desde hace 1 ao, esta emprendedora mujer instal en su casa una tienda de venta de helados de una marca reconocida, ah vende con la ayuda de su pequea hija durante todo el da. Adems durante los fines de semana vende cervezas y llega a comercializar por pedido a las propias casas de sus clientes, con este negocio obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Dice que le gusta mucho trabajar pues se entretiene bastante y no descuida las labores de su hogar, adems tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar su negocio para aumentar sus ganancias, y as espera salir adelante. Es el primer crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mara tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de helados, y tambin varias cajas de cervezas pues necesita abastecerse para el verano, ya que estos productos tienen bastante salida.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jose who is 55 years old and their young daughter. Together they work hard every day to get ahead. A year ago, this enterprising woman set up a shop in her home selling a well known ice cream. She sells all day with the help of her young daughter. On the weekends she also sells beer and she takes orders and delivers to her customer's homes. With this business she regularly obtains profits and is able to help her husband with the household expenses to provide her family a good quality of life. She enjoys working because it is entertaining and because she does not neglect her household work. She has many plans for the future such as expanding her business to increase her profits so she can get ahead. This is the first loan she has obtained from field partner MFP and she promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to look bad with the people that made this contribution, which will allow her to continue working in search of progress, possible. Maria plans on investing this loan in purchasing ice cream and several boxes of beer since she needs to stock her store for the summer as these products sell a lot.

loan.use: Purchase ice cream and boxes of beer.

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells maize and pineapple in Elmina. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a carpenter.
Ekua has been selling maize and pineapple for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

loan.use: To buy maize

loan.name: Yaira Yulieth

texts.es:
la sra. Yaira Yulieth P. tiene dos aos de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboracin y venta de tortillas todos los dias y los das mircoles y sbados se dedica a la venta de nacatamales los que distribuye de manera ambulante, siendo las rutas de mayor rentabilidad las zonas cafetaleras. Doa Yaira a sabido ganarse la clientela ya que sus tortillas son grandes y sus tamales tienen buen sabor, este tipo de negocio es muy rentable para ella, ya que en donde reside es una aldea con bastante poblacin. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y los nacatamales.
Se observo que sus condiciones de vida son favorables y su esposo se dedica a la ganadera y la agricultura
texts.en:
Yaira Yulieth P. has been making and selling tortillas for two years. She works every day and on Wednesdays and Saturdays she sells nacatamales (a Honduran tamal) which she sells as a street vendor. The most profitable routes are the the areas where the coffee plantations are located.
Yaira has learned how to gain customers since her tortillas are big and her tamales have a lot of flavor. This type of business is very profitable for her since she lives in a neighborhood with a large population.
She will use this loan to purchase materials to make tortillas and nacatamales.
It was observed that her living conditions are favorable and her husband raises livestock and farms.

loan.use: Purchase corn, wood, water, chicken, pork, vegetables and banana leaves.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Menana Aba

texts.en:
Menana Aba R. is divorced and has five dependents. Menana bakes pie and fries groundnuts for sale in Elmina. She has been doing this for fifteen years. Menana uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of her dependents.
Menana will use the loan to purchase flour, groundnuts, and other ingredients to bake pies and fry groundnuts for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loan.use: To purchase flour, groundnut, and baking ingredients

loan.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. sells provisions such as rice, soaps, and others items in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in educating her children. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to increase her stock. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.
In Menas hand is a cup of rice. At her side also are soaps.

loan.use: To buy stock

loan.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita B. is married and has one child. Rita is a hair dresser in Elmina. She also sells hair products. Her husband sews for a living. Rita uses her income to assist her husband in feeding their family.
Rita will use the loan to purchase more hair products to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to build a salon. In this picture, Rita is showing some of the artificial hairs she sells.

loan.use: To purchase hair products

loan.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. cooks food such as rice, beans, and wakye for sale in Elmina. She is divorced and has seven dependents. She has been cooking food for sale for thirty years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a cafeteria.
Adjoa is dishing out some of the cooked rice.

loan.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook for sale

loan.name: Nana Tweba Margaret

texts.en: Nana Tweba Margaret K. is a widow taking care of four children. She sells bottles and bags of water in Elmina. She also sells ice cream. She has been in this trade for seven years. She also sees to the general well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more water and ingredients to make ice cream for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loan.use: To buy water and ingredients to make ice cream

loan.name: Ramona De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Ramona P. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboracin y venta de pan. actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace ms de tres aos. Se a sabido ganar sus clientes por su buen trato y la buena calidad, sabor y porcin de sus panes. gracias a su negocio este le permite percibir ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares, doa Ramona tiene una hija que reside y trabaja en los Estados Unidos, le apoya ecomicamente pero esto no le es ningn impedimento para dejar de trabajar ya que siempre a sido independiente ademas le permite mantenerse ocupada todos los dias.
texts.en: Ramona P. has been making and selling bread for more than three years. She has won over her customers by treating them well, by the quality and flavor of her bread and by its portions. Her business allows her to have income to cover the family's expenses. Ramona has a daughter that lives and works in the United States. Her daughter helps her economically but she does not think this is an impediment for her to stop working since she has always been independent. Her business also allows her to keep occupied every day.

loan.use: Purchase flour, cheese, lard, margarine, soft drinks, yeast, sugar and wood.

loan.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es: la sra. Petrona del Carmen L. se dedica a la elaboracion de rosquillas, tustacas y quesadillas actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacin con ayuda de sus hijas, su producto los distribuye en diferentes negocios de la ciudad de El Paraso Y Danl, sus rosquillas tienen una gran demanda son caracterizadas por su sabor y lo crujientes que son, esta es su principal fuente de ingresos que doa Petrona Posee. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las rosquillas, tustacas y quesadillas. Petrona es una mujer emprendedora y con espritu de superacin, a tenido que luchar sola para darle la crianza y educacin a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Petrona del Carmen L. makes rosquillas (a doughnut shaped cracker), tustacas (a type of corn cake with sugar) and quesadillas. She makes these in her home with the help of her daughters. She distributes her product to different businesses in the cities of El Paraiso and Danli. Her rosquillas are in high demand. They are characterized by their flavor and how crunchy they are. This is the main source of income for Petrona.
She will use this loan to buy materials to make her rosquillas, tustacas and quesadillas.
Petrona is an enterprising woman with a spirit to overcome difficulties. She has had to fight on her own to raise and educate her children.

loan.use: Purchase cheese, corn, wood, lard, brown sugar and cinnamon.

loan.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Y. sells goundnuts and maize at Elmina, in both in small and large quantities. She is divorced and has two children. Ama has been selling goundnuts and maize for thirty years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize and groundnuts for resale. She plans to buy some land with the profits. In the bowl in front of her is maize. She has yet to receive the groundnuts from her supplier.

loan.use: To buy extra bags of maize and groundnuts for resale.

loan.name: Efua Mensah

texts.en:
Efua mensah P. is a fishmonger. She also cooks food for sale at Elmina. She is married with five dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. She assists her husband in paying school fees and utility bills. She is asking for a loan to purchase food to cook for sale. She hopes to use the profits from her business to establish a food stall.
In this picture Efua is dishing out some of her prepared food.

loan.use: To purchase food to cook for sale.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Mara, de 41 aos, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jorge de 48 aos y de sus 2 hijos que son mayores y trabajan independientes; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 aos, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida (men) diaria, pues reparte estos platillos a sus 15 comensales fijos que son trabajadores de una empresa y le pagan semanalmente. Esta muy satisfecha pues la labor es tranquila, empieza a cocinar muy temprano, y luego alista sus taper para repartir la comida al medioda, as se la pasa de lunes a sbado y solo descansa los domingos. Dice que aunque no tiene hijos pequeos se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante ya que quiere terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer sus diversos platillos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el tercer crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mara tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, como arroz, aceite, menestras, huevos y azcar que necesita para continuar cocinando, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jorge who is 48 years old and their two adult children who work independently. Together they strive daily to get ahead. For two years, this hardworking woman has been selling food daily. She delivers meals to 15 regular diners that work at a company and they pay her weekly. She is very satisfied since her work is peaceful. She starts cooking very early and then gets her food ready in containers to distribute the food at noon. She does this Monday through Saturday and only rests on Sundays. Even though she does not have small children, she strives daily to get ahead because she wants to finish building her home made of noble materials. In the future she plans on setting up a restaurant where she can offer a variety of dishes and in this way she can improve her profits. This is the third loan she has obtained from field partner MFP and she promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to look bad to the people who made this contribution, which will allow her to continue working in search of progress, possible. Maria plans on investing the loan in purchasing wholesale ingredients such as rice, oil, beans, eggs and sugar which she needs to keep cooking. She hopes to improve her profits.

loan.use: Wholesale purchase of beans, rice and sugar.

loan.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 39 aos, vive al lado de su esposo Walter de 44 aos que es chofer y de sus 3 jvenes hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada da para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la elaboracin de trenzas, echas a base de material reciclable, con las cuales fabrican carteras que son exportadas a otros pases. Ella manifiesta que labora para una intermediaria que les trae el material, por el trenzado le pagan mensual, segn el volumen de la produccin, y esta bastante satisfecha pues le genera regulares ganancias en lo que se ha convertido una labor familiar, pues en el trenzado del plstico le ayuda su esposo, durante sus ratos libres, adems de sus hijos cuando estn de vacaciones del colegio. Como es un trabajo bastante tranquilo, pues mientras mayor tiempo le dediquen mejores sern las ganancias. Siente que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una librera en su vivienda, pues por la zona donde vive no hay competencia. Es el cuarto crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mercedes tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de material, pues quiere empezar a producir por su cuenta sin necesidad de intermediarios.
texts.en: Mercedes, age 39, lives together with her husband Walter, age 44, who is a driver, and their 3 young children. Together they work hard every day to get ahead. This enterprising woman works creating braided panels from recyclable material. The panels are then used to make handbags, which are exported to other countries. She reports that she works for an intermediary who delivers the material. She is paid monthly for the braids, according to her production volume. She is quite satisfied because this work generates regular earnings. She has made this work into a family effort, since her husband helps her weave the plastic during his free time, and her children also help when they are on vacation from school. It is not difficult work, and the more time they dedicate to it, the more they earn. She feels that it has helped her family get ahead, and in the future she plans to set up a bookstore in her home, because there is no competition in the area where she lives. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually, since she does not want to disappoint the people who made possible this funding which will permit her to continue working in search of progress. Mercedes plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying materials, because she wants to start producing on her own, without the need for intermediaries.

loan.use: Buying materials to make braided panels from recycled plastic

loan.name: Miriams Ildilcia

texts.es: Miriams Ildilicia C. Ochoa se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpera en su casa de habitacioon. Miriams atiende a sus clientes y administra muy bien su negocio, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y le a permitido salir adelante supliendo los gastos del hogar. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias. Han mejorado notablemente las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia, hizo unas remodelaciones en su casa de habitacion con las ganancias obtenidas anteriormente.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilicia C. Ochoa is a merchant, she has a grocery store in her home. Miriams servers her customers and administers her business well. Her business is her main source of income and it has allowed her to be successful in supplying for the household expenses.
She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business so that she can obtain more profits.
Her and her family's living conditions have notably improved. She remodeled her home with profits she had previously made.

loan.use: Purchase lard, oil, margarine, soaps, toilet paper and sanitary napkins.

loan.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Mara, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazn, tiene 38 aos de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. Ella como responsable del hogar mantiene en las mejoras condiciones el inventario de su tienda ya que de ella dependen sus hijos y logra cubrir los gastos familiares, por tal motivo solicita un prstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azcar, aceite y maz, con estos productos espera continuar con el inventario en buenas condiciones y ofrecer a los clientes calidad y variedad, complaciendo sus necesidades cotidianas. Su objetivo es mantener el negocio en buenas condiciones y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Mara lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazn. She is 38 years old, lives with her four children, and works managing a store with basic necessities.

As the person responsible for the household, she keeps her store inventory in the best conditions as her children depend on her. She is able to cover the family expenses and this is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, and corn. With these products, she hopes to continue to keep her inventory in good conditions and offer quality and variety to her customers, meeting their daily needs.

Her goal is to keep her business in good condition and to help her children with their education so that they can be successful.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise for the store

loan.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 38 aos de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazn, tiene un hijo con el viven solos alquilando vivienda, l se dedica a la venta de CD Y DVD de forma ambulante, este negocio le ayuda a mantener a su hijo y pagar los gastos del hogar. Actualmente est solicitando un prstamo para fortalecer el negocio comprando CD Y DVD para abastecer el negocio, con esta ayuda espera mantenerse competente y atender las demandas de los clientes. Su principal objetivo es darle a su hijo los estudios necesarios y proveer la alimentacin diaria.
texts.en:
Oscar is 38 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazn. He has a son and they live alone in a rented house. Oscar works selling CDs and DVDs by foot and this business helps him to support his son and pay the household expenses.

He is currently requesting a loan to strengthen his business by purchasing CDs and DVDs to stock it. With this support, he hopes to stay up-to-date and tend to the customers demands.

His main goal is to provide his son with the necessary education and provide food on a daily basis.

loan.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs

loan.name: Maira Elieth

texts.es: Maira Elieth L. se dedica a la elaboracin y venta de pan casero y los fines de semana elabora nacatamales actividad que viene realizando por mas de 5 aos su producto lo vende de forma ambulante en los diferentes negocios de la localidad. tiene clientes fijos que siempre le compran todo el ao. algunos vecinos comentan que Maira es una mujer de muy buena conducta y cumplida con los compromisos. con los ingresos que le genera este negocio apoya a su esposo con algunos gastos en el hogar y a logran salir adelante y suplir las necesidades bsicas de sus dos hijos. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion del pan y de los nacatamales.
texts.en:
Maira Elieth L. makes homemade bread and on the weekends she makes nacatamales [tamales wrapped in banana leaves]. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. She sells her products to various businesses in the area. She has permanent clients who buy from her all year. Several neighbors have commented that Maira is a good person and follows through on her obligations.
The income that this business generates helps her husband with some of the household expenses, helps them to get ahead, and also provides the basic necessities for their two children.
She will use the loan to buy ingredients for making her bread and tamales.

loan.use: To buy corn, cheese, shortening, margarine, yeast, baking soda, firewood, water, matches, pork and chicken, vegetables, and banana leaves

loan.name: Unidas Somos Ms (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas Somos Ms est formado por un grupo de 7 seoras y un seor, quienes trabajan en el campo realizando diferentes actividades para obtener el sustento diario de sus hogares. Viven en la comunidad de Nonadel en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, respirando un aire de tranquilidad fuera del ruido de la ciudad.
La Seora. Elsa S. es socia del banco comunal Unidas Somos Ms, vive en la comunidad de Nonadel. Este es su primer crdito y fue invitada por una vecina a formar parte del banco comunal. Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha el tiempo que pasa en su casa para criar animales como son pollos y borregos a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad econmica. Tambin labora 3 das a la semana lavando y arreglando casas. Doa Elsa tiene 35 aos, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 11, 9 aos de edad y su ultimo hijo de un mes de nacido, su primer hijo trabajar para sus gastos, su segunda y tercera hija pasan en la casa y sus dos ltimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albail y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. El dinero de su crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es mejorar su casa.
La Seora. Hilda B. es socia del banco comunal Unidas Somos Ms, vive por la comunidad de Deleg. Tiene 26 aos, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 7, 5 y 3 aos de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. Doa Hilda se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidando de sus nios, tambin cra pollos, inicio este negocio con su primer crdito y ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
