Este es el tercer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y al igual que los crditos anteriores lo va a invertir en la compra mas pollos y en su alimento. Su sueo es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Unidas Somos Ms [United We are More] communal bank is made up of a group of 7 women and one man. They work in the countryside in various business to earn a living for their households.
They live in the community of Nonadel, where one can admire nature in all of its splendor, breathing an air of tranquility far from the noise of the city.
Elsa S. is a member of the Unidas Somos Ms community bank. She lives in Nonadel. This is her first loan and she was invited to join the bank by a neighbor. She is a homemaker and she takes advantage of the time she spends at home to raise animals, such as chickens and goats, which she sells when she has economic need. She also works 3 days a week washing clothing and cleaning houses.
Elsa is 35 years old, married, and has 6 children who are 18, 16, 14, 11, and 9 years old, and one son who is one month old. Her first son works and pays his expenses. Her first and second daughters stay at home, and the last two children study in a school in the community. Her husband works as a mason and between the two of them they have managed to build their own house. She will use the loan to buy more chickens. Her goal is to improve her house.
Hilda B. is a member of the Unidas Somos Ms communal bank. She lives in the community of Deleg. She is 26 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 10, 7, 5, and 3 years old. Her first three children study in a community school. They dont have their own house, so they rent. Hilda is a homemaker and along with taking care of her children, she also raises chickens. She started this business with the first loan and it has been growing, bit by bit. This is the third loan she has taken through the communal bank. As with her previous loans, she will invest it in buying more chickens and chicken feed. Her dream is to have her own house.

loan.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loan.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: La Alcanca Unidos al Futuro est conformada por 8 personas muy unidas y trabajadoras Sabina es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo ella tiene 53 aos D. edad se dedica a su pequea bodega desD. hace 10 aos, en el cual venD. abarrotes como son: arroz azcar, fideos, aceite y algunos productos ms que sus clientes requieren para su consumo, tambin venD. pollo verduras y gaseosas. Ella tiene este negocio en su casa las paredes son D. material metlico (kiosco) por eso trabaja mucho para poder terminar D. construir su casa con la ayuda D. su esposo. Ella solicit el prstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar una vitrina para sus productos y ms mercadera (arroz, azcar, fideos, aceite) al por mayor ya que esto le permite ahorrar y tener un poco mas D. ganancias. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo logr mejorar el ambiente D. su negocio ya que antes solo era D. estera.
texts.en: La Alcanca Unidos al Futuro has eight members, all of them fast friends and very hardworking. Sabina is one of the members of the group. She is 53 years old and has had her small shop for 10 years, selling groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other products to meet her customers' needs. She also sells chicken, produce, and soft drinks. She runs the business out of her house. The walls are maD. of sheet metal, and she's working hard to be able to finish building her house with her husband's help. She requested this loan for EDAPROSPO to buy a display counter for her products and other goods (rice, sugar, noodles, oil) that she sells in bulk for a little extra income. With a lot of hard work she was able to improve her store, which used to be built of straw.

loan.use: Buy a display counter and merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, oil) for her store

loan.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doa Lucia, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulutn, vive con sus hijos y nietos su casa es propia y se dedica a vender varios productos como dulces, jabon, huevos, tiene 54 aos de edad. Su negocio tiene 3 aos de existir y junto a su hija lo administra, este negocio es la fortaleza con la que cuenta el hogar de Doa Lucia, por el momento est solicitando un prstamo para comprar ms mercadera y enriquecer el negocio, ya que los produstos que ofrece tienen buena demanda de parte de los clientes pues son cosas que siempre son necesarias en cada hogar, y aprovechara para aumentar las cantidades de mercaderia en negocio. Su propsito es estar siempre activa y mejorar las condiciones econmicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulutn with her children and grandchildren. Her house is her own and she is 54 years old. She works selling various items like sweets, soap, and eggs and has had the business for three years. She runs it together with her daughter and this business is the strength of Lucias home. Right now, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and improve the business as the products that she sells are in good demand by her customers because they are needed in every home. She will take advantage to increase the amount of merchandise at the store.

Her goal is to always be active and to improve the households financial situation.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise (soap, detergents, sweets, and other products)

loan.name: Isrrael Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "Israel" es un banco nuevo se encuentra en su primer ciclo son clientes que ya tienen experiencia en otras instituciones son D. la zona D. villa Israel todos viven en la misma zona y la institucin esta entrando con apertura D. bancos nuevos ellas sacaron el crdito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, la representante del grupo es la Sr. Mara se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, tiene una tienda donD. venD. solo abarrotes , ella esta separada D. su esposo tiene 2 hijos dedica a esta actividad ya hace muchos aos, es una persona muy trabajadora y con el dinero del crdito comprara mercadera por mayor D. arroz, azcar, aceite , etc. Todas las socias esta muy agradecidas con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Israel" is a new bank and it is in its first cycle. Its customers have had experience with other institutions. They are from the Villa Israel area and they all live in the same area. This institution is opening new banks. They have obtained this loan to increase their working capital. The representative of the group is Maria. She has a store where she only sells groceries. She has been in this business for many years. She is separated from her husband and has two children. She is a hardworking person and with the money from this loan she will buy merchandise wholesale such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. All of the members are very thankful to this institution for the support it has provided them.

loan.use: Wholesale purchase of groceries.

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 48 aos, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos mayores y su nieta; juntos se esfuerzan cada da para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la confeccin y venta de ropa. Recuerda cuando enseaba a sus hijos a coser, pues ella realizaba este oficio desde que eran pequeos, con el tiempo ellos crecieron y ahora el mayor de sus hijos confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Teresa ayuda a su hijo cuando puede, pero ms lo ayuda en la venta de las prendas que l confecciona. Es as que viaja constantemente al interior del pas y las ofrece a los mayoristas de las ciudades que le pagan muy bien por prenda. Le gusta mucho la labor pues apoya a su hijo, conoce lugares y se distrae, pero en el futuro tiene planeado instalar su tienda de venta de prendas de vestir que elabora su primognito, asimismo desea continuar vendiendo en las provincias del pas. Es el quinto crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Teresa tiene planeado invertir este crdito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela para producir buena cantidad de prendas de vestir para el verano, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por concretar.
texts.en: Teresa is 48 years old and lives in her own home, beside her two older children and her granddaughter. Together they struggle daily to get ahead. This enterprising woman makes and sells clothing. She remembers when she taught her children to sew, which she did from the time they were small. They grew up, and now her oldest child makes all types of garments. Teresa helps her son whenever she can, but is the most useful selling the garments he makes. For this reason, she travels constantly to other parts of the country, offering clothes to the cities wholesale merchants, who pay her well for each piece. She likes this work a lot, since she supports her son, sees different places, and enjoys herself, but in the future she plans to set up a store to sell the clothing made by her first-born. She would also like to continue selling in the provinces. This is the fifth loan she takes out with MFP, and she promises to make the payments punctually. She doesnt wish to leave a bad impression with those who have made this support possible, which support will enable her to continue to work towards her goals. Teresa plans to use the requested loan to purchase enough fabric to produce a large number of garments for summer, since she has several orders to fulfill.

loan.use: To buy fabric.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy merchandise: creams, lipsticks, blush, and other items

loan.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del Grupo Mujeres en Marcha, residen en la colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Danl y son mujeres que se conocen muy bien entre si, cada una posee su propio negocio en el cual tienen buena experiencia en la administracin de los mismos. En la actualidad las Sras. Antes mencionadas no cuentan con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas sus negocios y necesitan un credito para salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la sra. Rosa Elena R. se dedica a la elaboracin y venta de nacatamales y hamburguesas. Actividad que lleva a cabo los das jueves y viernes de todas las semanas, sus clientes son los empleados del aserradero en donde labora su esposo el cual esta ubicado en la ciudad de danl. Doa Rosa a sabido ganarse la clientela por la higiene, sabor y tamao con que elabora sus nacatamales y hamburguesas.
la sra. Eda Ventura C. Zelaya se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de cosmticos y enchape de Oro, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace tres aos y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, ya que la demanda del producto es muy buena y sus clientes da a da son mas. Doa Eda anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de pulpera y a la vez a la venta de Cosmticos y Enchape de oro, pero se vio obligada a quitar el negocio de pulpera porque las ventas cada da iban bajando, adems alquilaba local y casi no le dedicaba tiempo ya que era atendida por un familiar y mientras mas tiempo pasabas mas perdidas tenia. La Sra. Cceres, sale a vender su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes Barrios, Colonias y empleados de diferentes fbricas de tabacos. se a sabido ganar los clientes por la amabilidad con que les atiende y por facilidades de pago que les brinda.
la sra, Blanca Lidia G. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo. Doa Blanca es una mujer que se a sabido ganarse los clientes por las facilidades de pago y por el buen producto que vende. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres en Marcha group live in the Nueva Esperanza development in the city of Danli. They are women who know each other very well. Each one has her own business and has good experience in running it. These women do not currently have the sufficient working capital to stock their businesses more, and so they need a loan to get ahead. The following is a description of their different businesses:
Rosa Elena R. makes and sells nactamales and hamburgers on Thursdays and Fridays every week. Her customers are the employees of the sawmill where her husband works, which is located in Danli city. Rosa has gained customers for her food's cleanliness, flavour and portions.
Eda Ventura C. Zelaya is a merchant, and she mainly sells cosmetics and gold-plated jewelry. She has done this for three years, and it is notable that during this time she has managed it well because the demand for her products is very high and she has more customers every day. Eda previously had a grocery store on top of her cosmetics and jewelry business, but she had to leave her grocery store because the sales were getting lower every day. Furthermore, she was renting the store and had almost no time for it; it was attended by a family member, and the more time that passed the more losses she had. Mrs C. goes out to sell her product door-to-door in different neighbourhoods and developments, and to employees of different tobacco factories. She has gained customers because of her kind service and the easy payment options she offers.
Mrs. Blanca Lidia G. sells clothing and new shoes. Blanca is a woman who has gained customers because of the ease of payment she offers, and because of the quality of her product. She will use this loan for the purchase of clothing and shoes.

loan.use: the purchase of bread for hamburgers, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mustard, tomato sauce, ground beef, spices, condiments, salt, chicken, corn, banana leaves, vegetables, cosmetics and gold-plated jewelry, clothing and shoes.

loan.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es: Patricia, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 31 aos de edad, tiene una hija de 10 aos, posee un negocio de medicamentos naturales. Actualmente est solicitando un prstamo para la compra de mercadera, para el negocio, con esta ayuda estar fortaleciendo el inventario y podr dar salida a la demanda de los clientes. Su propsito es proveer del negocio los ingresos que necesita para cubrir todas sus necesidades, as tambin velar por el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en: Patricia lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department. She is 31 and has one 10-year-old daughter. She has a natural medicines business. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business. With this help, she will strengthen her inventory and supply her customers' demand. She plans to use her business to earn the necessary income to cover all of her needs and provide for her daughter's well-being.

loan.use: the purchase of natural products

loan.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 37 aos, vive en casa de sus padres, en compaa de ellos, de su pareja Freddy de 38 aos y de su pequea hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada da para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene varios oficios, pues durante 3 veces a la semana se dedica a la venta de limones en el puesto de su prima que esta ubicado en un populoso mercado de su zona. De ah obtiene ganancias semanales pues su pariente le paga por la labor desempeada, adems durante el resto de das de la semana apoya a su madre en la venta de gaseosas y cervezas en su casa, de ah obtiene algunas ganancias, y le gustan sus labores pues son tranquilas y no tiene mucha presin. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles, pero sabe que lo lograr con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacin en su trabajo. Es el segundo crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Karina tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas para apoyar a su madre, pues necesita surtir el negocio con cantidad de mercadera, pues durante el verano tienen bastante salida.
texts.en: Karina, age 37, lives in her parents' home with her parents, her partner Freddy (age 38) and her small daughter. Together, they work hard every day to get ahead. This enterprising woman has various jobs. Three times a week she sells lemons in her cousin's stall in a busy local market. From this job, she earns a weekly income, as her cousin pays her for her labour. During the rest of the week she helps her mother sell pop and beer in their home. She makes some money from this, and enjoys the work because it is calm and relatively pressure-free. Since she is an enterprising woman she plans to open a food store in the future, and she knows that she will achieve this with hard work and dedication to her work. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually since she does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. It will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Karina plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of beers and pop to support her mother, since they need to stock the business with some merchandise, as they have a lot of sales in the summer.

loan.use: to stock up on pop and beer.

loan.name: Carlota

texts.es: Doa Carlota D. 46 aos D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua, departamento D. Morazn, donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 24 y 22 aos D. edad los dos estn estudiando gracias al esfuerzo D. sus padres, ya que doa Carlota su esposo elaboran y venden loza (comales y ollas, este oficio lo aprendi cada uno D. sus padres, ya que esta zona D. Guatajiagua se caracteriza por la herencia en trabajar el barro y crear utensilios D. cocina. El negocio lo atienden todo el da, fabricando sus productos para tener disponibles al momento D. que los clientes les visiten y demanden algn producto; su inconveniente es la escases D. material ya que en momentos se termina y esto les dificulta continuar con la actividad. Esta situacin les ha llevado a solicitar un prstamo para la compra D. materiales como loza cruda, tres carretas D. lea, nacazcol, barro negro y pasaje para transportar la mercadera. Esta ayuda les dar fortaleza y podrn ellos continuar con la fabricacin D. ollas y comales, ya que en verano es la mejor poca para fabricar ya que el sol siempre esta fuerte, Sus sueos son con el negocio que sea prospero, que mantengan cantidades adecuadas D. inventario y lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios ya que actualmente se encuentran en la universidad.
texts.en: Mrs Carlota, age 46, lives in Guatajiagua, in the Morazan department, with her husband and two children ages 24 and 22. Her children are in school, thanks to the hard work of their parents. Carlota and her husband make and sell crockery (plates for cooking tortillas, and pots). They each learned this business from their parents, since the Guatajiagua zone is known for the heritage of working with clay and creating cooking tools. They work in their business all day, making their products in order to have them available whenever a customer visits and requests any product. Their challenge is the scarcity of materials since at times they run out and it is hard to continue. This situation has brought them to request a loan for the purchase of materials such as cruD. crockery, three carts of firewood, nacazcol seeds, black clay, and the fare to transport the merchandise. This help will give them strength and allow them to continue making pots and plates, since the summer is the best season for production as the sun is always strong. Their dreams are for the business to prosper and maintain an adequate inventory, and for their children to finish their studies since they are currently in university.

loan.use: The purchase of crude crockery, three carts of firewood, nacazcol seeds, black clay, and the fare to transport the merchandise

loan.name: Apolinaria

texts.es: Doa Apolinaria, tiene 61 aos de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazn, vive con un nieto de 16 aos, un sobrino de 24 y una nieta de 1 ao y medio, se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, tamales, cuajada y tortillas, este negocio tiene muchos aos de existir y es su fuente de ingreso para mantener el hogar en buenas condiciones. Ella est solicitando actualmente un prstamo para abastecer el negocio comprando arroz, azcar, aceite, frijoles y dems productos que ofrece a los clientes, con este prstamo pretende mejorar la variedad de alimentos necesarios en cada hogar logrando mantener la preferencia de los que ya forman parte de su clientela. Suea con desarrollar el negocio, alcanzar estabilidad econmica y estar unida a su familia para alcanzar juntos las metas y sueos a futuro.
texts.en: Apolinaria, age 61, lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan department. She lives with a 16-year-old grandson, a niece, age 24, and a granddaughter age 1 and a half. Apolinaria sells basic staples, tamales, curds, and tortillas. She has had this business for many years, and it is her source of income to maintain her home in good condition. She is requesting a loan to stock her business, buying rice, sugar, oil, beans, and other products that she offers her customers. With this loan, she will improve the variety of food in every household, with a preference for those who are already her customers. She dreams of developing her business and achieving economic stability, and working with her family to achieve their goals and dreams for the future.

loan.use: the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, beans

loan.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 54 aos, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jos de 68 aos, que es obrero y sus 2 hijos mayores, juntos se esfuerzan cada da por salir adelante. Desde hace 8 aos, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de cosmticos, de una reconocida marca; y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias que obtiene le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempea visitando a sus amigas y conocidas, de esta manera les va enseando los catlogos para que le realicen pedidos; adems paralelamente a esta actividad tambin se dedica a la enseanza en un programa de alfabetizacin de su zona. Esta muy contenta pues ambos trabajos le permiten salir adelante, y ya tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de vender ropa, pues aunque a solo veces se dedica a este negocio sabe que es muy rentable. Es el sexto crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Irma tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela, pues quiere mandar a fabricar pantalones cortos y blusas para comercializar estas prendas durante el verano.
texts.en: Irma, 54 years old, lives in her own home with her 68 year old husband Jos, a laborer, and their two grown children. Together they work every day to get ahead. For 8 years this businesswoman has sold a well-known brand of cosmetics. She is very satisfied as her earnings that she receives have enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys her work as it allows her to visit friends and acquaintances, showing them catalogs from which they then order; in addition to this business she also teachers a reading program in her neighborhood. She is very content as both jobs allow her to get ahead, and she has many plans for the future such as the one to sell clothing. Even though she has only sometimes sold clothing she knows it is a profitable business. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she doesnt want to disappoint the people who make the money possible for her to be able to continue working and becoming successful. Irma has planned to invest the money into buying a quantity of fabric, as she wants to arrange for the making of some shorts and blouses to sell during the summer.

loan.use: Buy fabric to make pants and blouses

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de 42 aos de edad, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de 18 aos de edad, residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, es empleado desde hace 18 aos como motorista del ministerio de Trabajo. Esta solicitando un prstamo para los gastos educativos de su hijo que actualmente estudia educacin media, ya que el salario no cubre todas las necesidades, pues solamente l trabaja para mantener los gastos de la casa. Su proyeccin es continuar trabajando, cancelar puntualmente el prstamo y ayudar a su hijo hasta que este finalice una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 42 years old and lives in San Miguel with his wife and 18 year old son. For the past 18 years, he's been working as a driver with the Work Ministry. He is asking for a loan so that he can pay his son's tuition. At the moment he is only a part time student because his salary does not cover all the needs. He only works to maintain the household.
He expects to continue working, repay the loan on time, and help his son until he finalizes his professional career.

loan.use: Tuition

loan.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es: Doa Mara, tiene 60 aos de edad, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, donde vive junto a su esposo, posee una tienda que naci por iniciativa propia, atendiendo todos los das de 6:00am a 7:00pm, este negocio tiene 15 aos de existir y hasta el momento les ha solventado las necesidades del hogar. Ella por el momento desea invertir en mercadera por lo que solicita un prstamo para comprar arroz, pollo, azcar, aceite, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer la tienda, ofrecer ms productos a los clientes y espera que sus ventas aumenten. Para doa Mara este negocio de tantos aos, en el que ha trabajado mucho y del que ha obtenido ingresos para sostener al da los gastos del hogar, espera que siga siendo rentable y que le estabilice su condicin econmica.
texts.en:
Doa Mara, age 60, lives with her husband in the San Miguel department of San Miguel. She started her own store 15 years ago. It's open every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The income from this business is enough to cover Mara's household expenses. She is now requesting a loan to invest in merchandise such as rice, chicken, sugar, and oil.
This purchase will strengthen the store by allowing Mara to offer more products to her customers and thus, to increase her sales income. Mara has worked hard to build her business and hopes that it will remain profitable enough to support her economically.

loan.use: Purchase of rice, chicken, sugar, and oil.

loan.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 37 aos, vive en su casa propia en compaa de su esposo Hugo de 38 aos que es obrero y de sus 3 pequeos hijos; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Esta empeosa mujer se dedica a la costura de pedrera en prendas de vestir. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues la desempea, de lunes a viernes, durante sus ratos libres ya que una intermediaria le deja la ropa a ella y un grupo de amigas de la zona donde vive para que se dediquen al pegado de diversos tipos de pedrera que adornan diversas prendas. Le pagan semanalmente de acuerdo al volumen de prendas que termino el trabajo, y ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un negocio propio, pero sabe que debe terminar primero de construir su casa. Es el segundo crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Adelaida tiene planeado invertir el crdito en materiales para terminar de tarrajear las paredes de su casa por el interior, pues desea continuar progresando y que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Hugo, a 38 year old construction worker, and their three small children. Together they strive each day to move forward in life.
This industrious woman works sewing beaded jewellery into items of clothing. She is very satisfied with her occupation, working from Monday to Friday and also in her spare time, since an intermediary passes on clothes that require beadwork to her and a group of friends from her community. Adelaida is paid weekly according to the number of items of clothing that she completes and this money helps her husband with the constant home expenses. They have many plans for the future, including setting up their own business, but Adelaida knows that they should finish building their own house first.
This is the second loan that Adelaida has taken out with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time. She doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who make this loan possible, as it allows her to continue working towards progress. Adelaida plans to invest this loan in materials to finish plastering the interior walls of her home. She wants to continue making progress so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loan.use: Purchase construction materials

loan.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es: Mara de 27 aos de edad, est soltera vive con su madre y un hermano, residen en Usulutn, es empleada en una tienda distribuidora de lcteos, encargada de ventas, esta tienda est ubicada en la ciudad de El Transito, Mara tiene ya 5 aos de contar con este empleo. Ella por el momento su necesidad es cubrir los gastos educativos para su hermano menor, ya que ella se encarga de pagar la colegiatura por el ao y comprar tiles, por eso solicita un prstamo y salir de este gasto lo antes posible. Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia y que su hermano se prepare estudiando para que tenga en un futuro una oportunidad de empleo distinta a la de ella.
texts.en: Maria is 27 years old, single and lives with her mother and brother. She lives in Usulutan. She works for a store that sells milk products. She is in charge of sales. This store is located in the city of El Transito. Maria has been working here for the past five years. Right now Maria needs to pay for the cost of schooling for her younger brother. She is in charge of paying his yearly educational expenses including school supplies. She is asking for a loan to pay for these costs as soon as possible. Her objectives are to continue working in order to help her family and her brother. He is studying so that he has greater opportunities in the future. She would like him to have a different type of work than she has.

loan.use: To pay for her brother's educational expenses and school supplies.

loan.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Doa Gloria, es una comerciante de pan y administra un comedor, tiene 45 aos de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposo, el negocio es familiar y trabaja todos los das de la semana, vende pan por las tardes y comida desde la maana hasta el medioda, tiene clientela abundante. Por el momento est solicitando un prstamo para la compra de materiales de cocina, estos los necesita en el da a da para preparar la comida que ofrece a los clientes, su compra ser en carnes, verduras, condimentos y aceite, manteniendo con estos variedad en su cocina y vender a los clientes platillos de calidad. Su objetivo es progresar con sus dos negocios, empleando a personas para que distribuyan su pan y ampliar el comedor, garantizando ingresos diariamente para el mantenimiento del negocio y de los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Mrs. Gloria sells bread and runs a food stall. She is 45 years old. She lives in San Miguel with her husband. This is a family business and she works every day of the week. She sells bread in the afternoons and prepared food from the morning until the middle of the day. She has a lot of customers. Right now she is asking for a loan in order to buy kitchen supplies. These she needs in order to prepare the daily meals for her customers. She will buy meat, vegetables, condiments and oil in order to have a variety of food products in her kitchen and sell quality prepared food to her customers. Her objectives are to progress with her two businesses. She would like to employ people to sell her bread. She would like to expand her food stall in order to increase her daily earnings. The earnings will be used to maintain her business and also for household expenses

loan.use: She will buy meat, vegetables, condiments and oil.

loan.name: Elvin Alexander

texts.es: Elvin es un joven de 20 aos de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazn, est soltero vive con su madre, a quien le ayuda mucho desarrollando su trabajo que es el barro creando ollas y comales, tambin est aprendiendo el trabajo de estructuras metlicas, la alfarera la aprendi por sus padres y las estructuras metlicas las ha aprendido de Don Jos un seor vecino que tiene un taller de esta actividad y le ha ofrecido trabajo para que l aprenda y pueda tener otro ingreso para ayudar a su madre. Por el momento Elvin est solicitando un prstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboracin de loza (barro, lea, nacazcol) tambin comprara hierro pintura e insumos necesarios para las estructuras metlicas. El dinero de este prstamo ser una gran ayuda para su familia, pues es una oportunidad de abastecer de materiales el trabajo que a diario realizan, tambin l tendr materiales para comenzar a crear sus propios inicios en el taller de estructuras. El sueo actual es crear su propio taller de estructuras, ganar clientes y realizar su trabajo de la mejor manera demostrando la experiencia adquirida.
texts.en: Elvin is a young person who is 20 years old. He lives in Guatajiagua, in the department of Morazan. He is single and lives with his mother. She helps him a lot with his business, which is creating pots and griddles out of clay. He is also learning how to make metal items. The making of pottery he learned from his parents. He learned how to work with metal from his neighbor, Don Jose, who has a metal workshop. Don Jose offered him work so that he could learn this skill and have another form of income in order to help his mother. This time Elvin is asking for a loan in order to buy raw materials in order to make loza, which is a combination of mud, small wood and black seeds that are used as a colorant. He also will buy painted iron and other ingredients that he needs for metal fabrication. The money from this loan will be a big help to his family. It is an opportunity to stock up on the work materials that he needs on a daily basis. He also would like materials to use to begin to create his own items in the metal workshop. His dream is to have his own metal workshop, acquire customers and do his work in the best way he is able thereby showing he is capable.

loan.use: He will buy the raw materials used to make clay (mud, small sticks and black seeds used as a colorant).

loan.name: Elvin Nahun

texts.es: Elvin tiene 23 aos de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazn, se dedica a vender refrescos, est soltero y vive con sus padres, este joven es trabajador, ayuda a su madre con sus necesidades y ve por sus propios gastos siendo independiente para sus padres. El inicio ayudndole a su madre, luego se dedico a vender de forma permanente para contar con un ingreso estable, su inconveniente es que en ocasiones se le terminan los materiales para preparar los refrescos por lo que solicita un prstamo para comprar materiales en abundancia de aquellos productos de ms duracin, como azcar y frutas de duracin, esta ser una gran ayuda para l ya que su inventario lo enriquecer de productos y aumentara su produccin de refrescos. Su objetivo es algn da tener el negocio solvente de deudas y mejorar la condicin econmica de l y de sus padres.
texts.en: Elvin, 23, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazn area and sells soft drinks. He is single and lives with his parents. This young man is hardworking and helps his mother with the necessities. He is responsible for his own expenses and financially independent from his parents. He began his business by helping his mother and now sells full-time so he can have a stable income. One inconvenience is that he sometimes runs out of materials to prepare his soft drinks and must ask for a loan to buy bulk materials for those longer-lasting products such as sugar and fruit. This will be a great help for him to enrich his product inventory and increase his soft drink production. His goal is to one day have a business solvent of debt and to be able to improve his and his parents economic statuses.

loan.use: to buy fruit and sugar to prepare soft drinks

loan.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 35 aos, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos jvenes, juntos se esfuerzan cada da por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 aos, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas y hot dog fritos) y caldo de gallina en un puesto que ha instalado en el patio de su vivienda. Esta muy satisfecha pues este negocio le rinde buenas ganancias, y ella empieza a trabajar con la ayuda de su hija mayor, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, de lunes a domingo. Manifiesta que a pesar que su negocio requiere bastante tiempo, pues alista los platillos desde muy temprano. Esta muy contenta con las ganancias que recibe, ya que le han permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Para el futuro desea ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. Es el primer crdito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitir continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Zonia tiene planeado invertir el crdito solicitado en la compra de varias javas de gaseosa, pues quiere surtir mejor su negocio e implementarlo con estas bebidas.
texts.en: Zonia, 35, lives in her own house with her two teenaged daughters, and together they make an effort to get ahead. For the past 4 years this enterprising woman has sold salchipapas (fried potatoes and hot dogs) and chicken soup in a stand that she installed on the patio of her home. She is very satisfied because this business has given her a good profit. She begins working with the help of her oldest daughter at 6 pm and stays open to 10 pm, Mondays through Sundays. She shows that although the business is very time-consuming, she has the food ready very early. She is very content with the earnings that she is getting since they have allowed her to get her family ahead. In the future she wants to enlarge the space for her business to offer better service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments punctually so that she stays on the good side of those who have made her ability to continue working possible. Zonia plans to use the money from the loan to buy some soft drinks so that she can better stock her business with these drinks.

loan.use: To buy soft drinks to offer to her customers

loan.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 57 aos, queda separada de su esposo y vive en su casa que es propia, en compaa de sus 3 hijos mayores que tiene su familia. Desde hace muchos aos, desde la ventana de su casa, Luz vende gaseosas, galletas, frugos y cervezas. Los fines de semana; son das muy arduos para ella, ya que vende cerveza hasta altas horas de la noche a sus vecinos y otros jvenes deportistas de la loza aledaa a su casa, que le prefieren comprar a ella, por su buen trato y su gran paciencia, es as que capta buenas utilidades; sin embargo la venta de las dems bebidas gasificadas no le genera muchas rentas. Por ello su anhelo es instalar una puerta para el acceso de la gente a su establecimiento, asimismo desea surtirla con todos los productos comestibles a su bodega, ya que el negocio le gusta mucho y sobre todo conversar con sus clientes. Es el 12avo crdito con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, adems en su banco comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad. De contar con el crdito que solicita, comprar cervezas y gaseosas por la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and is separated from her husband. She lives in her own home with her 3 older children that have families of their own. Luz has been selling soft drinks, candy, frugos [fruit beverages] and beer from a window in her house for many years now. The weekends are difficult for her as she sells beer to her neighbors and young athletes from the sport courts in her neighborhood until late into the night. They prefer to buy from her because she treats them well and has lots of patience. This is how she makes a good profit as she does not make much from the sale of her other beverages. She would like to install a door so that people have access to her store, then she would be able to stock all kinds of grocery items in her store. She really likes this business and most of all she likes conversing with her customers.
This is her 12th loan with MFP and as a long time member she is committed to making her payments on time, as she has done in the past. Additionally, her communal bank is very respected because they are so responsible. With the loan she will buy beer and soft drinks for the summer season.

loan.use: To purchase soft drinks and beer

loan.name: Jos Ramn

texts.es:
El seor Jos Ramn U. U., es trabajador en una empresa aguadora ocupando el cargo de Guiriza en la seccin de conexiones nuevas desde hace 3 aos.
Es soltero de 25 aos de edad, con 2 personas a su cargo una de ella en edad escolar. El habita en la ciudad de Managua en la comarca de sbana grande desde hace 10 aos.
Este es el primer crdito que tiene en CEPRODEL, el cul solicita para invertirlo en compra de material para mejora de vivienda como es Zinc, perlnes, clavos y otros. Para poder tener una casa con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Seor Jos Ramn U. U., works for a water company. He has been in charge of new connections for Guiriza for 3 years.
He is a single 25-year-old, with 2 people in his care, one of them of school age. He has lived in the city of Managua in the sbana grande region for 10 years.
This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, which he has requested to invest in the purchase of materials to improve his home, such as zinc, purlins (roof supprts), and nails among other things, so that he will be able to have a house with better living conditions.

loan.use: To buy construction materials.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Mejora de vivienda

loan.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El seor Juan Manuel P., esta agradecido por su cooperacin en el anterior crdito el cual pudo operar realizarle la operacin que su hijo requera en ese momento. A su vivienda le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el materia. Es por eso que esta solicitando un prstamo ya que le preocupa la proteccin y la seguridad de su familia. Planea pagar el crdito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como ingeniero de electrnica de una maquiladora.
texts.en: Seor Juan Manuel P. is grateful for your cooperation with his previous loan, which allowed him to pay for an operation that his son needed. His home lacks a protective wall around it, but he does not have the necessary money to be able to buy the materials. That is why he is requesting a loan, since he is worried at the lack of protection and security for his family. He plans to repay the loan with a part of the income that he earns from his work as an electronics engineer in a bonded assembly plant.

loan.use: To build a protective wall around his house.

loan.name: Jos Mara

texts.es:
El seor, Jos Mara D. R. trabaja como fontanero en una empresa aguadora desde 2 aos. Vive en la ciudad de Managua Carretera vieja a Len comunidad los cedros.
Es soltero de 43 aos de edad, tiene 3 personas a su cargo dos de ellas son menores en edad escolar
Agradece a CEPRODEL, ya que le permite con este prstamo comprar los materiales de construccin como: cemento, hierro, perlnes, piedra cantera que tanto lo necesita para invertir en la mejora de su casa ya que despus viene el invierno y no podr construir. Este es su primer crdito con CEPRODEL y espera pagar en tiempo y forma para poder seguir siendo cliente.
texts.en:
Seor, Jos Mara D. R. has worked as a plumber in a water company for 2 years. He lives in the city of Managua on the old road to Len, community of the cedars.
He is a single 43-year-old who has 3 people in his care, two of whom are of school age.
He is grateful to CEPRODEL, since with this loan they permit him to buy building materials such as cement, iron, perlnes (roof supports), and quarry stone that he needs so much to invest in the improvement of his house since winter is coming and he will not be able to build then. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and he expects to repay on time in order to continue as a client.

loan.use: To buy construction materials for his home.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy construction materials for his home.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy construction materials

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For home improvement

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For home improvement and to cover school expenses

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy construction materials

loan.name: Eden's Group

texts.en:
Eden E. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Eden is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Eden is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Eden joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eden from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loan.name: Harselina's Group

texts.en:
Harselina G. is from the village of Maligaya, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Harselina is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Harselina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Harselina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Harselina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Harselina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Harselina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Harselina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Harselina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loan.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea B., 52, is set to break the common notion about being a farmer's wife. Irenea, a CCT* Community Partner, is, unlike common wives of farmers, a productive entrepreneur. She is married to Ignacio, and they have seven children. Three of them are already working, one is in elementary, and the other three are not yet of school age. They live as one family in Silang, Cavite.
Running a sari-sari (variety) store is the main focus of Irenea. She sells valuable products that meet the daily, immediate needs of her community. Being 35 years in business, she quite knows what her regular customers need. She also sells vegetables to support her customers' call for a balanced diet. Monthly, Irenea earns a net income of Php 7,900.
To further help her grow her business, Irenea decides to apply for a Php 18,000 loan. This she plans to use to furnish her store with more variety of products that will meet different tastes of different customers. She also plans to start selling meat as well. With this loan money at hand, she is set to break her perceived limitations when it comes to business.
Irenea admits that she also has customers who do not pay their debts. However, she also wants to break that bad habit of theirs and see that her business will prosper. Quite simply, she dreams of securing a bright future for her whole family.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: purchase of grocery items and vegetables for sale

loan.name: Esgar

texts.es:
Esgar tiene 26 aos de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseros que conforman el distrito agrcola de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por producir limn y otras frutas como la maracuy. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a ms de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehculo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio cubriendo rutas que unen los caseros cercanos a donde reside y depende de los ingresos que esta actividad de brinde para sustentar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento econmico de su familia.
El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi y el estado accidentado de los caminos de las zonas que recorre diariamente han hecho que su unidad mvil empiece a sufrir algunos daos que requieren de urgente reparacin para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta accin ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Esgar is 26 years old, single and lives with his family in a country house in the Olmos farm district, in an area known for their lemon production and other fruit such as maracuya. The area belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located over two hours from the city of Chiclayo.
He has a cargo and passenger service for which he uses a motorized rickshaw (actually a motorcycle with transport cabin attached). He operates along the route that connects homes where he lives and uses the income to cover personal expenses and help out with family expenses.
The continous use of his motorized rickshaw and the bad pavement of the roads he has to travel daily have caused some damage to the rickshaw which now requires urgent repair to continue working in optimum condition. To cover costs he has applied for a loan of 1200 PEN through Edpyme Alternative.

loan.use: To repair his motorized rickshaw

loan.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina S., 48, believes that being part of CCT* as a Community Partner is a blessing. Fedelina has no college background; nevertheless, she is able to put up a business of her own. She is married to Pedro, a foreman, and they have five children. One of them now works for a living.
A residential ready-to-wear (RTW) business is what Fedelina works on for more than five years now. She buys quality shirts, bags, pants, and shoes, and sells them to business acquaintances and neighbors. But aside from that, she also focuses on her piggery. She raises piglets and makes sure they grow healthy to produce good pork products. Monthly, she earns around Php 11,000 from these two businesses.
To help Fedelina continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php 16,000. She plans to use this loan to buy hog feeds and other materials needed to sustain her piggery even as the piglets are still being raised. She also plans to use this loan in buying quality Ready-to-Wear products which will suit the tastes of her regular customers.
Frustrations never cease to exist even in the life of Fedelina, but she chooses to focus on her goal rather than on the obstacles. She dreams of seeing her businesses grow and eventually expand. More than anything else, she wants to see her children finish schooling and be a blessing not just to her, but to the entire community.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: hog feeds and quality ready-to-wear items usually ordered by her customers

loan.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 50 aos de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de Jos Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos ms poblados de la regin, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su poblacin situada en zonas marginales. Es conocido por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.
Ella cuenta con una pequea bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo de cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, con el sostenimiento de la economa de su familia.
Esperanza desea implementar su negocio con ms productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old, married and lives with her family in the urban slum area in the Jos Leonardo Ortiz district. It is one of the most populous districts in the region with most of its inhabitants living in substandard housing. It is well known for the abundant trade and transportation activity there.
She has a small store in her home and offers staple goods and all kinds of groceries. She is very attentive and caring and therefore has loyal customers who prefer to do their shopping at her store. She uses the earnings from her business to help her husband cover household expenses.
Esperanza wants to increase her stock of products so she can increase sales and meet her customers' demands. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 PEN which she plans to use to reach her goal.

loan.use: To buy goods for her store

loan.name: Rama

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Rama B.. She is married and has one child, aged 10. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business. In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women.
Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loan.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loan.name: Janete

texts.en:
Not everyone is comfortable dealing with change. Janete P., 42, feels quite the same, though she is sure that God will enable her to overcome. Janete is a college graduate, and now she applies what she learned from school and what she gets from her training in CCT* as a Community Partner to make her business prosper. She is married to Antonio, who has a regular work as a driver. They raise their children in Cavite--two college students and one high school student.
Janete is a water dealer, and by this she provides clean, distilled water to her community for almost five years now. She also sells electronic load (e-load) for mobile phones, since Filipinos are avid texters. Sometimes, she also buys and sells pawn tickets. With these she earns around Php 7,000 monthly.
To help her grow her business, Janete decides to apply for a Php 9,000 loan. She plans to use the money to level up her water business, as well as to boost up her e-load business. She believes that by doing so, she increases the profitability of her businesses, which are the main sources of income of her family.
Admitting that a frequent change of business is troublesome for her is one thing Janete has to do in order to decide focusing on one or two and making it grow profitably. From there, she hopes to make her business really work. Janete simply wants her family to have better living conditions.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: purchase of materials to increase sales

loan.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano es un padre de familia de 59 aos de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en uno de los caseros que conforman el distrito agrcola de Tambogrande, una zona se cL. semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du produccin de frutas como mango y limn. Pertenece a la regin Piura y se encuentra ubicado a ms de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. l cra a su ganado en algnos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.
Actualmente Adriano desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado con esta inversin l espera lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Adriano is the father of a family, he is 59 years old and he lives together with his wife and their four children in the community that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region primarily known for fruit production such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.
He raises and sells livestock. He keeps his livestock in some corrals located near his house and he feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good level of development he puts offers them up for sale to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income which is why he always tries to manage it in the best way possible.
Adriano wishes to improve his livestock business with the acquisition of balanced feed. This investment will help him raise his livestock in a better way and it will improve his sales and his earnings. In order to reach his objective he approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loan.use: To purchase balanced livestock feed.

loan.name: Sunita

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Sunita S.. She is married and has two children aged 12 and 7. In 2001, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women.
Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loan.use: to buys raw materials for tailoring business

loan.name: Violeta's Group

texts.en:
Violeta A. is from the village of Linglingay, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Violeta is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Violeta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loan.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde es una cliente de 51 aos de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseros que conforman el distrito agrcola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du produccin de frutas como mango y limn. Pertenece a la regin Piura y se encuentra ubicado a ms de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la venta de cerveza, chicha (bebida preparada en base a una harina llamada jora) y comida en un lugar acondicionado para esas labores en su domicilio. Su negocio atiende los das viernes, sbados y domingos, ya que en su localidad se acostumbran las reuniones entre amigos, lo que hace que la gente de ese pueblo sea ms unida. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.
Cleotilde desea aumentar su mercadera para venderla, as como tambin comprar insumos para preparar ms comida, as ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cleotilde is a 51-year old woman who lives together with her family in the community that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region primarily known for fruit production such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.
She sells beer, chicha drink (a drink prepared from a jora flour base) and prepared foods from a space in her house remodeled for her business. She runs her business on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays because in her community friends come together, especially because the population of her community is very close. This business is her primary source of income which is why she tries to manage it in the best way possible.
Cleotilde wishes to increase her inventory for resale, and to purchase ingredients to prepare more foods in order to increase her sales and her earnings. In order to reach her objective she approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loan.name: Jo-Ane

texts.en:
Jo-ane S., 39, is an entrepreneur with a knack for multitasking. She is a registered nurse, but found success in establishing businesses. Her trainings in CCT* as a Community Partner enable her to reach heights in business. Jo-ane is married to Marzan, a painter. They live in Dasmarinas where they raise their only son, who is now in elementary.
Being in the direct-selling business, Jo-ane has developed the skill to choose the quality products and deal with people in the neighborhood to turn them into regular customers. She sells shirts, pants, bags, and shoes that suit the tastes of her friends and business connections. That is the reason her business works. Jo-ane also sells frozen foods to household people who take time to cook. Monthly, she earns an average net income of Php 10,800.
Jo-ane wants to maximize her potential as a multitasking entrepreneur. To help her continue operation of her businesses, she would like to request for a Php 31,000 loan. She plans to use this to increase the number of products she sells in order to better meet the specific needs of her regular customers. More importantly, she is planning to use a big part of the loan to start another business.
Sure enough, Jo-ane never misses her share of customers who do not pay on time. Nevertheless, she still prays for the ability to collect their payments and use the money in her soon-to-open business. All this multitasking is a means of preparation for the multifaceted future which she wants her only son to have.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: restocking inventory

loan.name: Petronila

texts.en:
There are people who cannot tolerate uncertainties in life. At 50, Petronila M. tries her best to minimize the uncertainties in her business and in her personal life. Petronila is married to Gabriel, who works as a driver. They live in Dasmarinas, Cavite, where they raise their four children. One of them is in college while another one is in elementary. They have a child who already works for a living, and one who stays at home.
Petronila is a dealer of charcoal and wood as cooking fuel, applying her learning from the training CCT* provides to its community partners. She buys sacks of it and repacks it into small packs worth Php 10. This she does to make it affordable to people in her community who often use it for cooking. With these, she earns an estimated net income around Php 10,000 every month.
To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php 8,000 loan. She plans to use this to buy more sacks of charcoal and bundles of woods as fuel to boost her business. She looks forward to an increased income due to this effort.
Customers and financial matters will always be a concern for her, but Petronila knows that God has given her the ability to produce wealth; the first step is to believe, and the next one is to take action. She faithfully does so, and she holds on to the promise that her dream of a prosperous business and a happy, healthy family will surely come to pass, despite all the present uncertainties.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: more sacks of charcoal and bundles of wood for household fuel

loan.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es:
Sandra Maribel S. T., tiene 30 aos de edad, reside en la Aldea Tasajeras junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos pequeos hijos de 8,5 y 1 aos. Sandra es una persona muy simpatica y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella Tiene una pequea pulpera que funciona en su domicilio, con un horario de atencin de 6:00 am 9:00 pm. Su principal ventaja es que no hay otra pulpera en el Aldea y eso le hace que todos sus vecinos hagan sus compras en su pulpera.
El prstamo lo necesita para comprar abarrotera para surtir su negocio de ms y variados productos de la canasta basica. Su meta es tener un mercadito y que este le permita obtener mayores ganancias para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio porque ella desea que sean profesionales y tambin que su de vida mejore. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con puntualidad el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sandra Maribel S. T. is 30 years old and lives with her family in the town of Tasajeras. Her family is made up of her husband and three small children who are 8, 5, and 1 year old. Sandra is a very kind person who is well known by her neighbors. She has a small pulpera [grocery store] that she runs from her house from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm each day. Her main advantage is that there are no other pulperas in the town, and therefore all her neighbors come to her store to make their purchases. She needs this loan to buy groceries to stock her business with more products and with a greater variety of daily necessities. Her goal is to have a small market, as this would allow her to earn better profits so that she could continue supporting her children's studies. She hopes that they will be professionals and that their quality of life will improve. This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her repayments punctually.

loan.use: to buy groceries for her store

loan.name: Josephfine's Group

texts.en:
Josephfine C. is from the village of Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Josephfine is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Josephfine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephfine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Josephfine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Josephfine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephfine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephfine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: Purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loan.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
One good characteristic of a winning entrepreneur is desiring to become better. At 50, Ireneo ignores the number of years he has lived and keeps in mind that there is more to learn or unlearn in order to improve his business. He lives with Jocelyn in Tanza, Cavite, where they raise three college children.
For four years now, Ireneo rents out his vans to people who are looking for cheap transportation for special trips or group outings. He sees that this kind of business is profitable in his community, where people do not yet have their own cars to use. Aside from that, Ireneo also has an ice cream business located near their home. He earns an estimated income of around Php1,000 per day.
To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting for a Php15,000 loan. He notices that an improvement has to be done in his shop. Part of the loan, then, will go to this purpose. As a Community Partner, he also continuously applies what he learns from CCT* to make this business grow, along with his ice cream business.
Ireneo presently struggles with coming up with new ideas for his business. He sees that if he has to keep up with the times, he has to give his business a new look. All that his heart desires is to see that his labor is not in vain, and that part of his income goes to his savings for his family. He anticipates a big improvement on his business, and a source of blessings that never runs out.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: Improving the shop

loan.name: Gertruda

texts.en:
If one would dream for ones self or ones family, why not dream for the best? Gertruda R., 34, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Ruby, as she is called by friends, reached college and is married to Joseph Ryan, a general manager. They have a child who is in elementary school. Together they live in Pasay City.
With the learning she gains as a Community Partner in CCT*, Ruby runs her own sari-sari (variety) store to capitalize on the big target market she has in her community. She has been doing business here for two years. It is quite easy for her since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees. She earns Php800 a day.
To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request for a Php15,000 loan. This she plans to buy more grocery items to put in her store, so that it would not have to look bare and incomplete. Ruby takes effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her child being supported.
Ruby struggles with time management when it comes to balancing business, health and family life. One proof of this is her health problem. However, she sees to it that these struggles will not prevent her from reaching her dreams for her family. She desires to see her small store grow and eventually expand. She dreams of good health for everyone in the family, having their own house and lot, and permanent job for her husband, and a big happy family. Deep inside, she knows that if there is faith, and action, it will be possible.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.
