loan.use: Grocery items and rice for her store

loan.name: Unidas Por El Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unidas por el amor est integrado por 11 socias y dos socios, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades econmicas. La sra. Maria Salome S. Z., es la coordinadora del banco comunal, tiene 53 aos de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, y reside en la comunidad del Rusio en el municipio de Juticalpa, Olancho. Inicio su negocio con el primer credito que obtuvo en FAMA en el a;o 2002, es una mujer luchadora y tiene una pequea pulpera en su casa de habitacin que atiende ella y su esposo. Maria atraviesa un problema de salud llamado paralisis facial y muy a menudo tiene que comprar medicamentos.
El prstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar azcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, etc. Con el apoyo del prstamo tendr ms y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrn encontrar todo lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos y asi ella podra cubrir los gastos de la casa y su salud. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio hasta inagurar un mercadito, tambien sue;a con hacerle mejoras a su casa porque esta bien deteriorada
Maria Salome ha sido cliente de FAMA por nueve a;os y espera pagar las cuotas de este nuevo prestamo de forma puntual y responsable como hasta en la actualidad.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas por el Amor' (United by Love) community bank is made up of 11 women and 2 men who each carry out different business activities. Maria Salome S. Z. is the coordinator of the community bank. She is 53 years old, married, has four children and lives in Rusio neighborhood, in the town of Juticalpa, Olancho. Maria set up her business with the first loan that she received from FAMA in 2002. She is a hard-working woman who owns a small grocery store in her home that both she and her husband serve in. Maria Salome suffers from a health problem called 'facial paralysis' and she has to buy medicine very often.
Maria needs this loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, butter, meat, chicken, sausages, bread, etc. Through the support of this loan, she will be able to have a better stocked business and her customers will be able to find everything they need to prepare their meals. This will, in turn, allow Maria to cover her household and health expenses. Maria's goal is to grow her business until she owns a mini-market. She also dreams of making improvements to her home because it is in a bad state of repair.
Maria Salome has been a client of FAMA for nine years and she hopes to make all the repayments on her new loan punctually and responsibly as she has with her previous loans.

loan.use: To buy general groceries

loan.name: Remelita

texts.en:
We do not need to make a lot of mistakes before we learn. At the age of 32, Remelita, as she is called by friends, learns the ways of both business and life to get going at a better pace. She finished only 2nd year high school, but her training in CCT as a Community Partner enables her to run a business with confidence. She is married to Marco Antonio, a driver. They used to live in Cebu City, but now they reside in Maricaban, Pasay City, with their three children. One of them is already in college, while the two others are in elementary.
Remelita has been in the direct selling for two years, but is still doing her best to master her trade. She tries to figure out what her customers like when it comes to bags, shoes, shirts, and pants. With no employees to help her sell, she gives her utmost strength to make her business work. She earns an estimated net income of around Php3,000 per month.
To help her grow her business, Lita applies for a Php15, 000 loan. She will use this money to buy quality apparel to make sure that her customers will get only the best in the market. With this money on hand, she can easily improve on her business, one lesson she got in her fellowship* with fellow community partners.
Just like any micro entrepreneur, Remelita also suffers from customers who do not pay their debts. But as she is learning how to be a successful entrepreneur, she also learns how to deal with such difficult times in business. The simplest dreams she has in her heart is for everyone in the family to have good health, and to see her children graduate from college.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: Purchase additional quality apparels for selling

loan.name: Lina

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Lina L., 37, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for her and her family. She has finished her high school education and is married to Primo, 47, a market vendor. They have four children who are currently attending elementary and high school.
Lina presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store which caters to needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocery in the community. Lina also operates from home a burger stand which she has run for almost a year now, and has gained regular customers who keep her business alive. She employs no one, and earns at least Php10, 000 estimated net income per month.
To help Lina continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php23,000 loan. She will use this to buy goods that her customers prefer. She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make her their number one sari-sari store in the community. She also plans to use part of this loan to purchase needed materials for her burger stand.
Lina learns the value of improving ones business, and thus works to innovate her own. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goal she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: Purchase raw ingredients for her burger stand and additional items for her variety store

loan.name: Ligaya's Group

texts.en:
Ligaya A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Ligaya is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Ligaya is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Ligaya joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ligaya has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ligaya from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loan.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes T. is from the village of Gamis Saguday Quirino. She is 48 years old. Agnes is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Agnes is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Agnes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loan.name: Anie

texts.en:
If one would dream for ones self or ones family, why not dream for the best? Anie Valerio, 40, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Anie is married to Manolito Valerio, a Liason Officer. They have two children who are currently in high school and college.
Anie runs her own small restaurant for a year now. She mobilizes members of her family to help her. It is quite easy for her to manage since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees. Her customers are her neighbors and the entire community. She earns at least Php11,000 estimated net income every month.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php15,000 loan. She plans to use this to buy raw ingredients, sacks of rice, and other materials needed for her restaurant operation. Anie takes effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her children being supported.
She dreams of having good health for everyone in the family and able to send all her children all the way through college. As CCT community partner, she is faithfully attending her weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. She believes that if there is faith in God, and action, everything will be possible.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: Purchase needed ingredients and other materials to continue operation of her restaurant

loan.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza T., 48 years old, is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo T. and are blessed with three children who are currently go to high school and college.
Edeliza operates a rug-making business having her husband as business partner. She primarily sells doormats but she also sells rugs, towels, braided quilts, bed sheets, and other crafts. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional raw materials, such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
Edeliza dreams of giving her children a good education through her hard work at her business. She always prays for good health and able to enjoy life to the fullest along with her family. As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups meet each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loan.use: Purchase materials needed for rug-making

loan.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio E. is from the village of Nagbukel, San Isidro. He is 45 years old. Anastacio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anastacio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anastacio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Anastacio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacio is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Anastacio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loan.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 57 years old and does stitching work to earn an income for her family. She started this business to financially support her husband who operates an herbal medicine making business. He is an expert in his field and has a great ability to diagnose diseases. Many people from different areas come to him for herbal treatments.
Sakina has 2 sons and 2 daughters. All of them work. Her eldest son has a business of selling mobile phones while the other son is a salesman and sells groceries to different grocery shops. Both of her daughters stitch clothing and help her in her business.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her elder sons mobile phones selling business. With the loan, he will purchase mobiles of different companies like Nokia, Samsung etc and calling cards for his shop to offer more variety to the clients to earn an extra income.
Her son has been operating this business for the past 10 years and managing a good clientele base. She is confident that an investment will give a big a boost to his business by increasing his profits.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and always paid her installments on time.
She belongs to a small city of Punjab Pakistan called Kasur which is known for its tanneries industry. She lives there with her family in a 3 room brick house.

loan.use: To buy mobile phones and calling cards to resell

loan.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito A. Jr. is from the village of San Rafael. He is 27 years old. Warlito is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Warlito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Warlito has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Warlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlito is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Warlito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loan.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita A. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 58 years old. Estelita is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-eight years and earns approximately $158 a month for these activities.
In 2010, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loan.name: Sheema

texts.en:
Sheema belongs to a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur, which is famous for its tanneries industry. She lives there in a three-room brick house with her family. She shares the financial burden with her husband by operating a small grocery store adjacent to her home. Through this store she sells daily use items like cooking oils, sugar, spices, candies, tea, etc. to her customers. She offers her customers quality products at cheap rates. She has been operating this business for the past five years. Her husband is a driver by profession. He owns a rickshaw which he uses to provide transport services to passengers.
Sheema is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is also a driver by profession while the second one is an electrician. Her elder daughter is studying in class 5. The others stay at home and dont do anything.
Sheema has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will help her to fulfill the demands of many more customers and to make more sales. She is very confident that her business will enjoy good growth after the loan investment and that she will be able to provide a better life for her family as a result.

loan.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loan.name: Guddu

texts.en:
Guddu lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is a 53-year-old lady, and the mother of three daughters who are all illiterate and do labor work. They couldnt get an education and had to start working at an early age due to the death of their father. Their father was the only breadwinner of the family, and after his death they had no financial resources available.
Guddu started a business of selling animals after the death of her husband. She purchases animals from the animal markets and raises them up to sell to butchers for a profit. The earned income helps her to put three meals a day on the table for her family.
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her animals sales business. With the loan she will buy goats and buffalo and raise them up for selling. She is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her business and will increase her household income as a result. She also has a plan to collect some dowry for her elder daughters marriage with the help of increased profits.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy animals (goats & buffalo) for animal sales business

loan.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia; an area known for fertile farmland for growing rice crops. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income of $2.5 per day.
Soam S.'s farm is outside of a watering system, so she would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase some pipe, and gasoline.

loan.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loan.name: Mesalina

texts.en:
Mesalina A. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 57 years old. Mesalina is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 20. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling hair accessories. She has been engaged in her business for quite some time now and she earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.
Mesalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
Mesalina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase assorted accessories to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase assorted accessories to sell

loan.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is the wife of M. R. and resides in a city called Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She has been living there in a three-room brick house with her family for past twenty-one years. Hameedan is 49 years old and is involved in the business of hand embroidery. She takes orders from her neighboring clients and fulfills them within a given time period to earn an income. She is known among her clients for the quality of her work and meeting her time commitment.
She is the mother of three sons and three daughters. Her sons have a business of selling bedsheets, and her daughters do embroidery to help their mother in completing her embroidery orders. Her husband has a business of selling construction supplies. He offers his services to different construction companies and earns income.
Hameedan has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further growth of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material and clothes in bulk to offer her clients better quality services.
She has been operating her business for the past ten years and keeps herself up to date about the latest trends in fashion and clothing. She is hopeful that an investment will give her business an instant boost and will increase her income.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy embroidery material and clothes for her embroidery business

loan.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel B. is from the town of Dauis. He is 38 years old. Arnel is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a fishing business, catching and selling assorted fish to the market. One of the reasons Arnel works so hard is because he wants to be able to sustain his children's education.
Arnel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
Arnel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair his fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loan.use: to repair his fishing boat

loan.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn S. is a 28-year-old woman who sells different kinds of Khmer cake in her village in Kompong Chhnang Province. Horn S. currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer. Besides selling Khmer cake, she assists her husband in the farming business as well. They have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school.
Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Horn S.s husband's business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crop. In order to solve this situation, Horn S. is taking out her loan to support her husband to purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loan.use: To purchase a pumping machine for pumping water in rice crops

loan.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
20-year-old Jackelyn is from the town of Dauis. She is married and has a one-year-old child. She is engaged in fishing. Her husband, who is also a fisherman, operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Jackelyn sells all of her husband's catch to the market. She also sells mobile phone credit loads to her neighbors. Jackelyn wants to have a happy and healthy family. She hopes to be a good mother and wife.
Jackelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loan.use: to invest in expanding the business

loan.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida belongs to a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur, which is famous for its leather industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past ten years. She is 37 years old, married to S. A. and has six children. Only three of them are able to attend school; the others are free to stay at home.
Her husband operates a soaps and hair oil selling business. He has a shop in the market where he sells his products and earns income for the family. He started this business ten years ago, and he has obtained a good reputation among his customers for his quality products and good conduct. He supplies soaps and hair oil to other shops as well.
Zubaida operates a business of selling shawls. She sells shawls to her neighboring clients by receiving orders from them. Her business grows during the winter season.
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy soaps and hair oil in larger quantities to sell through his shop. Zubaida is hopeful that an investment will put a positive impact on her husbands income and also expand his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy soaps and hair oil for reselling

loan.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela B. is from the town of Panglao. She is 46 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community.
Adela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
Adela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loan.use: to invest in expanding the business

loan.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch V. has been in the farming business for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Since 1990, Touch V. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate rice crops, from which she earns a daily income.
Touch V. is a widowed mother who has given birth to four children, most of whom are employed in various jobs and share their salary with her for the familys daily expenses. Because this is the harvest season, Touch V. wishes to buy many sacks of rice to add to her stock. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loan.use: To buy rice while prices are low for future sale

loan.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is a married woman from the town of Panglao. She has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. She earns from it daily. She also tends a small parcel of a rice farm. She says the harvest is very helpful, as she does not have to buy rice for her family to eat. Gelasia hopes to have a stable business.
Gelasia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
Gelasia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories.

loan.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loan.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D. is from the town of Panglao. She is 36 years old. Gemma is married and has three children aged five, three and one. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community.
Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is from the town of Panglao. She is 30 years old. Gina is married and has three young children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Gina says she wishes to have her own savings.
Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is the wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and leather industries. She has been living there with her family for the past ten years. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is studying in class 5 and the younger one is in class 2. Her daughter is only two years of age and doesnt attend school.
She and her husband are both involved in a business of selling clothes. She sells clothes to her neighboring clients and also offers them alteration services. Her husband purchases clothes from the wholesale markets in the city of Lahore. He operates a shop in the market where he sells ladies' and gents' clothes at cheaper rates.
Zahida has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her family business. They will utilize the loan in the purchasing of clothes in bulk, which will enable them to offer more variety to their clients and also minimizes the cost of traveling every month. They have been involved in this business for the past ten years, and Zahida is hopeful that an investment will make a positive impact on the business and that their income will be increased.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is a responsible loan user who has paid her installments on time and attended every meeting.

loan.use: To buy clothes for selling

loan.name: Mech

texts.en:
Mech O., 50, is a local farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Usually, she generates around $1 of profit a day for the needs of her family.
Mech O. has no life partner because her husband died of senility many years ago. Currently, she lives with her niece and nephew and they are working in different occupations. Her niece is a mobile used-goods seller for earning daily income.
This is rice-harvesting season and Mech O. needs capital to purchase rice to store in her stock supply to later sell when prices increase. With the rest of the funds, she will support her niece's business and buy used goods for selling.
Note: Mech O. and her niece, nephew and young granddaughter are pictured in the photo.

loan.use: To stock up on rice while prices are low for selling later

loan.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda, 36 years old, is from the town of Panglao. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, providing "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services. Glenda has been engaged in this business for four years now.
Glenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loan.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loan.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She has been living there with her family for the past twenty years. She is 42 years old and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a motor workshop as a mechanic while her elder daughter makes paranda (an ornament used to tie back hair). Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Safia also makes paranda to share the financial burden of her family with her husband and children. She sells them to different cosmetics shops at the markets and earns income in this way.
Her husband is a carpenter by profession and makes furniture on order. He has a showroom in the market where he displays his furniture items, like chairs, tables, etc. He is known for his creative art and quality among his clients.
Safia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further growth of her paranda making business. With the loan, she will purchase thread, beads and tassels in bulk quantities, which will help her to make paranda in larger quantities for selling.
She has been handling this business for the past ten years and she is very confident that her business will grow further after making the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy thread, beads and tassels for a paranda making and selling business. (paranda - an ornament used to tie back hair)

loan.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem N., 62, is a local farmer who has been growing rice for many years. She is married to Rik Phan, 74, who works with her on the farm. In addition, Nhem N. sells a few fruits to her fellow villagers for a profit.
This older couple has been married for many years and is blessed with seven children, all of whom are employed at different jobs.
Nhem N. now needs a loan as capital to buy fertilizers and gasoline to stock up for putting into her existing pumping machine, which she uses to pump water for her crop.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for putting into her pumping machine

loan.name: Greziel

texts.en:
Greziel L., 38 years old, is from the town of Panglao. She is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and manages a sari-sari store, selling noodles, bread and other products. She also displays her DVDs and pocketbooks for rent. She wants her business to grow and she is working hard to achieve it.
Greziel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane C. is from the town of Panglao. She is 29 years old. Jane is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She also supports her husband's business, which is a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) service.
Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.
Jane is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her general store business.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is a long-time business woman and low-income person. She has a small farm, and she grows different kinds of crops which she proposes to harvest and sell to a buyer when the crops are mature. She has been working on the farm since she was single. Her husband earns his profit by climbing the palm trees in and around his community. He has been in this business for a long time and it is a popular job for poor people who live in the province to do. Because their tools for climbing the palm trees are getting old and some are broken, Meas S. would like a loan to assist her husbands business in buying ladders, as well as some containers for palm juice. Meas S. has six single children, two of whom are staff workers for industry.

loan.use: To buy ladders and some containers for palm juice.

loan.name: Safia Kosar

texts.en:
Safia kosar belongs to a small city in Punjab Pakistan called Kasur, which is known for its tanneries industry. She lives there with her family in a two room brick house. Safia is 41 years old and is a school teacher. She earns a reasonable income from her teaching profession. She is also a very good housewife. Besides her school job she also does her household tasks very well. Safia has 4 sons and a daughter. Safia gives the required time to her children and teaches them. Her children are very intelligent and always get good scores in their classes.
Safia is married to M. A., who is a carpenter by profession and makes furniture on order to earn income for the family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husbands furniture business. With the loan, he will purchase wood, nails and furniture polisher and also hire a worker which will help him to complete his orders on time and earn maximum profits.
Safia is hopeful that her husbands business will become better after the loan investment is made. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loan.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polisher for furniture making business

loan.name: Chrek

texts.en: Chrek K., age 30, makes a living by selling fish. She and her husband buy fish from the rural areas at a reasonable price and sell it to gain a profit. Chrek K. currently earns an average of US $6.80 a day, and she has been running her business for three years. Chrek K. is the mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. Chrek K. and her husband always used their existing motorcycle for picking up their fish to sell in the mobile place. Unfortunately, their old motorcycle broke down while driving, which may affect their transportation. To deal with this problem, Chrek K. is applying for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loan.use: To buy a used motorcycle to replace her broken one.

loan.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang S. now weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She often makes over 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Recently, Hang S. has run out of essential materials from her stock supply, and she hopes to acquire more raw materials to continue her work of making baskets. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance. Hang S. is a 28-year-old married woman blessed with three children, all of whom are single and still dependent.

loan.use: To buy raw materials for making baskets for sale.

loan.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer P. is from the town of Panglao. She is 33 years old. Jennifer is married and has 4 children who are age 3, 5, 7, and 8. She is a dried fish dealer. Her husband helps her deliver fish using their tricycle. When they are done with all of the deliveries, her husband transports people around their community to earn an extra income.
Jennifer joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loan.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loan.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran belongs to a small city in Punjab Pakistan called Kasur, which is known for its tanneries industry. She lives there with her family in a 3 room brick house. Sughran's husbands name is B. A. and he works in a brick furnace for a low income. Sughran has given birth to 6 children: 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her elder son also works in a brick furnace while her elder daughter does embroidery by staying at home. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.
Sughran operates a dairy business at her home to earn income for her family. For this purpose she has some buffaloes at her home. She gets milk from these buffaloes every day and sells to her local area clients. She is known in the region for her quality services and has been operating this business for 15 years.
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo which will increase the production of milk and increase her sales. She is very confident that her business will grow further after the loan investment and believes she will easily be able to return the loan in installments.
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit record behavior and never missed any meetings.

loan.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loan.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo E. is from the village of San Rafael. He is 39 years old. Leonardo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Leonardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loan.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng P., 41, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs behind her house. She is married to Choum Sok, 45, who assists her in the business. The couple have seven children, all of whom are single. Three of her children are working in different jobs in the Phnom Penh City. To improve her trade, Heng P. is taking out her loan to purchase small pigs to raise.

loan.use: To purchase small pigs to raise.

loan.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. Patrick has a retail shop business, which he has run for ten years.
To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his rentals business further.

loan.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loan.name: Ma. Margie

texts.en:
Ma. Margie D. is from the town of Panglao. She is 38 years old. Ma. Margie is married and has 4 children who are 12, 17, 19, and 21 years old. To make a living, Ma. Margie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling bread and "bukayo" (sweets made of young coconut).
Ma. Margie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Margie is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loan.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loan.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard N. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Bernard has a retail shop business, which he has run for eight years.
To help expand his business, Bernard has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Bernard hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loan.use: To purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loan.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S. is 84-year-old woman who stays at home in order to do a little bit house works. She has no life partner, because her husband passed away years ago. Bun S. currently lives with her children, who are employed at a factory as sewing worker; they always contribute their salary to Bun S. to use in the whole family. In the past time, Bun S.s employed children have been faced with transportation difficulties. They go to work by taxi or walking, because they have no vehicle. To solve this problem, Bun S. would like to request a loan to buy a used motorbike for her kids to use for commuting to their work locations.

loan.use: To buy a used motorbike for her kids to use to commute to their work locations.

loan.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena L. is a married woman from the town of Panglao. She grows and fattens pigs and then sells them at the market. She also owns a small sari-sari store located at her house. Ma. Elena works hard to build her business. She hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.
Ma. Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loan.use: To purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell

loan.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a married woman from the town of Panglao. She has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. She and her husband also tend a small rice farm. They also own a carabao that helps in tilling the land. Norberta works hard to help provide for her family and improve their living.
Norberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norberta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories.

loan.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Betty has a restaurant business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and store food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to build a house and educate her child. Betty is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be hardworking.

loan.use: To purchase and store food for resale

loan.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Justine has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business selling fruit and vegetables.
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to build a house. Justine is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loan.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loan.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Nulu has a salon business, which she has run for six years.
To help expand her business, Nulu has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nulu hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land. Nulu is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loan.use: To purchase braids for the hair

loan.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo L. is from the town of Panglao. He is 45 years old. Primo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Primo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) service. Primo has been engaged in his business for 4 years.
Primo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Primo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loan.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Susan has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Susan is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play games.

loan.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loan.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Nulu has a DVD library business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Nulu has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase video DVDs for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nulu hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own a stationery business. Nulu is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loan.use: To purchase video DVDs for resale

loan.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace H. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Peace has a retail shop business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Peace hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to build rental houses. Peace is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loan.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loan.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin B. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Kevin has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Kevin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to build a house. Kevin is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more about family planning and how to protect against HIV/AIDS.

loan.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Sarah has a candle-making business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase candle wax materials for making candles for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Sarah is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play games.

loan.use: To purchase candle wax for candle making

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, who are not currently in school. Florence has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land. Florence is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself from HIV/AIDS.

loan.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Elizabeth has a business selling clothes, which she has run for over ten years.
To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Elizabeth hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to build a house. Elizabeth is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loan.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loan.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Shadia has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Shadia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shadia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to continue with her studies. Shadia is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business.

loan.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loan.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Jalia has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Jalia is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loan.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loan.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 45-year-old married woman from the town of Panglao. She is engaged in fishing. Her husband uses their fishing boat to catch assorted fish. Vicenta then sells her husband's catch at the market. Vicenta also now grows and sells pigs.
Vicenta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loan.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loan.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 51 years old and is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 children. Adora is a farmer and tills her own land. She plants and harvests rice crops. Although Adora has a sari-sari store located at her house, she still rents a small stall at the market to sell her harvest. She said more people can buy her rice if she sells it at the market. Adora is a good mother. She wants the best for her family.
Adora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Adora is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loan.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda F. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amanda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale.
Amanda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amanda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Amanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers

loan.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in Okara, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 5 years. She is 42 years old and married to S. A., who is a butcher by profession. His shop is located in the community area and he offers quality meat to his clients for cheap prices.
Kosar is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. She herself is a housewife and prefers to stay at home and perform her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in large quantity to fulfill customer demand and make more income. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Kosar is very hopeful that her husbands business will be expanded further after the loan investment.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loan.use: To buy chickens for chicken-meat selling business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy additional cosmetics for his business.

loan.name: Syed's Group

texts.en:
Syed lives in Okara, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She is 45 years old and married to M. S., who works as an electrician. His shop is located in the market and he offers electrical repair services to his clients.
Syed is a housewife and a very good administrator. She manages her household expenses very well and does her household work by staying at home. She is the mother of 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son works in a soap manufacturing factory while the others stay home. Only her third child is enrolled in school and studying in the 8th grade.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husbands electrician business. With the loan, he will purchase electrical repair tools to offer better quality services to his clients. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Syed is very hopeful that her husbands business will be expanded further after buying necessary tools with the loan. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Syed.

loan.use: To buy electrical repair tools

loan.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Perveen knows the importance of education, so thats why she has enrolled all of her children in a school so they get an education and make their future bright.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband who runs an electrician business and is the only breadwinner in the family. He offers his services, which include electricity repair, electricity installation, wiring, etc., at reasonable rates. With the loan, he will buy advanced repair tools.
Perveen is hopeful that, through the loan investment, her husband will be able to get more profits from his business by improving the quality of his services with advanced tools.
She is regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she established a good credit record by paying the installments on time. She lives in Okara, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agricultural industry.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loan.use: To buy advanced repair tools for electrician business

loan.name: Mary Kondua Ajoa

texts.en:
Mary Kondua Ajoa M. prepares porridge at Elmina. She serves it with sugar, milk, and bread. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a cashier. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.
Her loan will be used to acquire extra bags of maize to be able to produce in a larger quantity for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.
The mortar and pestle in the photo are what she uses to pound the maize before sending it to the mill.

loan.use: acquire extra bags of maize

loan.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells 'gari' (quick-cooking cassava grits) in small and large quantity at Elmina. She is divorced and has five dependents. She has been selling 'gari' for seven years. She is responsible for the upkeep of her dependents.
Demand for her goods is increasing, and she is requesting the loan to buy additional bags of 'gari' for sale and distribution to her customers. She anticipates using the new profit from her business to buy a plot of land.
Aba is pouring out some of the 'gari' into a bowl.

loan.use: buy additional bags of 'gari' for sale

loan.name: Florence Eshun Araba

texts.en:
Florence Eshun Araba A. prepares 'banku' (fermented corn dough) and sells it, together with fried fish and pepper sauce, at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a secretary. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.
Her loan will serve as working capital to buy more bags of maize to cook 'banku' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a cafeteria.

loan.use: to use as increased capital to buy more bags of maize

loan.name: Noureen's Group

texts.en:
Noureen comes from Jaranwala, a city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains 3 rooms and is made of bricks. She has been living there with her family for the past 20 years. She is 40 years old, an active lady, and spends her time at home doing her household tasks. She is married to M. K. who has a business selling jewelry. He operates his shop in the market and sells costume jewelry to his customers.
Noureen is the mother of four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is an embroidery expert while the 2nd one sells fish. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy jewelry such as rings, necklaces, and ear-rings for his business and improve his sales.
Marriage season is near and Noureen is hopeful that timely investment will bring more profit for her husband and improve the financial condition of his business.
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loan.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale

loan.name: Nyame Na

texts.en: Nyame Na O. cooks rice and other foods for sale at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Nyame has been cooking for sale for ten years. She assists her husband in paying for the education of her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

loan.use: to buy food items to cook

loan.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells kids' wear, underwear and other items by moving from one locality to another at Elmina. She is divorced and takes care of four children. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.
She has around her neck some underwear and, balanced on her head in a basin, other items she sells.

loan.use: add to her working capital to expand her business

loan.name: Efua Mansah

texts.en: Efua Mansah K. cooks banku (fermented maize porridge) for sale at Elmina. She is a widow taking care of six dependents. Efua has been cooking 'banku' and 'Fante kenkey' for sale for four years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'banku' and 'Fante kenkey' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loan.use: to buy more maize to prepare 'banku' and 'Fante kenkey' for sale.

loan.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a very good wife and mother. She manages her responsibilities very well. She is 57 years old, but still very active. She has a marriage bureau and helps people find their life partners. She is a resident of Jaranwala which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area of Razabad with her family in a 3-room brick house.
She is a widow and lives with her three sons who are young men and do different kind of work. Her eldest son has a tea stall, the 2nd one sells sweetmeats, and the youngest one weaves carpets. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who wants to improve his tea business. With the loan, he will buy sugar, milk, and tea in bulk quantity for his tea stall business.
He has been operating this business for the past 3 years and became well-known among his customers for the good taste of his tea. Nazeeran is hopeful that an investment will bring his business to more profitable position and earn him better profit.
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and she is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her and she will be able to marry off her eldest son soon with the increased loan profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazeeran.

loan.use: To buy sugar, milk and tea for tea stall

loan.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame Z. sells bread and porridge by moving from one area to another at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Maame has been selling porridge for seven years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and other ingredients to prepare the porridge for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.
In the pan, she has some baked bread. The cups balanced on the pan are used to serve her customers.

loan.use: buy more maize and other ingredients

loan.name: Falak's Group

texts.en:
Falak is a resident of Jaranwala which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Razabad with her family in a 3-room brick house for the past 10 years. She is 44 years old and married to M. A. who works in a factory for a reasonable income.
She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a 'pan' (betel leaf) and cigarette shop in the market and the 2nd one works in a marble-making factory. Her remaining children are studying in different classes. Falak herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household chores.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her sons cigarette and pan (betel leaf) selling shop. With the loan he will buy betel leaves and betel nuts and cigarettes of different brands which will help him make more sales and earn better profit. Falak hopes that her son who has been operating this business for more than a year will get more success in his business after investing the loan proceeds into it.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a booklet (called Asasah Passbook) is Falak.

loan.use: To buy betel leaves, betel nuts and cigarettes

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is divorced and has three children. She sells fruits and plantain at Elmina, which she has been doing for twenty years. Mary uses her income to see to the well being of her family. Mary will use the loan to purchase more fruits for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest back into her business.

loan.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more fruits for sale.

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells cloth, provisions, cassava, plantain and other items in Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Esi has been in this business for ten years. She helps her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her income to increase the sale of foodstuffs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loan.use: To increase the sale of foodstuffs

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua T. sells cassava, plantain and smoked fish in Elmina. She is married and has eight dependants. Her husband is a bar operator. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to reinvest her increased capital.

loan.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loan.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. W. is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer.
For 20 years, Ama has been smoking fish for sale at Elmina. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.
She is asking for the loan to buy an extra quantity of fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to buy land.

loan.use: To buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loan.name: Nana Ama

texts.en:
Nana Ama A. is married and has four children. Her husband sells drinks.
She operates a food stall at Elmina. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.
Nana's loan will be used to buy extra food items to expand her cooking business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loan.use: To buy extra food items to expand her cooking business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: House repairs and improvement

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: House construction and improvements

loan.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has been living in a city called Jaranwala for many years with her family in a two-room brick house. Jaranwala is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry.
Bushra sews clothes on an electric machine. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month.
Besides her job, she gives full time to her household work and manages it well. She has given birth to four children. Her elder son is a clerk in an office, and the second is a driver by profession. Her elder daughter helps her in her sewing business. Her younger daughter is 14 years old and stays at home.
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new electric sewing machine because her old machine has become rough and needs an immediate replacement. By purchasing a new machine, she will be able to meet her customers' demands and complete orders on time.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loan.use: To buy a new electric sewing machine for her sewing business

loan.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to Jaranwala, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for 14 years. She has given birth to four daughters and a son. All of them are very young and stay at home. Razia is not in a position to enroll them in school due to financial constraints.
Her husbands name is M. S. and he operates a vegetable selling business.
To financially assist her husband, Razia weaves carpets on order. She is very good at her art and her carpets sell for a very good price. She also sells clothes to her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family. Besides doing her businesses, she also manages her household work very well.
