Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes from the city of Lahore in bulk to minimize the cost of traveling and to increase her profits by offering more variety to her clients.
She has been operating this business for the past five years and is very confident about its growth as a result of a loan investment.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loan.use: To buy clothes for selling

loan.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina belongs to Jaranwala, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for 15 years.
To financially assist her husband, she weaves carpets. She receives orders from different carpet sellers and earns a good profit after completing them. She has just started doing this business but she is getting a good reputation among her clients due to her quality of work.
Besides her work, she also manages the household work efficiently and takes care of her family. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Three of them are getting their education while the youngest one is only 4 years old.
Her husband operates a business of selling motorbike spare parts. His shop is located in the market where he fulfills the requirements of his customers to earn a good profit.
Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy motorbikes spare parts to put into his shop for selling.
He has been doing this business for 10 years and Samina is confident that, through the loan investment, her husband will be able to make more sales and will generate more income.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and has a good credit record.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Samina.

loan.use: To buy motorbike spare parts for selling

loan.name: El Zapote Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Zapote esta ubicado en la Aldea El Zapote, de ahi se deriva el nombre del grupo, lo integran 4 mujeres, las cuales se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
doa Maricela de Jesus G. se dedica a la venta de carteras y mochilas en varios lugares cercanos a su comunidad, es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales tiene una hija de 18 dias de nacida. juntos con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante la familia, sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de carteras y mochilas.
doa Ana V. es una mujer trabajadora y muy dedicada a su negocio y a su familia, Ana se dedica a a venta de gallinas, actividad que realiza desde hace varios aos, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la maana para alimentarlas y sacarles los huevos. junto con su su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante con su familia, ademas cuentan con la ayuda de sus hijos, los cuales ya estan adultos y les ayudan con los gastos de la casa. sus tiempos libres lo dedican a la iglesia. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas gallinas y concentrado.
doa Felipa L. se dedica tambien a la venta y cria de gallinas, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos. su tiempo libre lo dedica a visitar la iglesia y cuidar de sus hijos.
doa Gloria O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequea pulperia desde hace 8 aos la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion. Gloria es madre de 3 hijos los cuales y los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y trabajan duro para sacar adelante su pequea familia, sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar a sus familiares. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
The El Zapote group is located in La Aldea El Zapote, which is where the group name comes from. The group is made up of 4 women, who are very hard-working. The following is a description of their different businesses:
Maricela de Jesus G. sells wallets and backpacks in various areas near to her community. She is a mother of 4 children, one of whom is a daughter born just 18 days ago. She and her husband work hard to get their family ahead. In their free time, they go to church. She will use this loan for the purchase of wallets and backpacks.
Ana V. is a hard-working woman who is very dedicated to her business and her family. Ana has sold hens for several years. She gets up every day at 5:00 am to feed them and collect the eggs. She and her husband work hard to get their family ahead. Their children, who are adults, help them with the household costs. They dedicate their free time to their church. She will use this loan to purchase more hens and concentrated food.
Felipa L. also sells and raises hens. She is a single mother and has 4 children. She dedicates her free time to visiting her church and taking care of her children.
Gloria O. sells consumer products. She has had a small grocery store in her home for 8 years. She is a mother of three children who are attending the community school. Her husband helps her and they work hard to get their little family ahead. They dedicate their free time to visiting family. She will use this loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

loan.use: the purchase of wallets, backpacks, hens, beans, milk, rice, sugar, bread, cereal, butter, oil, salt, toilet paper, concentrated food for hens, batteries, matches, candles.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is involved in a mirror-decoration business. He is a talented man in his field. He decorates mirrors and makes them more precious and attractive for the clients. He uses different decoration material, like glitter, colorful paints, etc., on mirrors.
With the loan, he will buy mirrors and decoration material, like glitter and paints, to make more decorative mirrors for selling to earn the maximum profits. He has been doing this work for past five years.
Bushra herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household chores. She is a very good administrator and manages her household expenses very well. In her spare time, she also helps her husband in decorating the mirrors.
She has given birth to seven children. All of them are young and stay at home. Bushra is unable to send them to school due to poor financial conditions. She lives in a combined family system; her brother-in-law also lives with her and he is a driver by profession while her father-in-law weaves carpets.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
She is hopeful that an investment will bring good changes to her husbands business and increase his monthly profits.
Bushra lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Anwerabad with her family in a two-room brick house.

loan.use: To buy mirrors and decoration material for a mirror-decoration business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: for home improvement

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: housing construction

loan.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: el sr. Jose Luis N. es un hombre trabajdor y muy dedicado a su trabajo. Jose se dedica a la venta de materiales electricos y tambien da el servicio de instalacion de los mismos, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de maana para hacer sus trabajos en varios lugares cercanos a su comunidad. Jose es divorciado y no tiene hijos, vive con una tia. sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a su demas familia. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales electricos. Jose hace varias instalaciones de luz electrica en diferetes casas y negocios.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Luis Nunez is a working man and very dedicated to his job. Jose works selling electrical materials and also provides installation service. Every day he gets up at 5 in the morning to do his work in various places around his community. Jose performs installations of electric light in various houses and businesses.
Jose is divorced and has no children. He lives with an aunt. He spends his free time visiting his family. The loan will be used to buy electrical materials.

loan.use: to buy electrical materials

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: housing construction

loan.name: Virginia De Jesus

texts.es: doa Virginia de Jesus A. tiene 59 aos de edad, vive en el Barrio el Centro del Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a su negocio que es una chiclera, tiene la ayuda economica de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos el hogar, juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante su hogar. Virginia es madre de 4 hijos, adultos y ya no dependen de ella economicamente. en sus sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar la iglesia y visitar la familia. el credito lo utilizaran para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir su chiclera. nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sus metas poco a poco se le han estado cumpliendo.
texts.en: Ms. Virginia de Jesus A. is 59 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Centro del Triunfo Cholucteca and works in her own business as a snack vender. She has the help of her husband to cover the household expenses. Together they are working hard to get ahead for their home and family. Virginia is the mother of 4 adult children who no longer depend on her financially. In her free time she visits church and family. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and to stock her snackbar. She commented to us that she feels very happy that she is succeeding already in getting ahead for her children and that little by little she has been accomplishing her goals.

loan.use: to buy churros, candies, cookies, juices, soft drinks, bonbons and gum.

loan.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El seor Marcelo C. S. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeando el cargo de Gestor Colector desde hace 9 aos.
Es casado con 3 personas a su cargo, 3 de estas estn en edad escolar, el habita en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Managua.
Este es el primer crdito que tiene con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para compra de vehculo para poder ir a dejar a los nios a la escuela y desplazarse a su trabajo, ya que este est lejano de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcelo C. S. has worked in a water and waste management company as collection manager for 9 years.
He is married and has three dependents, all of which are of school age. He lives in the city of Managua in the municipality of Managua.
This is the first loan that he is taking with CEPRODEL. He is requesting it to buy a vehicle with which to drop off his kids at school and get to work, since it is far from his home.

loan.use: To buy a vehicle

loan.name: Aura Leticia

texts.es: doa Aura Leticia V. tiene 45 aos de edad, vive en el Triunfo choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion. Aura es una mujer emprendedora, se levanta a las 4 de la maana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y luego salir a venderlas, ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia. sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar la iglesia y a sus familiares. tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, lea, cal para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas.
texts.en:
Ms. Aura Leticia V. is 45 years old. She lives in Triunfo, Choluteca and makes and sells tortillas. Her business is in her home. Aura is an entrepreneurial woman; she gets up at 4am to make her delicious tortillas and later go out to sell them. She also has help from her husband who works hard to get the family ahead.
She spends her free time going to church and with her relatives. She also raises and sells chickens and pigs.
She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime to increase her production of tortillas.

loan.use: To buy corn, lime, firewood, water, matches

loan.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a widow; she lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her but she recovered her senses and started working at people's homes to survive financially.
Now all three of her sons do different work, so Munawar has stopped working. She now stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her two eldest sons are electricians by profession and have a workshop in the market, where they repair refrigerators and other electronic items. Her youngest son sells clothes. He makes bulk purchases from Multan and Faisalabad and sells in his local city. They all contribute to their family financially through their earnings.
Munawar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons, who want to improve their electronics-repair business. With the loan, they will purchase the latest repairing tools, which will help them do their business better and offer quality services to their clients.
They have been operating this business for the past six years and Munawar is confident that an investment will improve their business and increase their income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book called Asasah Passbook is Munawar.

loan.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for an electronics-repairing business

loan.name: Jose Celino

texts.es: don Jose Celino M. vive En el Barrio el Centro el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica al procesamiento y venta de semillas de maraon, este producto tiene demanda ya que es muy sabroso. Jose es padre de 6 hijos los cuales ya son adultos. junto con su esposa trabajan duro para cubrir sus gastos personales y los gastos del hogar. Jose todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la maana para salir a vender sus semillas en caserios cercanos. su tiempo libre se lo dedica a su esposa. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de maraon para luego procesarlas y venderlas, este tipo de producto al final del proceso quedan como cacahuates crujientes y saladitos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Celino M. lives in the center of Triunfo, Choluteca. He processes and sells cashews. There is demand for this product, since it is delicious. Jose is the father of 6 children, who are already adults. Together with his wife, they work hard to meet their personal and household expenses. Jose gets up at 5 every day to go out and sell his nuts in nearby villages.
He dedicates his free time to his wife.
He will use the loan to buy cashews, in order to later process and sell them. At the end of the process, the final product is like crunchy and salty peanuts.

loan.use: To buy cashews

loan.name: Carlos Jadith

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos Jadith F. C. vive junto a su esposa e hija. Vive en casa alquilada la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio de casablanca. El Sr. Carlos trabaja como obrero de campo en diferentes fundos de la zona hace varios aos. Su esposa tambien es obrera de campo. El Sr. Carlos solicita el crdito para la compra de un modulo de vivienda. Su sueo segn nos comenta es tener su propio terreno y poder construir su vivienda. El est muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trvez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos C. Carlos Jadith lives together with his wife and daughter. They live in a rental home located in the village of Casa Blanca. Carlos is an agricultural worker on various farms in the area. His wife is also an agricultural worker. Carlos is seeking the loan to buy a housing unit. He tells us that his dream is to have his own piece of land on which to construct his house. Carlos is very grateful for the support that we can provide him through this financing.

loan.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loan.name: Bilqis' Group

texts.en:
Bilqis lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Hussain Nagar with her family in a two-room brick house.
Bilqis is married to A. B., who runs a motor workshop in the market. He started this business 30 years ago and now it is working well for him.
She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her youngest son and daughter are studying while the others work with their father in his motor workshop business.
Bilqis herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy the latest repairing tools for his workshop to further improve his business.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called the Asasah passbook is Bilqis.

loan.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for a motor workshop

loan.name: Ada Petrona

texts.es: Ada es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera de dos hijos. Tiene su pequeo negocio de venta de leche agria, helados y bocadillos, iniciando por iniciativa propia para poder solventar sus gastos. Ya que se quedo sin trabajo, el cual laboraba como promotora venta. Hoy en da, necesita aumentar sus productos de ventas, lo que recurre al financiamiento para lograr el objetivo, el cual comprara ms leche para hacer leche agria, helados, variedad de bocadillos. Lo que espera aumentar los niveles de venta como la captacin de ms cliente, logrando poder cumplir con sus compromisos de pago como las necesidades personales.
texts.en: Ada is a hardworking woman, the single mother of two children. She has a small business selling buttermilk, ice cream, and sandwiches, which she started in order to cover her expenses now that she's lost her job as a product promoter. Now she needs to increase the amount of products she sells, so she's looking for a loan in order to meet this goal. She will use it to buy more milk for making buttermilk and ice cream, and a variety of sandwiches. She hopes to increase her sales in order to attract more customers, and so be able to make her loan payments as well as cover her own needs.

loan.use: Purchase milk to make buttermilk and ice cream, as well as more sandwiches, in hopes of increasing her sales

loan.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es: Alma es una mujer con su propio negocio, la venta de tortillas el cual trabaja desde hace varios aos en sus ventas. Siendo de pocos recursos ha logrado apoyar a su familia, su esposo labora en una cantera. Al iniciar con la venta de tortilla lo hizo con pocas libras de maz el cual no contaba con ms capital, tambin, tena que atraer la clientela. Luego comienza a palmear los tres tiempos, ya que contaba con ms productos siendo Afodenic, una puerta ah mejorar su inversin lo que aumento sus ventas, como sus ganancias, logrando mejor alimentacin para su familia como mantener el equilibrio de su venta de tortilla. Con este nuevo crdito comprara ochos sacos de maseca de 50 libras, lea y carbn y seguir con la venta de mayor produccin de tortillas.
texts.en: Alma is a mother with her own business, selling tortillas, which she has done for several years. Even though she has few resources she has been able to support her family. Her husband works in a quarry. When she started selling tortillas she made them with very little flour, as she did not have enough capital. She also had to attract customers. Later she started to roll them three times, since she had more products thanks to Afodenic. She has improved her sales and earnings and has been able to better feed her family and keep her sales stable. With this new loan she will purchase 50 pound bags of maseca corn flour, as well as firewood and coal, and keep selling more tortillas.

loan.use: to purchase quintales [a unit of measurement: 46 kg] of maseca corn flour, firewood and coal for making tortillas

loan.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Maravilla inicia su quinto ciclo con 14 socias. Victoria, tiene 33 aos, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos uno de 4 aos y el otro de 9 meses. Victoria, antes con su pareja tenia un recreo marisquera, pero se separaron, ella decidi abrir su propio recreo marisquera en su casa y le va bien poco a poco las persona comienzan a visitar su establecimiento, atiende de lunes a domingo los fines de semana son ms concurridos. Victoria solicita un prstamo que lo invertir en la compra de mesas, mensajera, esteras, etc, para implementar su establecimiento. Ella es socia de Finca desde hace un ao, le gusta porque le dieron la oportunidad de otorgarle un crdito cuando lo necesitaba, aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora. El sueo de victoria es que su negocio sea reconocido en Ayacucho y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: The Maravilla Communal Bank has 14 members and is starting its fifth loan cycle. Victoria is 33 years old. She is a single mother with a 4 year old and a 9 month old baby. Prior to their separation, she and her partner owned a seafood restaurant. She decided to open her own seafood restaurant at her home and its going well. Little by little, people are beginning to visit her establishment. She serves meals Monday through Sunday but the weekends are the most crowded. Victoria is requesting the loan to pay for tables, courier service, rugs, etc. to equip her establishment. She is pleased to have been a member of Finca for the past year because they provide her with the opportunity to obtain a loan when she needs it. She learns a lot from the training she receives from her sponsor. Victorias dream is that her business becomes recognized in Ayacucho and to educate her children.

loan.use: To pay for tables, courier service, and rugs

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 65 aos, vive en compaa D. su esposo en su casa propia. Hace ms D. 21 aos que tiene una tienda ubicada en su misma casa, en donD. comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azcar, fideos, leche, entre otros que son del consumo diario D. la gente. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadera aunque en algunas ocasiones sus proveedores van a su misma tienda para ofrecerle las promociones D. los productos. En todos estos largos aos ha visto que este negocio ha resultado estable en las ganancias y afirma que le agrada estar trabajando en su tienda porque le permite estar activa todo el da, es por esa razn que seguir trabajando por mas aos. Es su crdito nmero 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, lo invertir en la compra D. ms mercadera para su tienda y tambin en la compra D. sacos D. abono ya que sembrar maz.
texts.en: Maria is 65 and lives with her husband in their own home. She has had a store in her home for over 21 years, where she sells basic staples that people consume every day, such as: rice, sugar, pasta and milk, among others. Every week she stocks up on merchandise, and sometimes her suppliers come to her store to offer promotions. In all the time that she has had this business, it has generated a stable income and showed her that she does enjoy working in her store because it allows her to be active all day. For this reason, she will keep working for many more years. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always been responsible with her payments. She is happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and very united. She thanks those of you who will lend toward this loan, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her store, and also in the purchase of bags of fertilizer since she will sow corn.

loan.use: to purchase products to stock her business, and for bags of fertilizer for her corn crop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To build a home

loan.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El seor Luis Enrique L. G., es trabajador de una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado, desempeando el cargo de inspector de campo, tiene 1ao y medio de trabajar en esta empresa.
Es casado, con 3 personas a su cargo, uno de ellos en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el barrio Adolfo Reyes.
Este es su primer crdito en CEPRODEL lo solicita para compra de materiales de construccin tales como; piedra cantera y bloques.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique L. G. has worked as a site inspector for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past year and a half.
He is married with three children, one of whom is school aged. He lives in the suburb of Adolfo Reyes in the city of Managua.
This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He will use it to purchase building materials such as slate and cement blocks.

loan.use: Purchase of building materials

loan.name: Lster Antonio

texts.es:
El seor Lster Antonio S. V. trabaja como Guiriza en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 1 ao.
Es casado de 39 aos de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 39 aos.
Este es el primer crdito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para consumo y compra de materiales de construccin tales como: bloques y piedra cantera.
texts.en:
Lster Antonio S. V. has worked for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past year.
He is 39 years of age and married with three children. He has lived in the city of Managua in the Managua municipality all his life.
This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He will use it to buy consumer goods and building materials such as cement blocks and slate.

loan.use: To purchase consumer goods and building materials

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Building and home improvements

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Home improvements

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Home repairs

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of building materials and Avon products

loan.name: Hortencia

texts.es: La seora Hortencia A. esta agradecida por su cooperacin en el anterior crdito. Esta nuevamente solicitando otro prstamo para comprar ms mercanca de mercera. Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para l inversin es por eso que esta recurriendo a solicitar su cooperacin en este prstamo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y su familia puedan tener una vida mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Hortencia A. is grateful for your help by funding her previous loan.
She is now applying for another loan to purchase more haberdashery merchandise, as she does not have the capital she needs to invest in her business.
This business is the source of income for herself and her family, which allows them to live more peacefully.

loan.use: Investment in her own business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Home improvements

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To build a home

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Personal expenses

loan.name: Manuel

texts.es: El seor Manuel Vlez est muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibi en los prstamos anteriores. Su negocio ha crecido bastante y ha podido darles trabajo a dos personas ms. Est solicitando su colaboracin para invertir ahora en la compra y venta de aparatos. Su idea es seguir desarrollndose y con este nuevo propsito de comercializacin, no tiene duda que lo lograr. Corresponde a cada uno de ustedes que le brindarn su apoyo para este nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Manuel V. is very grateful to all of you for the support he has received with his previous loans. His business has grown considerably and he has been able to employ two more people.
He is requesting your help to invest now in the purchase and sale of equipment. His idea is to keep growing and with this new business proposition he has no doubt that he can accomplish that.
Manuel responds to every one of you that will give him support for this new project.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise for his business.

loan.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La seora Pastora V. E. trabaja como Conserje en un Recinto Universitario, desde hace 12 aos
Es soltera de 53 aos de edad, no tiene persona que dependa de ella, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 13 aos.
Este es el crdito nmero 8 con CEPRODEL los que ha utilizado en su mayora para cubrir gastos mdicos de sus familiares y otros para su vivienda. Este en particular lo solicita para remodelar su casa ya que hay partes que necesitan cambio.
texts.en:
Pastora V. E. has been working as a janitor at a university campus for 12 years.
She is single, 53 years old and does not have any dependents. She has been living in the city of Managua in the municipality of Managua for 13 years.
This is her 8th loan with field partner CEPRODEL. She used the majority of the previous loans to cover medical expenses for family members and also for her home. She is requesting this loan to remodel her home because parts of it need change.

loan.use: Remodel her home.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Mara, de 52 aos, es separada de su esposo, y vive en su casa que es propia en compaa de sus dos hijos que son mayores. Hace muchos aos tena un bazar, negocio que le ayudaba en el sustento de su familia, pero los problemas conyugales que tena tuvo que hacerse cargo de la educacin superior de sus hijos; por tal razn su negocio no pudo auto sostenerse que fracaso. Hoy trabaja en casa ajena, realizando labores domesticas durante el da, sin embargo no le daba abasto as que emprendi un negocio adicional, que es la venta de productos de belleza. Desde entonces aprovecha la oportunidad de vender a sus amistades y familias los cosmticos que ms demanda tienen. Con estas ganancias viene afrontando y cubriendo la educacin de sus hijos adems de comprar los medicamentos para su madre anciana. En adelante piensa dejar de trabajar como domstica para retomar e reabrir su bazar, de esa manera lograr estabilizar su economa. Es el 11avo crdito con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea contar con posteriores ayudas para re iniciar su negocio anterior. De obtener el crdito solicitado, podr cubrir los gastos de operacin de su madre.
texts.en:
52 year-old Mara is separated from her husband and lives in her own home with her two grown-up children. Mara owned a store for many years and her business helped her to support her family but, owing to her marriage problems, she had to take sole responsibility for her children's higher education expenses. For this reason, her business could not sustain itself and failed.
Currently, Mara works in other peoples' homes, carrying out domestic tasks during the day. However, as this is not enough to support her family, she has taken on an additional business, selling beauty products. Mara has taken the opportunity to sell her most popular cosmetics to her friends and family members. She uses the profits from this business to cover the expenses of her children's education and to buy medication for her elderly mother.
In the future, Mara plans to stop working as a domestic employee and to re-open her store. In this way, she hopes to stabilize her finances.
This is Mara's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she would like to have access to loans in the future, to help her to re-start her previous business. Mara will use this loan to cover the expenses of an operation for her mother.

loan.use: To cover her mother's operation expenses

loan.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, D. 38 aos, vive en casa D. sus suegros junto a su esposo, Pedro. Ambos tienen dos hijos adolescentes, quienes an estudian. Hace ms D. 4 aos est trabajadora madre D. familia, se dedica a L. venta D. gas, actividad que lo realiza en su mismo domicilio. DesD. entonces se dedica en L. distribucin D. los balones D. gas al domicilio D. sus clientes, quienes requieren del servicio. Por otro lado, trabaja en L. municipalidad D. su distrito D. esa manera se asegura un ingreso extra. Es as que sus hijos L. apoyan, cuando las veces que trabaja en L. municipalidad, ellos se dedican D. hacer el pedido D. gas, D. esa manera buscan mejorar su calidad D. vida. ElL. est muy contenta con su nuevo trabajo, pero a L. vez todas las tardes no descuida D. su negocio; Como es una mujer emprendedora en adelante anheL. ampliar su negocio y sobre todo comprarse una moto lineal para distribuir gas con mayor rapidez. Es el 11avo crdito con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas, pues como es lder D. su banco comunal, debe ser ejemplo, asimismo podr acceder a otros crditos fcilmente. D. obtener el crdito que solicita, podr incrementar ms balones D. gas, para as auto sostener su negocio.
texts.en: Marisol is 38 years old and lives in her in-laws' home with her husband Pedro. They have teen-aged children who are in school. For more than four years this hardworking family has been selling gas which they sell out of their home. Since then, they have engaged in the distribution of gas tanks to the homes of customers who require service. She also works in the municipality of her district which ensures that she will have extra income. When she is working for the municipality her children help with the gas orders thus they are searching for a better quality of life. She is very happy with her new job but at the same time she does not neglect her business in the evenings. Because she is an enterprising woman she hopes to expand her business in the future and above all to buy a motorbike so that she can more quickly distribute gas. This is her 11th loan with field partner MFP and she promises to be responsible with her payments because she is the leader of her community bank she has to set an example and so she can access other loans. With the loan she is requesting she will be able to increase her gas tanks so that her business can be self-sustaining.

loan.use: Purchase more gas tanks.

loan.name: Monica

texts.es: Mnica, de 41 aos, vive en su casa que es propia, en compaa de su esposo y su hijo. Ella es profesora de nivel primario, en un colegio particular, asimismo le gusta el negocio. Es as que hace ms de 7 aos vende calzados, actividad que hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien. Actualmente visita a sus amistades y familias a ofrecer lo nuevos modelos en zapatos, puesto que son adquiridos en provincias por lo que tiene que viajas cada fin de mes. Se siente muy satisfecha con el negocio que posee, ya que le es rentable, adems que la mercadera lo vende a crdito, as mantiene a sus clientes y largo plazo recupera lo invertido. Sin embargo le molesta tener que presionar a sus clientes para que terminen de pagar pasada la fecha establecida de pago. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un terreno y poder construir habitaciones, ya que ve el negocio de la renta de espacios es mucha ms rentable. Es el 12avo crdito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere acceder a posteriores ayudas para continuar progresando. De obtener el crdito que solicita, comprar zapatos para la temporada escolar que se avecina.
texts.en: Monica is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She is a primary school teacher at a public school. She has been selling shoes for more than seven years, a business that has so far gone very well. She currently visits her friends and families to offer new shoe models. She acquires the shoes in the provinces and has to travel there at the end of every month. She is very pleased with her business because it is profitable and because her merchandise is sold on credit and she is able to keep her customers and in the long run she recovers her investment. However, she does not like having to press her clients to finish paying after the date established for the payment. In the future, she plans to buy land to be able to build rooms because she sees that the business of renting rooms is very profitable. This is her 12th loan with field partner MFP and she promises to pay her dues on time because she wants to have access to future loans in order to further progress. With the loan she is requesting she will purchase shoes for the school season ahead.

loan.use: Purchase shoes for the school season.

loan.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noem tiene 35 aos, vive en su casa que es propia, en compaa de su esposo y sus 2 hijos pequeos que estudian en el colegio. Noem se dedica a coser blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones y buzos, es decir su especialidad es confeccionar uniformes y prendas deportivas para el colegio, mercadera que es ofrecida a sus amistades y profesores de los centros educativos que se encuentran cerca de su casa. De esta manera viene trabajando hace 6 aos en esta labor, con la ayuda de su cuada y hasta la de su esposo. Le gusta mucho la actividad que realiza, adems lo haced desde la comodidad de su casa. Por ahora su meta es construir el segundo nivel de su casa, para que pueda acondicionar su taller de costura con ms implementos. Es el 11avo crdito con MFP, es una socia responsable y siempre preocupada por el bienestar del grupo comunal. De obtener el crdito que solicita, comprar tela en diversos diseos y modelos para elaborar ms blusas, pantalones y faldas, ya que pronto se acerca la temporada escolar.
texts.en: Noemi is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two small children who are in school. Noemi makes blouses, shirts, skirts, pants and sweatshirts. Her specialty is making uniforms and sportswear for schools. She offers her merchandise to her friends and to teachers at schools near her home. She has been working this way for six years with the help of her sister-in-law and sometimes her husband. She likes her job and likes that she can do it from the comfort of her home. Currently her goal is to add a second level to her home so that she can set up her sewing workshop with more machines. This is the 11th loan that she has obtained from field partner MFP. She is a responsible member and she always worries about the welfare of the community group. With the loan she is requesting she will buy fabric in different designs so that she can make more blouses, pants and skirts since the school season is approaching.

loan.use: Purchase different types of fabric.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 30 aos, vive en casa D. sus suegros, en compaa D. su esposo y sus dos hijos Brayan y Adriana. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. productos D. limpieza, que inicialmente era D. su padre, quien al fallecer ella tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Actualmente su hermana Yolanda es quien esta al frente D. la venta D. estos productos, pues ella acaba D. dar a luz a su hija Adriana, solo espera el tiempo necesario para retomar el trabajo, aunque no deja D. continuar invirtiendo en la compra D. ms mercadera. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que desD. muy pequea apoyaba a su padre en las ventas, y considera que es un trabajo muy rentable, adems algunos productos D. limpieza como el jabn, detergentes, escoba, escobillas; no tiene fecha D. vencimiento, por lo que no se aflige D. su rpida venta. Lo que ms desea Rosa es ampliar su negocio con diversa mercadera. Es el onceavo crdito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que valora el beneficio D. este negocio en su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita desea incrementar con productos novedosos en limpieza para as tener que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 30 years old, lives in her in-laws' home with her husband and two children, Brayan and Adriana. She makes her living with a business selling cleaning products. The business was initially her father's, but when he passed away, Rosa had to take it take over. Because Rosa just gave birth to her daughter Adriana, her sister, Yolanda, is currently in charge of selling their products. Rosa is only taking the necessary leave before she takes up the business again. Even so, she hasn't stopped investing in the purchase of more merchandise. She likes what she does, especially since she helped her father with the sales even as young girl. She considers the work to be very profitable. In addition, some of the cleaning products, like soap, detergents, brooms and brushes, don't have expiration dates, so she doesn't need to worry about selling them quickly. What Rosa wants most is to expand her business with varied merchandise. This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments on time. She values the benefit of MFP in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to increase her merchandise with novel cleaning products to offer to her customers.

loan.use: To purchase novel cleaning products.

loan.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La seora Agueda M. C. es habitante de la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca, ella tiene la edad de 39 aos, solo estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria y esta casada con el seor Martn Luis Crespo C. con el cual tiene tres hijas las cuales se llaman Cintia de 19 aos de edad que asiste los fines de semana(sbado) a la escuela normal de la Zona Urbana a 15 minutos de su comunidad en donde estudia Licenciatura en pedagoga, Yarely de 16 aos que asiste al bachillerato y la mas pequea Karen que asiste a la secundaria de su comunidad.
Doa Agueda desde hace mas de tres aos inicio con su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo ella vende casa por casa lleva sus catlogos a sus clientes para que vean sus productos, levanta pedidos, los encarga con su proveedor y posteriormente lo entrega a sus clientes, ella nos dice que decidi iniciar su propio negocio ya que quera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas. Ella necesita este prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de Zapatos y catlogos, tambin nos comenta que ella espera seguir trabajando muy duro ya que en un futuro quiere tener un pequeo local en el centro de su comunidad para poner una zapateria.
Doa Agueda se encuentra agradecida con la Fundacin por la confianza que le esta brindando al otorgarle este prstamo y la oportunidad de que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Agueda M. C. lives in the community of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca. She is 39 years old, has only studied through sixth grade, and is married to Martn Lusi Crespo C.. Together they have three daughters. Cinta is 19 years old and goes to school on the weekends (Saturday) in a city 15 minutes from their community where she is studying to get her teaching license. Yarely is 16 years old and is working towards her bachelor's degree. The youngest, Karen, goes to high school in the community.
More than three years ago Agueda began her business selling shoes from a catalog. She sells house to house and brings her catalogs to her clients so they can see her products and look at orders. She places orders with her supplier and the brings them to her clients. She tells us that she decided to start this business because she wanted to help her husband pay for the household expenses and her daughters' education. She needs this loan to invest in buying shoes and catalogs. She also tells us that she wants to continue working very hard since in the future she wants to have a small location in the center of the community to put her shoe store.
Agueda is very thankful to the Foundation for the confidence it has in her by offering this loan and the opportunity for her business to prosper.

loan.use: To buy and sell shoes from a catalog.

loan.name: Miguel's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Miguel R. raises pigs for breeding. He is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Little Tadian. Miguel has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Miguel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Miguel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. Miguel is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Miguel R. Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

Nenita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Nenita is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Nenita H.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loan.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs. She is 50 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Caraniogan. Beatriz has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.
In 2007, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business.
Beatriz is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Beatriz A.'s Group".
About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Daisy's Group

texts.en:
Daisy R. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 44 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daisy R.'s Group.
Daisy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2008, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Glory has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Glory is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Glory from ASKI. About ASKI:

loan.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en: Florentina C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Macatal. Florentina has been in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Florentina is the leader of an eight member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Florentina C.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise

loan.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea N. has been in farming business for over ten years. She is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She has three children: all of them are single, and they are still living with her. Her husband is a casual construction worker and earns a profit of around US $2.50 a day. In addition to the farming business, Chea N. raise a few pigs behind her house for extra-profit. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chea N. and her family, she would like to request a loan to buy additional feed and small pigs to feed for selling.

loan.use: To buy additional feed and small pigs to feed for selling.

loan.name: Larryn Gramber

texts.es:
Larryn tiene 37 aos de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el casero La compuerta, una zona agrcola que pertenece al distrito de Oyotn, una zona de territorio accidentado que se encuentra situada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, por un lado posee un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar diversos granos y cereales, asimismo cuenta con un grupo de animales menores los cuales cra en su vivienda alimentndoles de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside.
Larryn ha sembrado actualmente un cultivo de maz en su parcela, el desea aplicarle pesticidas y abonos para poder brindarle mantenimiento y lograr asegurarse una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Larryn is 37 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the hamlet of La Compuerta, an agricultural zone that belongs to the district of Oyotn. It is an area with uneven, hilly land, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.
His work is all related to agriculture. On the one hand, he has a plot of farmland where he plants various grains and cereals. He also has a group of young animals that he raises in his home, feeding them natural grains and grasses. When they have fully developed he sells them to traders who pass through the zone where he lives.
Larryn has recently planted corn on his land and he would like to apply pesticides and fertilizers in order to care for his fields and to ensure that he has a good harvest. In order to do this, he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his crops

loan.name: Aita

texts.es:
Aita es una madre D. familia D. 58 aos D. edad y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el casero La Compuerta, una zona agrcola que pertenece al distrito D. Oyotn, una zona D. territorio accidentado que se encuentra situada a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.
Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura junto a su esposo, juntos poseen un terreno D. cultivo en donD. suelen sembrar granos y cereales, asimismo ella cuenta con un grupo D. animales menores los cuales cra en algunos corrales D. su vivienda alimentndoles D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los venD. a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD..
Aita desea adquirir pesticidas y abonos para poder brindarle mantenimiento al cultivo D. maz que tiene instalado actualmente, D. ese modo esperan asegurarse una buena cosecha. Asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales. Para lograr su objetivo ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito D. 1800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Aita is a 58 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of La Compuerta, an agricultural zone in the district of Oyotn. It is an area with uneven, hilly land, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.
She and her husband both work in agriculture. They own a plot of farmland together, where they plant grains and cereals. Aita also has a group of young animals that she raises in pens at her house. She feeds them natural grains and grasses, and once they have fully developed, she sells them to merchants who pass through the zone where they live.
Aita would like to buy pesticides and fertilizers to care for the corn fields that they currently have planted. She hopes this will ensure a good harvest. She would also like to acquire a balanced diet for her animals. In order to achieve her goals, she decided to request a loan of 1,800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn fields

loan.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en: Erlinda D.'s main source of income comes from tending a canteen near a school. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Banquero. Erlinda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Erlinda is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Erlinda D.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Roth

texts.en: Roth N. is a 48-year-old widowed woman who is a local farmer. She lives with her five children, three of whom are single and two of whom are married. She always weaves baskets for additional income besides that which she receives from farming. Roth N. is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. She and her children sometimes go through the village looking for bamboo, which they take home and soak in water for almost a week. After that, they dry it in the sunshine for three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces, and after that she and her children start making it into baskets. Recently, Roth N. has not been comfortable, because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loan.use: To repair her old house.

loan.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny tiene 26 aos de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseros que conforman el distrito de Monsef, una zona agrcola y comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
El cuenta con una pequea panadera instalada en su domicilio, all el prepara su masa y la hornea muy temprano por la maana. Los panes que produce los suele ofrecer en venta a sus vecinos y tambin los distribuye en los principales establecimientos de la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y a la calidad con la que prepara sus productos, su demanda ha empezado a aumentar considerablemente. Para lograr satisfacerla y aumentar sus ventas, Jhonny ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 26 years old, single, and lives with his family in one of the hamlets that comprises the district of Monsef. It is an agricultural and commercial zone located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He has a small bakery set up in his house, where he prepares his dough and does his baking very early in the morning. He offers the bread he makes to his neighbors and also distributes to the main establishments in the area where he lives. He uses the income he earns from this work to cover his expenses and to help his family get ahead.
Thanks to the length of time he has been baking and the quality of his products, his demand has started to grow considerably. In order to achieve his goals of satisfying the demand and increasing his sales, Jhonny has decided to request a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: to buy more ingredients for his bread bakery

loan.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents since 1979. She is now married and has eight kids, five of whom are single and three are married. Two of her children are working in different jobs, and they have a fixed salary every month. Her husband often works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is an annual process with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Presently, Touch S. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. This loan will provide her with additional new assets.

loan.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business.

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 54 aos D. edad, es casada, y resiD. junto a su esposo, hijos y una nieta en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito D. la provincia D. Piura, en la regin del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo D. frutas.
Se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales, a base D. plantas y vegetales en su propio domicilio. Ella por el conocimiento que posee sobre las bondades D. los productos D. la naturaleza tiene bastante clientela a quien orienta para la majora D. su salud. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economa diaria. Asimismo su esposo se dedica a la venta D. productos D. abarrotes en un puesto en el mercado D. su localidad.
Lucila siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea comprar ms plantas y vegetales para realizar mayor cantidad D. preparados medicinales. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old, married and lives with her spouse, children and granddaughter in the TambogranD. district, in the province and region of Piura. A region characterized by its inhabitants who mainly dedicate themselves to the cultivation of fruit.
From her home she sells natural products that are plant and vegetable based. Because of the knowledge that she possesses about the benefits of her natural products, she has a wiD. customer base who she can help to improve their health. The business allows her to help her family sustain their daily needs. Her husband sells groceries from a stall in a city market.
Lucila always strives to be able to keep her business going forward. These days she wishes to buy more plants and vegetables to have a larger quantity of herbal remedies. Because of this, she thinks it's advisable to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loan.use: The purchase of inputs to make herbal remedies.

loan.name: Son

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Son S., age 31, who lives in the province of Kompong Thom, which is the best territory for farming. Son S. is married and devoted to her one child, who depends on her care. Her husband earns an income by driving a horse cart around his community.
Son S. grows various crops on her farmland, which she acquired from her grandmother many years ago. She does well in the farming business almost every year. Son S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a plot of her neighbors farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming, and to add to her personal savings. She will use this land for farming.

loan.use: To buy a plot of her neighbors land for farming

loan.name: Jos

texts.es:
Jos tiene 49 aos de edad, es soltero, y reside en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la regin del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.
Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era joven, y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse una hectrea y media de terreno. En su terreno de cultivo suele sembrar limn. Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha las comercializa con las plantas procesadoras de la zona. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economa diaria.
Jos siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que coseche a futuro se desarrollen de mejor modo. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jos is 49-years-old. He's single and lives in the Tambogrande district of the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation.
Jos has worked in agriculture since he was young, and with a lot of hard work he was able to buy a hectare and a half of land. He usually plants lemons on his land. At harvest time he sells them with the plant processors in the area. The business allows him to help sustain his family on a day-to-day basis.
Jos always pushes himself to get his business ahead. Currently he wishes to use various fertilizers on his land in order to yield a better crop. For this he believed it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles ($550 USD) to help him achieve his goal.

loan.use: Purchase of various fertilizers

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 52 aos de edad, es casada, y tiene seis hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la regin del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.
Se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y aves de corral, en los lugares alrededor de su casa. Ella los engorda hasta que alcancen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado para venderlos posteriormente. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economa diaria.
Teresa siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente ella desea comprar mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52-years-old. She's married and has six children. She lives with her husband in the Tambogrande district in the province of Piura in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation.
Teresa raises goats and poultry in the area surrounding her house. She feeds and raises them until they're ready to be sold. This business allows her to help support her family in the daily expenses.
Teresa always pushes herself to get her family ahead. Currently she wants to buy a large quantity of balanced feed for her animals. For this purpose she has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to help her achieve her goal.

loan.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals

loan.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor M., age 57, is married to Yen, age 58. They have three children, all of whom are employed as garment workers. She and her husband have been earning a living for many years by cultivating rice crops. They have had experience in this sector since 1985. This family usually generates an income of approximately $5 each day to use for all the family expenses.
Sor M. says that her savings account is currently not sufficient to assist her daughter to have her wedding, which coming soon. To deal with this situation, Sor M. is seeking a loan to help her daughter hold her wedding ceremony.

loan.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding ceremony

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loan.name: Yolanda Maribel

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 27 aos de edad, es conviviente, y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la regin del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.
Yolanda se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catlogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras ms pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez ms clientes.
Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo aves de corral, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades apoya a su familia, con el sostenimiento de la economa de su familia. Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantenerse en estas actividades.
Yolanda desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and three children in Tambogrande district, in Piura province, in the region of the same name. This area is noted for the fact that its inhabitants are mainly fruit growers.
Yolanda's business is selling beauty products through a catalog. She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently. The more orders her customers make, the more points she earns from the company that provides the products and, hence, the more profits she makes. For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers. Yolanda also works selling poultry. She uses the income she makes from these business activities to support her family financially.
Yolanda works untiringly to keep going in her businesses. She would like to add to her stock of beauty products so that she can meet the demand she currently has. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: To increase her stock of beauty products

loan.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the village of Victoria. She is 42 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda C.'s Group.
Imelda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loan.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family.
She is married to M. M. who is 43 years old and is a daily wage labor.
Razia has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. She couldnt provide them education facilities due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to his clients. He contributes the family financially through the earning.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who also wants to buy a donkey cart and start loading business because his profession doesnt return with good income and in result his family suffers from financial aspect.
Razia is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to approach many clients and makes better profits from his new business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loan.use: To buy a donkey cart for starting a loading business

loan.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan lives in the city of Jaranwala, located in Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its agricultural industry. She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter, and all of them are young and getting their education. The family has lived in Jaranwala for 20 years.
Her husband works in a private organization and she supports him by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. Maqsoodan is skilled in her work and receives regular orders from her community members. She has been in this profession for four years and she has never received any complaints from her customers.
Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine. The old machine doesnt produce a completed dress in a timely manner, and the new machine will help her work more efficiently and make better profits. She is a regular borrower of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With the previous loan she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Maqsoodan.

loan.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loan.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in a small city called Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. She is a 49-year-old active lady. She spends her time at home taking care of her household responsibilities.
She is married to S. A. who makes and sells leather purses. He has contracts with different purse sellers and he provides them with the finished products to earn income for the family. He has a great talent which is admired by many of his clients and became the reason for getting more orders on a regular basis. Azra, besides her household work, also helps him in preparing the purses and in completing the orders on time.
She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy leather, zippers, etc. in larger quantities, which will help him to complete his orders on time and increase his clientele base. Azra is very hopeful that by investing money in her husbands business, he will successfully continue to get good results from his business.
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield
